loans.name: Mainifo

texts.en:
Mainifo T. is 20 and married with 2 children (ages 4 and 8).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Mainifo has 4 years of experience in this business.  Mainifo needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 120 tala or US $50 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Mainifo joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Mainifo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Mainifo T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Adalat Semeteeva`s Group

texts.en:
Adalat is 50 years old. She has been married for more than 25 years and has 3 sons. Her husband and elder 2 sons work at a construction company in Russia and regularly send money to their family. Her youngest son is a high school student. Adalat has a very rare business for women in Central Asia; she is a taxi driver. She usually provides transportation services to her neighbors, friends and relatives. It all began in 2008 when she used money sent to her from Russia to buy a second hand Mercedes for $4000. At the present time, she earns about $150 per month. Last year she changed her car and bought a Toyota for $5000 because it is more comfortable and economical. She will use this loan to buy a tire and do some minor car painting. In the future, Adalat plans to find a constant job; previously, she worked in the city’s educational department.  

Mairamkan, 40, is a mother of five children. She breeds livestock and also sells milk products. She is trying to provide her children with the best education possible. She is planning to buy one cow to increase milk production. 

Idris, 34, provides transportation services. He is married with 4 children. His wife sells rice and his two older children are students. This loan will be used to buy additional rice for his wife’s business in order to increase turnover. 

Kizdarkan is 48 years old. She is a widow with 5 children. Kizdarkan breeds livestock. Her children also take an active role in this business.  Now she has 2 cows and will use this loan to buy a milk cow.  More milk means a bigger income for her family. 


This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-P's concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy a tire and do some minor car painting

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Antonia tiene 50 años y  esta casada con el Sr. Carlos M. D. 52 años, cuentan con 4 hijos todos ellos trabajando actualmente.
 La familia se dedica actualmente a la venta en  D. ropas en su domicilio, actualmente cuenta con una buena cantidad D. clientes y la venta lo realiza saliendo a recorrer por los alrededores D. la ciudad.
Le gustaría  abrir en su domicilio un salón D. ventas D. ropas ya que le es incomodo recorrer, y por poseer varios clientes.
texts.en:
Antonia, age 50, is married to Carlos M., age 52. They have four children who are currently working. At present the family sells clothes. They have a good amount of customers, and they make sales by going to the outskirts of the city. She would like to open a place to sell clothes in her home because it is uncomfortable traveling to their various customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes like t-shirts, dresses, blouses, and others

loans.name: Abylkasymova Zamira`s Group

texts.en:
Zamira is a woman with a hard fate. Her husband died many years ago and, unfortunately, she doesn't have any children. She lives with her brother's family. She works in a local school where she is a teacher. On weekends, she deals with animal sales in the local market. This loan will be used to buy cattle to resell later. Now she has eight cattle as trade assets. 

Bermet is 55 years old. She is also a widow with four children. Her elder daughter studies at the university. She deals with vegetable sales in Nookat. She sells mainly potatoes. This loan will be used to buy a cow. Her sons will help their mother look after it and she will sell milk and milk products. 

Busara, 52, has two sons. Both of them are pupils. She is involved in livestock breeding. She will use this loan to buy cattle to feed. She started this business four years ago with one sheep. Now she has a few cattle. 

Gulay is 44 years old. She lives with her sister and nieces. She works in the local library. In her free time, she looks after her cattle. She will buy cattle with her loan. Her average income from her business is $100 US.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en:
Omolara, age 49, lives in Lagos, Nigeria. She is married and has one child. She sells drinks to make a living and has been managing this business for over 20 years. 

She wants to expand her business, which is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100, 000 to purchase drinks in larger quantities to sell. She hopes to have a car for her business in future so that she can supply drinks at wholesale to her customers at their individual places of business.

Omolara is very supportive of her husband in terms of providing food, clothing, and so on for the children. She intends to repay her loan by its due date. She expresses her gratitude to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Ange

texts.en:
Ange is 34 years old and is married with three children who are 2, 9 and 12 years old.

Ange struggles by owning a barber shop where she earns money for her daily living. This is her fifth year in this business, even though her earned profits are still too low to expand her business as she wishes.

Ange is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her barbershop by purchasing some additional equipment, mainly clippers, etc.. This, in turn, will help her to increase the number of her customers as well as her profits.

If successful, Ange will continue to provide all the best needs of her children as well as building a secure future for them.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for her barber shop

loans.name: Ndock

texts.fr: Ndock D. est une femme de 65 ans, elle est veuve sans enfant. Elle est depuis 5 ans membre du Banc Villageois de KEUR NGALGOU et y a reçu 10 fois de suite de crédit. Elle est vendeuse de bétail, son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter 10 moutons qu'elle engraisse pour revendre au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Ndock D. is a 65-year old woman, a widow without children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois of Keur Ngalgou for five years and has obtained ten successive loans. She is selling livestock; her new loan will allow her to purchase ten sheep for fattening before reselling at the local biweekly fairs. Her goal is to be able to support herself.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening her livestock business

loans.name: Aboubakal

texts.en:
Aboubakal is 35 years old and married with two children who are 3 and 6 years old.  Aboubakal is well known in the business of selling spare parts and this is his third successful year in the business.  Aboubakal works from 7 am to 8 pm every day.

Aboubakal needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that he can increase the size of his business by adding a larger quantity of different spare parts, mainly those used on cars of high level (Mercedes Benz). With this loan, Aboubakal hopes that his profits will increase to the extent the he is expecting, so as to create some sources of income as well as more jobs for people in his community.

loans.use: To purchase additional spare parts for sale

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, de 57 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a las tareas del campo, junto con su familia. Y en la actualidad trabaja activamente en estas labores, cultiva maca (raíz con propiedades curativas) y papa (tubérculo peruano), además cría diversos animales, pero sobretodo la alpaca, pues es la adecuada para el tipo de clima  de la comunidad donde vive. Diariamente lleva a pastear a sus alpacas en las amplias planicies de su tierra natal, luego comercializa la lana que trasquila de sus animales, y obtiene regulares ganancias; en ocasiones también vende su carne. Las cosechas de sus productos también los comercializa, sobre todo la maca que le trae mayores ganancias. Para el futuro tiene planes de aumentar la  cantidad de sus animales y también desea sembrar en mayor cantidad.Es la quinta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete será muy responsable con sus pagos, además agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Antonio invertirá el dinero solicitado en  pagar  a ayudantes   para sus cosechas, y también comprará medicinas que necesita para sus alpacas.
texts.en:
Antonio is 57 years old, and lives with his wife and three children in a house that he owns. Ever since he was very young, he has worked in the fields with his family. Nowadays he grows maca (a root with curative properties) and papa (a Peruvian tuber). He also raises various animals, above all alpacas which are the best suited to the climate where he lives. Every day he takes his alpacas to graze in the ample plains of his homeland, and he regularly shears and sells their wool for profit. Sometimes he also sells their meat. He also sells the harvests from his crop, from which the maca is the most profitable. His plans for the future include increasing both the number of animals he raises, and the number of plants that he sows. This is Antonio's fifth loan with MFP, and he promises to be very responsible with his payments. He also wishes to thank everyone who has made possible this loan, which will be very useful for the further progress of his business. Antonio will use the requested money to pay farmhands to help in his fields, and to buy medicines for his alpacas.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medicine for his alpacas and pay farmhands.

loans.name: Tita

texts.es: Tita tiene 50 años, vive en casa propia, en compañía de su pareja y su hija Selene de 8 años. Hace más de un año que empezó a vender productos de belleza, ya que una vecina le incentivo en la venta por estar en este trabajo. Con el tiempo ha logrado a ganar experiencia, ahora le es rentable el negocio, pues parte de su éxito se debe en el buen trato hacia sus clientes, también conoce los productos que ofrece y eso le da mucha confianza a la clientela. En un futuro ha pensado seguir en este rubro hasta convertirse en líder y así acceder a las ventajas de este negocio, ya que sus ingresos aumentarían al mismo tiempo su experiencia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para así tenerlo en stock.
texts.en:
Tita is 50 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and eight year old daughter Selene. A year and a half ago, she began selling beauty products after a neighbor convinced her to start this business. Over time, she gained experience and now has a profitable business. Part of her success is attributed to the good service she provides to her customers. She is also knowledgeable about the products she offers and demonstrates great confidence with her customers. In the future, she hopes to remain in this field until she becomes a leader and has access to the advantages that come with the business. She will continue to gain more experience as her income increase.

This is her first loan with MFP. Tita promises to be prompt with all of her payments. The loan she requested will be used to buy a larger quantity of beauty products so that she will have them in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of cosmetics

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita L. is from the village of Lalawan Dicayas. She is 42 years old, married and has one school-aged child.  To make a living, Rita owns and operates a business that provides repair services to community members.  Rita has been in business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Rita joined PMPC to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business. Rita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC.  Rita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP to buy electrical materials. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

--------------------------------------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Buy electrical materials.

loans.name: Isac

texts.es: Isac tiene una pequeña bodega hace 5 años que le permite cubrir los gastos en casa  pero como es un hombre emprendedor diariamente compra y vende pasteles en un mercado grande de Vitarte en donde de forma ambulante los vende. Sus 3 hijos que aun están en el colegio apoyan con este trabajo. A Isac le gustaría ver a sus 3 hijos con estudios profesionales y por eso trabaja día a día, Además tiene como objetivo tener su propia panadería. Isaac agradece los el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
For the last five years Isac has had a small shop which helps him meet his household expenses. But, since he is an entrepreneurial man, he also works every day as a street vendor buying and selling cakes in the main market of Vitarte. His three high school-aged children help him with this work. Isac would like to see his three children be educated as professionals and this is why he works hard every day. He also would like to own his own bakery. Isac is grateful for the support of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Exito Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Éxito lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, estordas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Araceli U. quien desde hace ocho años vende cosmético de diferentes marcas. Ella tiene dos hijos de 14 y 8 años por los cuales trabaja arduamente.
Las otras integrantes son Yolanda N. quien produce y comercializa tiste, pozol, pinolillo etc. y María Magdalena U. M. quien es costurera desde hace 20 años.
texts.en:
The El Éxito (Success) group is made up of three hard working, dedicated and enterprising people. One of them is Araceli U. who has sold various brands of cosmetics for the last 8 years. She has two children, who are 14 and 8 years of age, for whom she works hard. The other group members are: Yolanda N. who makes and sells tiste (drink made with tortilla, cacao and sugar), pozol (drink made with corn and cacao), pinolillo (cornmeal and cacao-based drink), etc. and María Magdalena U. M. who has been a seamstress for the last 20 years.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cosmetics.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria S. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 47 years old. Gloria is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She says she is thankful to have a source of income and hopes for her farm to grow more.

Gloria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Gloria from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve their living conditions. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna J. is from the town of Banga. She is 38 years old and married with three school-aged children. Rosanna is a farmer and helps her husband plant and harvest rice crops. She also plants fruit trees like "rambutan," a kind of lychee. She also makes food that she sells in the community. Like other mothers, she wants to see her children be professionals someday.

Rosanna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer. She will also buy ingredients for cooking. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosanna from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and ingredients for cooking the food she sells

loans.name: Ligia Aracely

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Tiene 55 años pero tiene muchas energías así es la señora Ligia, está casada hace 36 años y de esta linda relación tuvieron 5 hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, pero dos de ellos aún viven con ella en su casa.

Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa interior de todo tipo, además de camisetas deportivas, ella junto con su esposo atienden su local que tienen en su propia casa, trabajan desde las 8am hasta las 6pm, venden al por mayor a comerciantes de la zona a los cuales les deja a crédito y a buen precio. La mercadería las adquieren en Guayaquil ciudad a la que viajan una vez al mes y en otros casos solo hacen los pedidos y se los envían.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar más mercadería, ya que tiene muchos productos entregados y tiene muchos pedidos por entregar.

 Sus metas son seguir adelante y comprar un buen carro.
texts.en:
The community bank named May 3 meets every two weeks in the district of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. The location is known for its commerce, for its traditional feast days of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the generally happy population. Ligia is 55 years old but she is full of energy. She has been married for 36 years and from this beautiful marriage came 5 children. They are all grown but two are still living at home. She has a business selling undergarments of all kinds but she also sells t-shirts. She and her husband manage the store located in a section of their home. They work from 8am to 6pm. They sell in wholesale to retailers in the region. They complete their sales in credit and they always offer their merchandise at a good price. They purchase their merchandise in the city of Guayaquil where they travel once a month or more often if they receive special orders. This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise. She has filled many orders and she still has many orders outstanding. Her goal is to advance and to purchase a good car.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase undergarments and t-shirts.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is 33 years old and she is still single.  Antoinette is a successful entrepreneur who has owned a nursery school since 2005.  She is very proud of her business as it allows her to provide for the basic needs of her family.

Antoinette needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  Once given this loan, Antoinette will buy some equipment like chairs and renovate the classrooms.  If successful, Antoinette will start planning how to build some other rooms so that she can find her business being expanded.

loans.use: To buy some school equipment

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok O. is a 43-year-old married mother who currently lives in the best territory of Phnom Penh, the capital in Cambodia. 

Mrs. Sok O. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of crops on this land, such as cabbages, cucumbers, and morning glories, which she will sell to buyers every three months when the plants mature. 

Her husband is a fisherman and has been selling a few fresh fish in the local busy market for many years. Currently, the fishing is temporarily interrupted because the fishing tool is broken. Because of that, Mrs. Sok O. requested a loan in order to buy additional fishing equipment.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 29 year-old Mariatu. She is married and has 1 child, aged 3 months. In 1995, Mariatu established her business of selling plastic bowls, sets of pans, and food items. She began this business to generate more income to help her husband provide livelihood for their family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL every month. She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to buy more inventory.

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Mariatu plans to buy piece of land. She thanks you for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy assorted rubbers bowls, sets of pans, dishes, and palm oil.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria Luz es socia del Banco Comunal Tu Angel Lucy, tiene 41 años, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos (16-13-11-8). Maria Luz, se dedica a venta de polos y buzos para niños y adultos. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en comprar su mercadería, tiene demanda.
Maria Luz, antes se dedicaba a la venta de especería en forma ambulatoria, pero no se vendía a veces se malograba, decidió cambia por la venta de buzos y polos porque tiene bastante demanda sobre todo los fines de mes, sus compradores potenciales son del Programa Juntos.
Su sueño es abrir una tienda grande y ampliar más su mercadería, construir su casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
M.ía Luz, 41, is a member of the Tu Ángel Lucy (Your Angel Lucy) communal bank.  She has a live-in partner and four children (16, 13, 11 and 8 years old).  M.ía Luz sells children and adult t-shirts and sweatshirts.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise; she has demand.

M.ía Luz used to sell spices itinerantly but sometimes she didn’t sell and went through hard times.  She decided to change to the sale of t-shirts and sweatshirts because she has quite a bit of demand, especially at the end of the month.  Her potential buyers are from the Programa Juntos (Government funded assistance program for the extreme poor).

Her dream is to open a big store and expand her inventory, to build her own house and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy sweatshirts.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla a 27 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur de profession.  Elle est revendeuse de maïs et compte dans cette activité près de 12 ans déjà.  Elle est née à Tabligbo mais habite à akodessewa. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de Lomé pour se procurer plus de marchandises. Elle demande un prêt pour faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: Abla is 27 years old and married to a man who is a driver by profession. Abla sells maize and has been in this business for nearly 12 years. She was born in Tabligbo, but now she lives in Akodessewa. She purchases her supplies in the towns around Lomé, in order to get more goods. She is requesting this loan in order to better meet increasing demand.

loans.use: To purchase maize

loans.name: Harrison Sirikia

texts.en:
Harrison, 28 years old, has been farming in Naivasha since 2003.  He rotates between planting cabbage and wheat.

Harrison was introduced to KADET by a friend, and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) in good time.  He plans to plant wheat and buy fertilizer with the new loan.

In the future, Harrison hopes to buy his own farming equipment and save on having to rent equipment every time he wants to plant or harvest.

loans.use: To plant wheat and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Lodivina

texts.en:
Lodivina S. is from the village of San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Lodivina is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Lodivina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, instant noodles & snacks in the local community. Lodivina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lodivina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lodivina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Lodivina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lodivina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products, like beverages to sell

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es: Benedicta, de 58 años, es una valerosa madre soltera de 2 hijos, los cuales viven en diferentes lugares del país. Pero ella vive con su papa Honorato, de 83 años de edad, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Cochas. Hace algún tiempo está laboriosa mujer, se dedicaba a la venta de coca, donde comercializaba al por mayor, con la licencia correspondiente, del estado. Ahora ella regresó a Tarma, para poder cuidar a su papá que está delicado de salud; a quien ayuda en sus sembríos de papa, habas, arveja y maíz, los que cuida con mucho cuidado, porque sabe que de ello depende sus ganancias. En cada cosecha Benedicta, lleva a vender su producción a la capital. Pero el mayor pasatiempo de ella, es la crianza de sus 45 cabezas de reses y sus 50 cuyes, los cuales los alimenta para luego vender su carne al por mayor en el mercado central de Tarma. Ahora quiere sembrar en mayores cantidades y cuidar a su papá. Es el décimo crédito con MFP, y como secretaria de su banco comunal, se siente dichosa de poder pertenecer a una asociación antigua que trabaja para el éxito de sus integrantes. De obtener el crédito solicitado, podrá adquirir varios sacos de semilla de arveja, los cuales esparcirá en sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
58 year-old Benedicta is a courageous single mother.  She has two children who live in different parts of the country.  Benedicta lives with her dad, 83 year-old Honorato, in their own home which is located in the town of Cochas.

Some time ago, this hard-working woman used to sell coca leaf wholesale, with the corresponding state license.   Now she has returned to Tarma so that she can take care of her dad who is not in good health.  She helps him with his potato, bean, pea and corn crops, taking good care of them because she knows that their profits depend on it.  Each harvest season, Benedicta takes her crops to sell in the capital.  However, her biggest pastime is raising her 45 heads of cattle and 50 guinea pigs which she feeds so that she can then sell their meat wholesale in Tarma central market.  Benedicta would like to sow her crops in larger quantities and take care of her father.

This is Benedicta's tenth loan with MFP and, as secretary of her community bank, she feels lucky to be able to work for a long-standing association that works for the success of its members.  She will use her loan to acquire several sacks of pea seed which she will sow on her land.

loans.use: To buy sacks of pea seed

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem P. is a married woman who has always done housework as a daily routine. She is a good housewife and a good mother of six children. Her 
main activities include cooking  meals for all members the family as well as washing clothes, cleaning house, caring her kids, managing the property.

 Her husband is a fisherman, and earns a profit about $5 per day which is used to meet family expenses. This couple are blessed with six children, four of whom are single, and two are married. They have two children working  at the main factory and having a proper salary every month. Khem P. says that she has one child who wishes to go on and study at the university level but Khem P. has no cash to support him.  Khem P. would like to request a loan to be used to pay the school cost.

loans.use: To pay for school costs.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
Emiliano es soltero y tiene de 68 años de edad, reside junto familia en el caserío Santa Elena del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Emiliano se dedica  a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura. El cría ganado ovino y aves de corral en un espacio que tiene cerca a su domicilio. Él los alimenta con pastos naturales y, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes y vecinos de la zona en donde él reside, de esta manera solventa sus gastos económicos y ayuda a su madre.

El desea adquirir más animales para ampliar su negocio y comprar alimento balanceado que le permita venderlos a buen precio e incrementar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Emiliano es una persona bastante trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es poder mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Emiliano, 68, is single living with his family in Santa Elena in the Tambogrande farming area located in Piura region over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

Emiliano works in activities associated with farming.  He raises sheep and barnyard fowl in an area near his house.  He feeds them natural grasses and when they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants and neighbors in his area.  This way he meets his personal expenses and helps his mother.

He wants to acquire more animals to expand his business and to buy nutritionally balanced feed that will make it possible for him to sell them at a good price and increase his sales.  He has, therefore, deemed it advisable to request a 500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa that will help him reach his objective.

Emiliano is quite a hard working person.  His greatest wish is to improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy animals and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia L. is a married woman who lives in Brooke's Point, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a fish vending business.  Her husband Efifanio, who is 60 years old, works as a driver to earn his living.  They have seven children who are between 20 and 42 years old. Virginia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Virginia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500 to buy fresh fish so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Virginia L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of fresh fish

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with eight children, owning a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in farming for the last ten years starting with soy beans and diversifing to bananas, eggplants and maize plus rearing goats. His hardships are poor climatic changes, price fluctuations, and high transport costs. His vision is a well-established dairy farm and a well-educated family. Vincent intends to use the loan to buy seeds and for clearing land.

loans.use: Buying seeds and clearing land

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina S. is from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old. Angelina is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Angelina owns & operates a transportation services business. Angelina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Angelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Angelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from GDMPC. Angelina is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Angelina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support four children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she wants to save money by using the dried wood from her surroundings.

Jocelyn is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To buy an envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is a young father of one daughter and three sons. Sulaiman owns a taxi and drives it in Rafah refugee camp in the Gaza Strip. 

Sulaiman took out a loan from FATEN to have the car fixed and be able to work longer hours and transport passengers outside Rafah which will increase the profit and enhance the family's financial situation.

Sulaiman was photographed next to his car.

loans.use: to have his taxi fixed and be able to work longer hours.

loans.name: Adelio

texts.es:
Adelio, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y una hija de 8 años de edad, ellos residen en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, tiene 15 años de trabajar en la tierra, aprendió de su padre y está dedicado todos los días de la semana para atender lo que demande la agricultura de 6:00am a 4:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes ya que se dispone a iniciar la siembra de maíz y frijol, este préstamo le ayudara a tener listo los materiales que necesita y llevar a cabo dicha actividad.
Su objetivo es mantener su trabajo y ayudar a su familia y sobre todo a su hija en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Adelio is a farmer. He lives with his wife and eight year-old daughter in San Rafael Oriente, department of San Miguel. He has been working the land for 15 years, a skill he learned from his father. He works every day of the week from 6:00 AM to 4:00 PM, in order to meet the demands of farming.

He is requesting a loan to buy organic and inorganic fertilizers, as he is about to start planting corn and beans. This loan will help him to have the materials he needs on hand and to accomplish the aforementioned task. His goal is to keep working and to help his family, and above all, to support his daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela is a married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Fidela is 44 years old and has four children who are in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

Fidela has been in this business for ten years.  In the future, Fidela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa is 54 years of age and married with six children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. 

Epenesa needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 280 talas or $117 per week) to improve the business.

In 2011, Epenesa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Epenesa's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 50 years old and married.  She has five children, one of whom is in school.  Letecia works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks of groceries for her sari-sari store.

Letecia has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items, such as soft-drinks, soap, noodles and other groceries.   In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money to enable her to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of groceries for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Miguel Arcángel II”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos, todos independientes.  Estudió hasta cuarto de educación primaria.
Su préstamo anterior fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de golosinas y gaseosas.  Trabaja con el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace un año.
Con su  nuevo préstamo solicitado de  S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará diez jabas de gaseosas, cinco cajas de galletas, caramelos y chocolates, etc., cuenta que los vende de forma ambulatoria por el coliseo de Ilave.
Su sueño es tener más capital para abrir un restaurante. Y así mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the San Miguel Arcángel II Community Bank located in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 43 years old, widowed, and has four children who have left home. Juana attended primary school up to grade four.

A previous loan was for S/. 500 which she invested in her candy and soft drinks business. She has worked with Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. With the new loan of S/. 1000 that she is seeking, Juana will buy ten cases of soft drinks, five boxes of cookies, candy and chocolates etc. She sells these items in the streets near Ilave’s coliseum. 

Juana’s dream is to have enough money to open a restaurant and thereby increase her income.

She enjoys the simplicity of getting a loan through her community bank.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cookies, candy etc.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Vicenta works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Vicenta is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase materials to repair a fishing boat for her fishing/fish vending business.

Vicenta has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving money and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair a fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Yadigar

texts.en: Yadigar is 42 and married with 3 children. Yadigar runs a grocery store where he sells different kinds of goods such as confectioneries, candies, butter, beverages and other items. He has 10 years of experience in this field and his monthly income is about $300 USD. His store located in the central Imishli bazaar and is very popular among local people. He would like to increase the range of good he sells and for this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase more food products to sell

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia has been operating a boutique business for the last 13 years in Kenyatta market, Nairobi city.  She is 38 years old and married to Jones. They have four children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add to her stock of trousers, blouses, skirts and sweaters

In the future, Cornelia hopes to expand her business and open a boutique in Southern Sudan.

loans.use: To add to her stock of trousers, blouses, skirts and sweaters

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel de 66 años de edad, vive con su esposa en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pacora que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Angel desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, su corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos de casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles  para la compra de más animales como pavos y su respectivo alimento, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Angel es una persona que con esfuerzo y empeño a sabido salir adelante y brindarle algunas comodidades a su esposa.
texts.en:
66-year-old Angel lives with his wife in his own home which has water and electricity.  The house is located in the rural district of Pacora, in Lambayeque department.  The people in this area work in farming and livestock raising.

Angel has been raising and selling farmyard animals for some yeras.  His pens are located behind his home and they are suitable for the animals.  He feeds his animals balanced feed so that they reach an optimal level of development.  This means he is able to sell them in the different markets in his area and make good profits with which to cover his household expenses.

Angel has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals such as turkeys and feed.  He will use the profits that he makes from selling his animals to repay his loan and enjoy a better quality of life.  Angel is a person who, through hard work and determination, has known how to get ahead in life and provide his wife with some comforts in life.

loans.use: to buy more farmyard animals and their respective feed

loans.name: Ricardo Arturo

texts.es:
Ricardo Arturo tiene 31 años de edad, es casado vive con la esposa y con los tres hijos de tres, ocho,diesiceis años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

La V.R.C se llama 1º DE MAYO, se encuentra ubicada en la ciudadela primero de mayo, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas a 30 minutos de la oficia esta ventanilla se dedica a labores comerciales, agricultura, crianza de animales, negocios propios y empleos.
 
Ricardo Arturo  trabaja como guardia de seguridad en una institución publica, además se dedica al comercio de ropa. Las compras las realiza en Guayaquil y las Vende en Ventanas.

El crédito lo solicita para comprar ropa y artículos de bazar. El crédito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar los ingresos al momento de vender la mercadería. Enfrenta desafíos como la falta de dinero para invertir en el negocio. Su sueño es mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia y dar buena atención a los clientes.

Le gusta trabajar, salir con la familia, hacer deporte y ver televisión.
texts.en:
Ricardo Arturo is 31 years old, married, and has three children.  He lives with his wife and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The '1º de Mayo' community bank is located in Primero de Mayo community, in Ventanas canton, 30 minutes from our office.  The members of the bank work in commerce, farming, animal raising, their own businesses and jobs.

Ricardo Arturo works as a security guard in a public institution.  He also sells clothes.  He makes his purchases in Guayaquil and makes his sales in Ventanas.

Ricardo Arturo is requesting this loan to buy clothes and miscellaneous goods. The loan will help him to improve his income when he sells the merchandise. He faces challenges such as a lack of money to invest in his business.  His dream is to improve his family's life style and to provide his customers with a good service.

Ricardo Arturo enjoys working, going out with his family, taking part in sports and watching television - especially sports.

loans.use: to buy clothes and miscellaneous goods

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita works hard to support her family. Cristita is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Cristita requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fish to sell.

Cristita has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Cristita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Slyvere

texts.en:
Slyvere is 32 years old and is single. He sells charcoal in his market. He has been in this business for three years and works from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. everyday of the week.

Slyvere has requested a loan from Kiva through Vision Finance Company in order to support his business by purchasing of more sacks of charcoal to sell. With the profits, Slyvere will buy the food for his family and save money.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Tesai Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se inicio gracias a las Señoras Antonia y Marina quienes ya habían formado parte de otro comité en su barrio. Las mismas contactaron con sus vecinas y amigas para formar su propio comité en el Barrio. El comité se Denomina “TESAI” en homenaje a la pequeña fundación de salud de su Barrio. Las integrantes agradecen la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación  Paraguaya, ya que las mismas tendrán nuevas oportunidades para emprender un mejor trabajo, colaborando con los ingreso de su hogar y así brindarle a sus hijos un mejor bienestar. Actualmente el grupo está integrado por 22 mujeres, trabajando en el tercer ciclo.
La señora Antonia se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza, dice que tiene muchos clientes que siempre compra de ella. Tiene todo tipo de productos, los cuales gustan a sus clientes. Comenta que gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido mantener y ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de productos de limpieza, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener más variedad de productos.
texts.en:
This committee was started thanks to Antonia and Marina who had been members of another committee in their neighborhood.  The women contacted their friends and neighbors in order to set up their own committee in the neighborhood.  The committee is called 'Tesai' in honor of the small health foundation in their neighborhood.  The members of the committee are grateful for the opportunity that Fundación Paraguaya are giving them as they will have new opportunities to better carry out their work, contribute to their household income and thereby improve their children's well-being.

This group currently has 22 [female] members who are on their third loan cycle.  Antonia sells cleaning products.  She says that she has many customers who always buy from her.  She has all kinds of products which please her customers.  She says that, thanks to this work, she has been able to support and help her family.

Antonia is requesting this loan to buy cleaning products so that she can stock up and have a larger variety of products available.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products to sell

loans.name: Mirna Patricia

texts.es: A los 25 años de edad Mirna Patricia ha visto crecer su negocio y al mismo tiempo crecer a sus 2 hijos. Mirna es una mujer muy emprendedora y disfruta de obtener su medio de vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, pues anhela poderle dar educación a sus hijos menores, ya que quiere verlos salir adelante. el motivo del crédito es para la compra bananos, naranjas y mangos. Da gracias a Dios por permitirle acceder al crédito y mejorar las condiciones para realizar su actividad productiva.
texts.en:
At 25 years of age, Mirna Patricia has seen her both her business and her two children grow.  Mirna is a very enterprising woman who enjoys her means of earning a living.  She works selling fruit and vegetables.  She wants to provide her young children with an education, as she wants to see them move ahead in life.

The purpose for this loan is to purchase bananas, oranges and mangoes.  She gives thanks to God for allowing her to receive this loan and improve her work situation.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, oranges, and mangoes.

loans.name: Lourdesina

texts.en:
Lourdesina is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 8 children. 

Lourdesina has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell.

Lourdesina has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Lourdesina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is a 36-year-old married woman with 6 children. The oldest child is 18 years old and the youngest is 7 years old.

Cristy and her husband run a fishing business in Panglao, Bohol. Fishing is their main source of income. Cristy does her best to improve their business and sustain their family. She applied for a loan to purchase a fishing boat and nets. Cristy hopes for their business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat and nets.

loans.name: Las Cazuelitas Group

texts.es: Las nuevas integrantes del grupo son las señoras Leovigilda, Fresvinda, Maximina y Esperanza van a comprar con su prestamo materiales para elaborar alfareria van a comprar barro, greta por bulto y leña, la señora Esther va a comprar ropa de dama, caballero y niños, las otras integrantes siguen en su actividad que vienen desarrollando. La señora Esther tiene 43 años de edad, ella es casada su esposo no trabaja, ellos tienen 1 hijo varón pequeño esta en preescolar, ella vende ropa de dama, caballero y niños, ella solicito su préstamo para surtirse de ropa va a comprar faldas, blusas, vestidos de niña y ropa interior,  pantalones de dama, ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años por necesidad, ella vende en los tianguis de los pueblos, su negocio es importante porque de ahí gana para comer, ella se siente orgullosa de tener su propio negocio de convivir con sus clientes y atenderlos amablemente, las ganancias de negocio las utiliza para volver a invertir, ella quiere ampliar su negocio comprar mas mercancía para tener bien surtido su negocio, ella lo piensa lograr con el crédito y con las ganancias, sus sueños y esperanzas son ampliar su negocio, tener salud para trabajar y mejorar la calidad de vida para sus hijos. Las integrantes del grupo le quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos sus préstamos, gracias a su apoyo salimos adelante en los negocios y en las familias".
texts.en:
The new members of the group are Leovigilda, Fresvinda, Maximina and Esperanza. They are going to use their loan to buy materials for making pottery, such as clay, packages of glaze, and firewood.   

Esther is going to buy ladies', men's and children's clothing. The other members are continuing with the existing business activities.

Esther is 43, married, and has a little son who is in pre-school. Her husband isn't employed. She sells ladies', men's and children's clothing. She applied for her loan in order to stock up on clothing, such as skirts, blouses, children's dresses, underwear, and ladies' pants.

She started her business three years ago through necessity. She sells in local markets. Her business is important because that's how she earns her livelihood. She feels proud to have her own business, to live near her customers, and serve them with friendliness. 

She is re-investing her earnings in her business. She wants to expand it to buy more merchandise, in order to have a well-stocked store. She intends to achieve this with the loan and her earnings. 

Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business, to have the health to be able to work, and to improve her children's quality of life. 

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad, "We appreciate the loans, because thanks to your support, our businesses and our families are moving forward."

loans.use: To buy ladies' underwear, skirts, blouses, children's dresses, and ladies' pants.

location.town: Barrio San Pedro, Acteopan, Estado de Puebla

loans.name: Islomiddin

texts.ru: Исломидин более 7 лет занимается производством кирпичных блоков. Работниками являются двое членов семьи и имеет еще двоих работников. Его бизнес приносит ему стабильный доход. С прибыли он купил аппарат по производству  кирпичных блоков. Его бизнес расширяется, и он хочет нанять еще двоих работников. Он хотел бы получить займ для покупки цемента и гравий для производства кирпичных блоков.
texts.en: Islomiddin has been producing building bricks for the last seven years. Two members of his family work at the brick making plant and Islomiddin employs two more workers as well. This business has been yielding steady profits and Islomiddin was able to buy a new brick making machine. This purchase allowed him to increase production and he is hoping to hire two more workers for his plant. Islomiddin is requesting this loan to purchase cement and gravel to make more bricks.

loans.use: To buy cement and gravel

loans.name: Mon

texts.en: Mon, 54, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are ice vendors. Two of her children are employed at the garment factory. Currently, she has an old truck which carries ice to sell to the clients and now the truck is broken down. Mon is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to pay for her truck reparation. By doing so, she can easily carry ice to sell and go further to get more clients. In the future, she would like to build a new house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to pay for her truck repairs.

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
Luzvilla is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Luzvilla has a retail shop that sells clothing like t-shirts and printed blouses. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of clothes to sell.

Luzvilla is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Luzvilla hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Mrs. Srun is a 26-year-old mother of two who lives in the Prey Chor district. She is a local farmer who owns a few plots of farmland for growing rice crops two seasons of the year. She has a common-law relationship with her husband, aged 29, who is skilled in making and repairing iron tools. 

Srun would like to take out a loan to purchase iron to support her husband’s business. Her husband will use the iron to make tools and other items as needed by his customers. Srun hopes that her family’s business will improve so they can improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase iron to support her husband’s business.

loans.name: Sonia Dolores

texts.es:
Sonia, de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja de albañil y junto a él tienen tres hijos, una estudia y los otros dos trabajan. 

Sonia, vende pupusas, su madre le enseño como hacerlas y ella decidió iniciar con la venta de este productos típico de nuestro país, ella tiene muchos años de vender pupusas y por esa razón ya es muy conocida en la zona. 

Sonia, necesita el préstamo para comprar una plancha nueva para elaborar pupusas, porque la que tenia se la dono a su madre, quien también se dedica al mismo negocio.

Sonia, sueña con seguir trabajando en su negocio.

loans.use: para comprar una plancha nueva para elaborar pupusas.

loans.name: Nosa

texts.en: Mrs. Nosa O. is 39 years old, and is married with two children. She sells provisions to the community. She is from Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She needs the stated amount to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Itagia

texts.en: Itagia is a 49-year old, married woman with eight children.  She applied for her first loan of ST 800 (approximately USD 300) in order to start a taro farm.  This taro farm has allowed her family to cover their basic expenses and is now their major income source.  Itagia is convinced that she can do yet more to raise her family’s standard of living.  She is enthusiastic about the SPBD program given the results she has seen thus far from her hard work.  She is now seeking additional funds to buy some basic time-saving, yield-improving supplies to help her on the farm (e.g. a wheelbarrow and some fertilizer)

loans.use: Agricultural supplies

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.ru:
M., Mutabar is married and has 4 children. She started her business sewing kurpachi (traditional Tajik mattresses) at home. Currently, she sews in an atelier called “Navruz” that is located in the center of the city. Because she has been in this business for 15 years, Mutabar has many clients. Since 2000, she has been an active client of MLF “Microinvest”. She is asking for $1,100 to expand her business and increase profits.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Мансурова Мутабар замужем, имеет 4 детей. Начала свой бизнес шитьем национальной курпачи, принимала заказы на дом. На данный момент шьет в ателье «Навруз», расположенный в центре города. У нее много потенциальных клиентов. Как уже 15 лет занимается этим бизнесом. С 2000г. она является активной клиенткой МЗФ «Микроинвест». Она запрашивает 1011$ для расширения своего бизнеса, а также для получения максимальной прибыли.

loans.use:
For business expansion

расширения бизнеса

loans.name: Kin

texts.en: Mrs. Kin T. is a married woman of 57 years. Her two children are both enrolled school. She and her husband work as farmers growing rice crops and raising livestock. Together, they can typically earn $ 2 USD each day. This couple hopes to use the loan to increase their livestock with more ducks and chickens. The eggs will contribute to their additional profits.

loans.use: To increase her livestock with additional ducks.

loans.name: Tepora Tolumai

texts.en: Tepora is a married mother who is 28 years old. She has two children and her husband is unemployed. They used to live on their plantation, which Tepora's husband looked after. Through their hard work they have made small improvements for their family. They now own a taxi which really helps with transportation, and in helping to carry the taro from their village to sell in the market. This is Tepora's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To buy 5 liters of gromoxome chemicals, a back sprayer, and other equipment needed for her plantation.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru:
Sharif M., 36, is married and has 4 children. For 3 years, he has been selling clothing for children. His sales spot is located at the Vahdatsky region’s market. Sharif plans to use this loan to purchase new inventory of winter clothing. Sharif is one of the few vendors, who sell children’s clothing at the market, so to remain competitive; Sharif must sell at or below competitors’ prices. Sharif plans to repay the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Миров Шариф, возраст – 36 лет, образование среднее техническое, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Шариф занимается торговлей детских вещей уже в течение 3 лет. Свой бизнес он ведёт на рынке Вахдатского орайона где имеет торговую точку. На полученный кредит клиент планирует приобрести новый товар детской одежды для зимнего сезона, так как начинается пора холодов. На рынке где торгует клиент не так уж много торговых точек по продаже детской одежды. И чтобы быть конкурентноспособным Шариф хочет приобрести большое количество товара и реализовать его по цене ниже чем у других поставщиков, что даст ему возможность увеличить оборачиваемость своих товаров. а жители района смогут приобрести необходимые им детские вещи по ценам чуть ниже, чем у других. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales volume

loans.name: Faala

texts.en: Faala is a 46 year old married mother of five kids presently residing in Malie. She is a new member of Malie Borrowing Centre and would like a loan to support her 3 acre taro plantation.  She rarely asks her family living overseas for a financial support because she takes 2-3 bags of taro to the market twice a week and she earns more than $200-$300 WST ($80-120 USD) a month.  She would like a loan to buy fertilizers, weed killers, spades and other supplies for her plantation

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, weed killers, spades and other supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma belongs to the group, Cesar Vallejo, located in the Padre Abad 199 street, in the district of Calleria, in the state of Ucayali. She is 62 years old and has 6 kids, all of whom are adults. She also adopted a boy and she considers him as another son. She is married and her husband is retired. With the first loan of $300 that she received from Manuela Ramos, which she invested in clothes and selling beauty products.

Now she has a small workshop in her house where she makes clothes and sells beauty products. She gets up at 6am to make breakfast for her son and husband, and then she makes clothes.

With the loan of $1,700, which she will pay back over a period of 5 months, she will invest $200 in cotton, $200 in cloth, $200 in needles, elastic, buttons and clasps.

Norma is very happy and works with a lot of enthusiasm as she now has the economic suppor of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Norma pertenece al banco comunal Cesar Vallejo, ubicado en pasaje Padre Abad 199, distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años y es madre de 6 hijos, todos independientes, también adoptó a un niño y lo considera como si fuera un hijo más, es casada y su esposo está jubilado. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decidió invertir en la confección de ropa y comercialización de productos de belleza. En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño taller de confección de prendas de vestir y venta de productos de belleza instalado en su casa. Se levanta a las 6 a.m. para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y esposo y luego se dedica a la confección de sus prendas. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de S/. 200 en algodón, S/. 200 en telas, S/. 200 en agujas, cierres, blondas botones y elásticos. Norma se siente muy contenta, con más ánimos de trabajar porque ahora cuenta con un respaldo económico gracias al apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To buy material (cotton, cloth, needles) / Compra de materiales (algodón, telas, agujas, etc)

loans.name: Imad

texts.en: Imad lives with his wife and three children in south Lebanon, in the town of Saida. He is a 38 years old and paints furniture for a living. This is the second time Imad has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua. He plans to use this new loan to buy supplies for his workshop.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a furniture-painting business

loans.name: Gloria De Fatima

texts.pt:
Gloria da Fátima D. was born in Upper Mulocue district, in the province of Zambézia on May 7, 1955. She is currently in her 12th year at Joaquim Chissano Secondary School, in Boane, where she takes night classes.

Gloria had 5 brothers, but only 2 are alive today. She lived with her parents until the age of 15. She married in 1971 and had 3 children. Her oldest is 38 years old. In 1973 she separated from her first husband and in 1974 she re-married and had 5 more children.

Gloria left Mulocue 1966 to live in Maputo with her parents. In 1976 she worked as a teacher in Massagen in the province of Gaza for 2 years. She was forced to abandon teaching during the war because her life was at risk. From 1984 to 1990 she worked in Mahubu. Since then she has worked at the Primary School and teaches former soldiers in Boane.

Gloria had never applied to a credit institution until now. She got to know Hluvuku-Adsema through some co-workers. With her loan of 10,000.00 MT she intends to buy cement to finish the walls of her house, which has never been completed. Her future goal is to acquire further credit to improve her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Antigos Combatentes - Boane Nome: Gloria Da Fátima D. Actividade: Habitação Montante:10.000,00MT Aplicação: Compra de material de construção Inicio: 29/02/2008 Fim: 30/06/2009

Gloria Da Fátima D., Nasceu no distrito de alto Mulocue, Província da Zambézia aos 07/05/1955. Esta a estudar ate então, frequenta actualmente a 12ª classe na Escola Secundaria Joaquim Chissano de Boane no periodo nocturno.

Teve 5 irmãos, mas actualmente so estao vivos apenas 2, pois os outros 3 irmãos faleceram. Viveu soba responsabilidade dos pais ate aos 15 anos. Juntou se maritalmente em 1971 tendo gerado 3 filhos o mas velho tem actualmente 38 anos.

Em 1973 separou se do primeiro marido e de seguida juntou se em 1974 tendo gerado outros 5 filhos. Em 1966 saiu do Alto Mulocue para Maputo na casa dos pais.

Em 1976 Começou a trabalhar em Massagene na Província de Gaza como Professora durante 2 anos. Por causa da Guerra teve que abandonar o sector de serviço porque corria risco de vida.

De 1984 a 1990 trabalhou em Mahubu durante 06 anos. A partir dos meados de 1990 ate então encontra se a trabalhar na Escola Primaria e Completa Antigos Combatentes em Boane.

Nunca trabalhou com instituições de credito e pela 1ª vez que trabalha com instituições desse género . Conhece a HLUVUKU-ADSEMA graças aos colegas de trabalho. Com o emprestimo de 10.000,00MT pretende comprar cimento para rebocos das paredes da casa onde ela reside, mas que ainda nao estava terminada.

A perspectiva futura e ter outro credito para aplicar no melhoramento da sua residencia.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family home

loans.name: Joyce's Tumshukuru Mungu Group

texts.en:
Joyce is 40 years old and is a divorced woman with 6 children, ages 6 to 20 years old. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child, age 6 years old. Joyce owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 6 am to 9.30 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Stella, who has business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.fr: Born on 22 January 1986 in Lomé, Mrs. Rissikatou Y.

loans.use: To buy soap, milk, and a big container of cooking oil to sell individually at a higher profit margin.

loans.name: Yanapassiñani Group

texts.es:
This group is maD. up of 14 people who all live in the Collpani area. The name comes from the word Yanapasiñani which means “We will help each other” and was created by Victor who is chairman of the bank. The group is entering its third cycle; the previous two were completed without any problems or delays. The group is very supportive and anytime anyone within the group had trouble repaying the group covered their debt. The fourteen people are aware of the obligations they are committing to as well as those of the institution and above all know that the money is provided to them for investment in their respective businesses. They each have good expectations for growth. The types of businesses of the group’s members incluD. the sale of clothes, cosmetics and cell phones as well as several drivers.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

Grupo conformado por 14 personas todas viven por la zona D. Collpani. El nombre fue creado por el señor Víctor que es el Presidente del banco, por que la palabra Yanapasiñani significa “Nos ayudaremos”. El grupo entro a su tercer ciclo D. los cuales los dos anteriores trabajaron sin ninguna preocupación ni retraso alguno mas al contrario el grupo es muy solidario y D. la persona que una vez falló, el grupo cubrió su deuda. Las catorce personas están concientes respecto a la obligación que están adquiriendo, tienen conocimiento D. todas las obligaciones que tienen con la institución y sobre todo saben que el dinero que se les presta es para la inversión en sus negocios respectivos. Estas personas tienen buenas expectativas para el crecimiento D. cada uno D. los componentes del grupo.

Nombre D. los socios:

P. E. EULOGIA P. S. HILDA ROSA M. N. LUSMILA JIMENA M. M. VICTOR B. E. EDITH JESUSA M. D. T. VICTORIA C. COND. VICTOR HUGO B. D. Y. MERCEDES LIDIA A. D. A. ELENA G. M. YOVANA MIRIAM C. COND. WILDER RAMIRO VENTA D. CELULARES 5 C. D. M. MARIA VENTA D. ROPA 1 R. L. ESCOLASTICA VENTA D. COSMETICOS 2 T. B. VIDAL ZENON CHOFER 2

loans.use: Capital for Operations

loans.name: Modester K

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania!  Modester M., 28 is not married, and has no children.  In 2003, Modester established her tailoring business. Working six days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $190 every month from this business. Modester requires a loan in order to buy more material. She thanks you for your support.  

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed uncreditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from the client, extending a loan to then, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more material.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is 26 years old. She is married with 2 children. She also takes care of 2 other children aged 13 and 10 years old. She has been a maize seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Rebeca now hopes for a loan to buy more maize for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more maize for resale

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is 29 years old and she is single. She has been a "khanga" (traditional Tanzanian clothing) and basket seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 8:30am to 4:30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Asiya now hopes for a loan to buy more baskets and "khanga" for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more baskets and "khanga" for re-sale

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Sarni

texts.id:
Dengan kandang yang sederhana, Ni Nyoman Sarni dengan semangat membantu  suaminya dengan cara memelihara babi .Sarni bisa memberi tambahan untuk kebutuhan keluarga. Untuk mewujudkan hal itu, Ni Nyoman Sarni tergabung dalam program ternak babi dari Yayasan Dinari Modal Yang dimiliki sebanyak Rp.5.000.000,- dengan modal ini Ni Nyoman Sarni bisa mengembangkan usaha ternaknya. Modal Rp.1000.000,-digunakan untuk beli bibit sebanyak 2 ekor dan Rp. 3000.000,- untuk membeli pakan selama 6 bulan. Babi yang dipelihara ini akan dijual untuk babi guling.
Dalam 3 bulan bisa mendapat untung 1000.000,-karena dalam 3 bulan babi sudah bisa dijual. Keuntungan yang diperoleh digunakan untuk membiayai anak-anaknya sekolah dan sebagian untuk keperluan rumah tangganya.Ni Nyoman Sarni tidak sendiri dalam memelihara babinya. Dia dibantu  anaknya yang duduk dibangku SMA. Dengan semnagat Ni Nyoman Sarni menekuni usaha ini, karena sudah bisa dirasakan keuntungannya.
texts.en:
Sarni is helps her husband by rearing pigs, she participated in the pig farming program. From the Rp.5.000.000 capital, Sarni intends to use Rp.1000.000 to buy 2 piglets, and Rp. 3000.000 to buy pig feedings for 6 months. In 3 months time she will profit 1000.000 from selling the pigs. With this she intends to raise her children and support her family. Her children helps her in rearing the pigs as well. Sarni puts a lot of effort in doing this, because she knows she will be successful in this.
