texts.en: Nemarrau, 31-year-old married father of two, has been a farmer for the past six years.  This will be his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to buy farm inputs like manure, seedlings . With the profits generated, he plans to pay school fees for his children. An assiduous man who works with effort to attain more despite limited resources, Nemarrau dreams of being a prominent farmer.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, manure, seedlings.

loans.name: Kuña Marangatu Group

texts.es:
Este comité denominado Kuña Marangatu, surgió por contacto D. una D. las señoras con la fundación. Actualmente está integrado por 15 mujeres, el grupo se encuentra en el ciclo número 20 del programa, operan con la Fundación desD. el año 2006.
Alba, es una D. las miembros del comité, ella se dedica a la venta D. calzados D. todo tipo, este trabajo le permite salir adelante día a día y mantener a su familia y a los que D. ella dependen. Comenta que le va muy bien en el negocio por lo que le gustaría poder seguir con el. Ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora, luchadora y emprendedora.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. calzados, con lo cual podrá tener más variedad D. productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le dan
texts.en:
This communal bank, called Kuña Marangatu, came about through contact with one of the ladies of the Fundacion. Currently it consists of 15 women. It is in its 20th loan cycle with the program and they have worked with the Fundacion since 2006. 

Alba is one of the members of the group. She sells all types of footwear. This work allows her to get ahead on a daily basis and take care of her family and those that depend on her. She tells us that she is doing very well and so would like to continue running the business. She considers herself to be a very hardworking, enterprising and determined woman.

She is asking for the loan to buy footwear with which to have a wider variety of products to offer her customers. She is thankful to the Fundacion and Kiva for the opportunity given her.

loans.use: to buy footwear for later sale.

loans.name: Urginia

texts.es:
Urginia es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras Juli II” del, distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.  Cuenta con estudios superiores.

Desde hace dos años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra de bayetas (telas).

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevo soles, comprará 12 kilos de lana de diferentes colores, quince metros de bayeta y algunos materiales para construir su casa como yeso, cemento.  La artesanía la vende en Puno y Juli.
Ella cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, quien trabaja en una Institución de la zona.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las charlas y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Urginia is a member of the “Aymaras Juli II” communal bank in Juli District, Chucuito Province and Puno Department.  She’s 40 years old, married and has three children.  She completed higher education.

She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in the purchase of baize (fabric).

She will use this new, 1000 new sol, loan to buy 12 kilos of yarn in different colors and 15 meters of baize as well as some building materials and supplies like plaster and cement.  She sells her crafts in Puno and Juli.  Her husband, who works for a local institution, helps her out.  Her dream is that her children become professionals.  What she enjoys the most about her communal bank is the talks and the meetings.

loans.use: to buy twelve kilos of yarn in assorted colors and fifteen meters of baize.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien is 31 years old. She lives in Nguyet Cau village, Yen Phong Bac Ninh. She is married and she has one child who is going to school. 

She not only grows rice, but also she sells fast food. She has had this job for five years. She has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

She sometimes needs a loan to expand her business, so she has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This is the fifth time she borrows from SEDA. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy pork, chicken and spices to produce fast food.

loans.use: to buy pork, chicken and spices to produce fast food.

loans.name: Yokub

texts.ru: Ёкуб примерный семьянин, заботливый  отец пятерых детей. Жена домохозяйка. Вместе с детьми они ведут хозяйство по разведению крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. У них  своя ферма. На ферме работают все дети после занятий. Он старается  воспитать детей  трудолюбивыми. Он запрашивает займ для постройки дома и надеется в поддержке добрых людей. Он верит в то, что получит займ и заранее благодарен тем, кто предоставит его.
texts.en: Yokub is an exemplary family man and a caring father of five children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Together with the children, they run a business of breeding cattle and small livestock and have their own farm.  All of the children work on the farm after school.  Yokub tries to raise his children to be hardworking people.  He is requesting this loan to build a house and hopes to get the support of kind people.  He believes that he will get this loan and thanks those, who provide it, in advance.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa sigue participando en el banco comunal “Choquequirao” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Teresa sigue trabajando en la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo tejidos, chalinas, guantes, gorros, mantillas, mantas grandes, ponchos, chalecos y adorno en cerámica.

Teresa con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el negocio.

Teresa solicita el préstamo para invertir en la comprar mantas, estandartes, ropa para santos, chullos y entre otros. 
	
Teresa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Teresa continues participating in Asociación Arariwa's “Choquequirao” communal bank from the city of Cusco. Teresa continues selling craftwork like textiles, shawls, gloves, hats, baby clothes, large blankets, ponchos, cardigans and ceramic decorations.

The previous loan went very well for her, and she was able to make a good profit. This is why she wants another loan, because it helps her business a lot.

Teresa is asking for the loan to buy blankets, banners, clothing for saints' statues, woolen caps and other items.
	
Teresa is grateful for the opportunity given to her through this medium, and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase materials for clothes making

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is 64 years old and a widow with 9 children.

Basilisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more products for her sari-sari store. Basilisa has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Basilisa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is a housewife, and she stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very efficient woman and performs her duties very well. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and performs transportation services to his passengers, and also picks and drops off school children.

Azra has given birth to five sons and one daughter. None of them could get an education, due to financial constraints. Her eldest son is a rickshaw driver, while the others stay at home.

Azra has applied for a loan for her husband, who wants to repair his autorickshaw. By doing this, he will be able to provide better transport services to his passengers and increase his income. Azra has a lot of confidence in her husband and is very much sure that an investment will help him make his business more profitable, and her family will be able to live a better financial life in result.

Note: In the photo,"the woman holding a book (called "Asasah Passbook") is Azra.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw for a transportation business.

loans.name: Hurmatoy

texts.ru: Хурматой жительница района Кубадиён. Она добрая, отзывчивая и приятная женщина. Хурматой любит помогать людям и считает это своим призванием в жизни. Поэтому она пошла учиться на врача. Хурматой работает врачом в местной больнице. Ее работа очень ответственная, ведь на ее плечи возложена жизни людей. Хурматой много времени проводит на работе, но старается уделять больше внимания своей матери. Хурматой живет с мамой одни. В дом доход приносит только Хурматой. Она с мамой долго копили денег на ремонт, но так и не собрав достаточную сумму отложили ремонт. Зима пришла очень холодной и Хурматой и у мамы были трудности с сохранением тепла в доме. Хурматой как врач и дочь заботится о маме и не хочет, чтоб повторились снова жилищные трудности в зимний период. Она больше не собирается откладывать ремонт и обращается за кредитом.
texts.en:
Hurmatoy is a 29-year-old resident of the Qubadiyon region. She is a kind, sympathetic and pleasant young woman. Hurmatoy enjoys helping people and considers it her calling. That is why she studied to become a doctor. For four years already, she has been working as a doctor in a local hospital. Hurmatoy’s work is very important since she is responsible for people’s lives. 

Although she spends a lot of time at work, Hurmatoy still tries to devote enough time to care for her mother. Hurmatoy lives with her mother alone. The only source of income for the family comes from Hurmatoy’s work. Her mother and she had been saving money for renovations for a long time, but being unable to save enough, they postponed the work. Then winter came and it was very cold, forcing Hurmatoy and her mother to struggle to keep the house warm. As a doctor, Hurmatoy cares for her mother’s health and doesn’t want to face the same difficulty during the winter again. She is not going to postpone renovations any further, which is why she requested a loan.

loans.use: to renovate the house

loans.name: Grupo Yoxaja Group

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 40 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre  dieciséis y veintitrés años,  esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
María para obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la producción de café, esta humilde actividad lo realiza ella desde hace 20 años, ella también se dedica a la venta de banano por quintal. Ella tiene la necesidad de un préstamo por esa razón es la representante del grupo yoxaja 2, su crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas para el mantenimiento de café. Su gran sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Compra de insumos agrícolas para el mantenimiento de café.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence Restaurant, a 51 years old caterer from a historic area of Benin City, specializes in providing special food for people in her community. She plans to improve her business with a minimum loan of $500.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase computer accessories and hire two assistants for his computer repairs business

loans.name: Tohir

texts.en:
Inragimov Tohir, 46 years old, graduated from secondary school. He is married and has 5 children. He worked for a few years out of the country (in Russia), and 2 1/2 years ago he came back to his family and started his own small business. He has a wholesale trading point in Tijorat market of the Yavan district and sells footwear.

He is going to use the loan amount to increase his assortment of summer footwear. Since he is doing wholesale trading, the prices at his trading point are significantly lower than competitors are offering. It helps the poor population of the district, which does not have stable and good salaries to avail themselves of cheap footwear for summer time.

loans.use: Increase footwear assortment

loans.name: Ilda Simão

texts.pt:
Ilda Simao L. is 40 years old. She lives with her husband and 5 children in the neighborhood of Canico, in Maputo. She owns a small grocery shop in her home, where she sells food and drinks.

Ilda joined the Development Fund of Women Program in February 2006 and her first loan was of 5.000MT. She is on the 4th stage of the program. Ilda plans on borrowing 15.000MT to invest on her business. She plans on re-paying the loan in a 6 months period. Ilda's business has experienced memorable growth after she joined the program.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Ilda Simão L. tem 40 anos de Idade,vive maritalmente e é mãe de 5 filhos.Vive no bairro polna Caniço em Maputo. Uma pequena mercearia em casa onde vende diversos produtos alimentares e bebidas.

Entrou para o aprograma em Fevereiro de 2006 com um empréstimo inicial de 5.000 MT. Vai para o quarto ciclo de empréstimo e pretende tomar 15.000 Mt para pagar em 6 meses, o qual vai investir no negócio. Tem teve um crescimento assinalável do negócio depois que começou a tomar os empréstimos uma vez que todos os montantes são aplicados no mesmo.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Aniva

texts.en: A. is a 37 year old mother of two, who struggles to make ends meet financially.  This is mainly due to the fact that her husband doesn’t earn much as a bus driver.  However, Anivas' determination to satisfy her family needs drove her to start up her screen printing elei business. She borrowed from SPBD to purchase all materials needed to start up.  She sells to the locals and some tourists passing through her village of Safaatoa Uta.  This helps her to earn $120 a week after all expenses.  She is now able to help her husband with his weekly earnings of $120.

loans.use: For home improvement and for supplies for her elei screen printing business

loans.name: Francisca Franco

texts.en:
Francisca is a 24-year-old mother of two children and she dedicates herself, together with her husband, to the sales of fish. She has been running that business for more than one year.

Weekly, Francisca’s husband goes Santo Domingo, the capital, to buy the fish in a fish shop. In the house, they have a freezer to preserve the fish. Francisca sells the goods from home, while her husband sells in the streets. Actually, the entrepreneur buys a small amount of fish since she doesn’t have a very spacious freezer. She hopes she can get a used one before long.

The entrepreneur would like to add new products to her business. Her plan is to use her loan and buy many kinds of shellfish so that she can diversify her inventory and satisfy and attract more clients.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of shellfish to introduce to her fish selling business.

loans.name: María Immacula

texts.en:
Immacula is a 33-year-old woman that recently seperated from her husband.  She is bravely raising her two daughters by herself.   The children both attend her school.

Immacula is the manager of a school she founded three years ago for the children of her community.  Currently, more than 200 children go to her school.  As a visionary manager, Immacula plans to computerize the school in a few years.  She wants to install electronic blackboards, a computer room for the teachers as well as one for the pupils.

In the meantime, Imacula needs to resolve the school's present issues.  She is requesting funds to buy new chairs for the pupils and to repair some desks.  Immacula says that with God’s help and a lot of effort she will achieve her goals.

loans.use: To purchase new chairs and repair desks at a new school.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Mr. Ramon M.’ business is the sale of footwear. This has been his business for 21 years in the city of Leon in Nicaragua. It is a very popular business in this market because he sells all kind of shoes, of different colors and sizes. He sells both women and men shoes.

He is married and has three children, he works hard to provide for them and fulfill all their needs. He opens his business every day from very early in the morning and begins to work with the support of his wife and children. His goal is to extend his premises and offer greater amounts of shoes and the best styles, the best brands and in addition the best prices to get more costumers.

He has borrowed money from Ceprodel that he has used to buy greater amounts of footwear and to cover his family needs. His loan’s record is 10 loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de calzados es el negocio al que se dedica el señor Ramón M. desde hace 21 años en la ciudad de León en Nicaragua. Su negocio es muy común en el sector de calzados de este mercado debido a que oferta zapatos de todo tipo, todo color y todo tamaño para damas y para caballeros.

Es casado y con tres hijos a su responsabilidad por los que lucha fuertemente para mantenerlos y brindarle todas sus necesidades. Todos los días desde muy temprano en la mañana abre su negocio y comienza a trabajar con el apoyo de su esposa y de sus hijos. Su meta es ampliar su local y brindar mayores cantidades de zapatos con los mejores estilos, las mejores marcas y además los mejores precios para así ganar mas clientelas en su local.

Consiente de la necesidad de invertir ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel que los ha utilizado para la adquisición de mayores cantidades de calzados y para las necesidades de su hogar. Su record crediticio es de 10 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en: Ismail M. is a 51-year-old trader who keeps a small store where he sells men's clothes, shells and other items. He is married and has four children. Ismail is a repeat borrower from Aqroinvest; he borrowed two loans and successfully repaid them on time. Now Ismail is going to expand his business and diversify the number of products.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Mrs. Nelly C. P. is a member of the Community Bank "Los Eucaliptos". She lives in the San Martín region, in the province of San Martín and the district of Morales. Her business is located in her own home in the housing development Pueblo Joven "9 de Abril". She has been working for 20 years selling perfume and cosmetics of many brands including Esika, Avon and Unique. She sells her products on order and by catalog. Her most important clients are the workers in public and private institutions.

With this loan of 1200 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy a variety of articles such as perfumes, creams, shampoos, make-up, deoderant and other products of brands that offer discounted prices during this season of the year. With this purchase her business will be well-stocked with a wider range of products and she will be able to satisfy her clients.

She is 40 years old and lives with her husband and 2 sons. She dreams of seeing her sons grow into professionals. That dream motivates her to work every day with a lot of perseverance. She hopes to have a grocery business in the future.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nelly C. P., es socia del banco comunal “Los Eucaliptos” vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales , su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa del Pueblo Joven 9 de abril, se dedica hace 22 años a la venta de artículos de perfumería y cosméticos de diferentes marcas como Esika, Avon, Unique, que lo vende a través de pedidos y por catalogo,siendo sus principales clientes los trabajadores de instituciones públicas y privadas.

Con el crédito de S/. 1,200.00, el cual pagara en 4 meses, comprará diversos artículos como perfumes, cremas, champús, jabones, maquillajes, desodorante y otros productos mas, de estas marcas que salen en ofertas en esta temporada para tener en stock y variar sus productos para así satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes.

Tiene 40 años vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos a quienes desea verlos profesionales, razón por el que día a día trabaja con mucha perseverancia, anhelando mas adelante tener un negocio de venta de abarrotes.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy products for her business.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is 42 years old and is married woman with 5 children, ages 4-20 years old. Roda is a clothes seller, she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $130 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Lilieni

texts.en: Lilieni T., 19, is married with one child.  She has worked as a vegetable gardener for the last two years, and six days a week sells her produce to the public and the people of her village at the main market in town. She has taken out one previous loan from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $291.  SPBD loans are Lilieni’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from a traditional bank. Part of the loan will be used to expand her house, or for repairs. Her husband helps her operate her business on Friday and Saturday and works at the local gas station from Monday to Thursday.

loans.use: Purchase cucumber, cabbage, tomato and pumpkin seeds, along with beans and fertilizer.

loans.name: Enith

texts.es:
Enith is the only lady selling fruit in her community and therefore here clients’ demands are large and very satisfactory. Daily she spends hours of attention and joy with each and every housewife that visits her, and her wish to improve is centered on the development of her little ones. Your response and immediate support would contribute to make her dream come true as it is her wish to enlarge her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Enith, dentro de su zona es la única dama que comercializa frutas y debido a esta razón la demanda de sus clientes es amplia y muy satisfactoria. A diario dedica horas enteras de atención y alegría a cada una de las amas de casa que la visitan y su deseo de mejora se centra en el desarrollo de cada uno de sus pequeños. Vuestra respuesta y ayuda inmediata podrá contribuir con el cumplimiento D. deseo de ampliación de su negocio.

loans.use: Enlarge a small sales stand.

loans.name: Keang

texts.en:
Mrs. Keang S.,39, and her husband, Mr. Mengtich Ly, 49, who live in a small village about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh, married in 1990 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of them are in local school.

Mrs. Keang has been selling vegetables for two years. She buys them from Ta Khmao market for re-sale at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for fifteen years. His motorcycle scooter is very old and breaks down very often.

So, Keang is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one for her husband to drive as a motor taxi and to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for running a motor taxi and expand business of selling vegetables

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth M. is a married woman. She resides in the Temeke District in Dar es Salaam. She has a poultry business. She keeps both layers and broilers. It takes almost six months for layers to get the first harvest, while broilers take three years. She meets the daily demands of her family with her business. Her plan is to expand the business to increase sales. She needs a loan of $900 to meet her goals.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Fatma

texts.fr: FatmaW. est une Femme mère de trois enfants qui habite au quartier des parcelles assainies de thiès. elle gére un restaurant au quarter Randoulene de thiés depuis plus de dix ans. elle est societaire  de l'IMCEC depuis 2003 et a bénéficié de plusieurs prets qu'elle a remboursé sans problème.. elle sollicite ce nouveau pret dans le but de mieux développer son activité.
texts.en:
Fatma W. is the mother of three children and lives in the district called Parcelles Assainies in Thiès. She has managed a little restaurant in the neighborhood called Randoulene in Thiés for more than 10 years. She has belonged to IMCEC since 2003 and has had several loans that she reimbursed without problems. She is asking for this new loan in order to further develop her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: developing her little restaurant business

loans.name: Mwaidi

texts.en: Mwaidi has had a business selling food in Zanzibar for three years. She is 27 years old, divorced, and has two children, ages 2 and 6.  She owns a shop selling food where she works every day from 5:00am to 6:00pm. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $65 each month. She is hoping that this loan increases her profit and expands her business.

loans.use: Mwaidi would like to expand her food-selling business

loans.name: Dinhthi

texts.vi:
Chị L. tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Gia đình chị có 6 người con trong đó 5 người con đã trưởng thành. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang chăn nuôi ngan vịt để phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Hàng tháng với mức thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gia đình, lương làm cán bộ của chồng và sự hỗ trợ của con đi lao động xuất khẩu khoảng 5.000.000đ  kinh tế gia đình chị  rất ổn định, việc hoàn trả vốn cũng rất thuận lợi.
 Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 10.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng để mua ngan, vịt  về nuôi, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để mua thức ăn phục vụ cho công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs L. is a TYM fund member since 2002. She has 6 children, 5 of them are grown up. She and her family raise barbary ducks for a living. Her husband is an officer. Her family has a stable income: his salary, their children's salaries and revenue from the suck business total 5.000.000 VND a month. She does not have problem making the weekly payment. This time she is requesting a loan of 10.000.000 VND to buy feed and baby ducks to raise

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy baby ducks and feed

loans.name: Uju

texts.en: Uju is a single parent. She is 35 years old and has 2 children that she takes care of by herself. Uju sells secondhand clothes. The demand for her clothing is high. Uju lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. Uju needs the loan to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell to her customers. She is very grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Dilan Satan

texts.fr: Dilan Satan S., 59 ans, mariée, 05 enfants scolarisés en charge est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 3 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des robes et ensembles africains. Les revenus tirés de son commerce vont lui permettre d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Dilan Satan S., age 59, is married and has five children in school who are in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Peyrissac for three years. Her work consists in buying and reselling dresses and African suits. The income derived from her commerce is going to allow her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in dresses and African outfits

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Шарипов Мухаббат проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 37 лет, незамужем и имеет троих детей. Работает педагогом в средней школе. Но после того как она осталась одна с тремя детьми на руках ей пришлось заняться бизнесом. Торгует коврами на центральном рынке Гиссара. Кредит планирует использовать для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muhabbat S. lives in the Gissar region. She is 37 years old, not married and has three children. She works as a teacher in junior high school. After she was left alone with 3 children she had to go into business to support them. Muhabbat sells carpets at the central market in Gissar. She plans to use the loan to increase sales. She will repay her loan in 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Gultakin

texts.en: Gultakin M. is 35-year-old woman who has been breeding calves for the last 12 years. Gultakin is married and has two children. Cattle breeding is the only financial source for her family. Gultakin purchases baby calves, fattens them and then sells to the local people. She applied for $1200 to purchase two calves and expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase two calves.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel Fernández T. se ve ala necesidad de ampliar su casa ya que donde vive es muy pequeño ya que son casas de interés social y todas son del mismo tamaño. Con el  préstamo empezaría  la construcción de un cuarto en la parte de atrás para extender sala comedor. 
El es una persona trabajadora la cual ha permanecido en una maquiladora desde hace 9 años al igual que su esposa es de la manera que calificaron para obtener su casa pero ahora quieren hacerle mejoras para el bienestar de ellos como también el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miguel F. T. sees a need to expand the house where he lives, a government house that like other similar houses are the same small size. With the loan, he would begin building a room in the back of the house to extend the living-dining room outwards. He's a hard-working man who, for 9 years, has worked at the same factory where his wife works. That's how they qualified to get their house but now they want to improve it for the well-being of their children as well as themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials.

loans.name: Mihail

texts.en:
Mihail is a very honest and responsible man at his job, and he performs it well. He likes cars, and he is familiar with all the details of a motor vehicle. Three years ago, Mihail opened a car wash that is famous in his town. For 3 years he has managed to attract quite a few clients who trust the services provided by Mihail. This year he has decided to expand his business by supplementing the equipment necessary, such as a water pressure device, technical clothing, chemicals and other things, so that customers will have a desire to use Mihail's services in the future .

He decided to borrow a loan Microinvest to buy the necessary equipment and materials.

loans.use: To buy new equipment and materials.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac E. is 39 years old and married with three children. He sells drinks and provisions.

Isaac hopes for a loan in the amount of N40000 in order to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Channa

texts.en: Mr. Channa K. is villager in Krang Thnang village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. In this plantation, he faces a problem because he does not have enough money to hire laborer with two oxen to plow the field. He has decided to ask for a loan to buy a buffalo to use with his old buffalo to plow on the field and to reduce his expenses. His wife, Mrs. Saem Sokhun, owns a poultry business. Mr. Channa K. is 25 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study. He and his wife are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to use with his old buffalo to plow the field and to reduce his expenses.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna P., 43, is a resident of Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Married, she has devoted her life to her business for the future of her family. She tried selling “puto” (rice pancake snack). Her loyal customers are her relatives and neighbors.

Lorna is in her third year of membership to Paglaum MPC where she gets working capital. She feels fulfilled. Lorna applied for php7,000 for her snack vending business. Lorna hopes she will become a big-time business woman.

loans.use: Capital for snack vending.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
C. Shahodat is 52 years old. For fifteen years Shahodat has been working as a market vendor. She sells plates and dishes made in an oriental style in the central local market, which are very popular among the local populace. This kind of china is also widely used for girls' dowry and also for family celebrations. Now Shahodat is planning to enlarge the range of goods she sells by purchasing more china. Hence, she is requesting 2,000 Somoni. Shahodat is an existing IMON client with good credit history, and promises to repay the loan promptly. She thanks everyone supporting her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road. It has produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities who still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Till today, it remains a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. Civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous with only 7% of the land being arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural and manufacturing sectors, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase oriental-style plates and dishes

loans.name: Antonio Sopeai

texts.en:
Antonio Sopeai M. is originally from the city of Zavala, but currently resides in Boane, a suburb of Maputo, the capital of Mozambique. Antonio originally moved from Zavala to Maputo in search of work when he was 30. Due to the civil war, his wife and children were only able to join him many years later.

Antonio is now 55 and his children are 15 and 12. Both are currently in school. On top of supporting his immediate family Antonio also sends remittance payments to his mother in Zavala.

Antonio is employed as a bartender at Restaurante Imperial in Boane. He is requesting this loan to help finance the construction of his home. This will be his third loan from Hluvuku. The other three he has successfully paid back.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila L. is from the village of Cento Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 41 years old and has school-aged children. She is separated from her husband. To make a living, Mila runs a family member's business venture in the retail sector operating a general retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling high demand products in the local community. Mila has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mila joined as Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be to purchase additional goods for sale in her store.  A portion of her loan will also be used to repair her house. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. 

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her store and to repair her house.

location.town: Cento, Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
Durante 15 años, la señora María Teresa P. se ha dedicado a la actividad de secretaria en una empresa del municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega. Ella tiene la necesidad de reconstruir su casa de habitación ya que es una dama muy trabajadora y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus tres hijos en edad escolar.

Ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de solicitar un crédito para utilizarlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción ya que debe de adquirirlos a lo inmediato para dar lugar a la obra y de esta manera beneficiar grandemente a sus pequeños hijos los cuales necesitan mucho de su apoyo incondicional para tener un techo digno donde vivir.
texts.en:
For the past 15 years, Mrs. Maria Teresa P. has worked as a secretary at a company in the Municipality of Somotillo, Chinandega city. She needs to rebuild her house, since she is a very hard-working woman who is responsible for her three school-age children. She has come to Ceprodel to request a loan in order to purchase construction materials. She needs these materials immediately in order to start the project, and she expects it to greatly benefit her young children, who require her unconditional support in order to have a decent roof over their heads.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Lutaaya's Group

texts.en: N. Lutaaya is the leader of her lending group in Kiyunga, Lugazi. She is 28 years old and a mother of 4 children of which 3 are school going while the last born is a baby. She is a very hard working lady with two businesses that is to say; she is a farmer growing food both for sale and home consumption and also she has a business of selling clothes from Kiyunga and the neighboring trading centres. In the farming business, she has been working hand in hand with her husband and the little savings she made, enabled her to start up the clothes selling business. She has decided to ask for a loan to help increase the stock and quality of her clothes so that she could make more profits out of it.

loans.use: Buying more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Franklin Antonio

texts.es: Franklin Antonio L.  Sánchez tiene 30 años de edad, con 2 hijos menores de edad los que ha logrado mantener de la manera mas digna que esta a su alcance. ofreciendo sus servicios con su triciclo transportando a las personas hasta el lugar que se le indica, muchas veces le ha ido un poco mal pero gracias a Dios nunca se ha acostado sin comer que es lo mas importante, al principio le trabajo a un empleador el cual lo explotaba pero con un poco de ahorro logro comprar su propio triciclo. su meta es comprar al menos 10 triciclos y poder emplear a otros, para esto el necesita un financiamiento y por el momento con este dinero que se le conceda, piensa comprar 2 triciclos y empezar a cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Franklin Antonio is 30 years old, with 2 young children who he has managed to maintain in the most dignified manner he possibly could. He offers tricycle services, transporting people wherever they wish to go. Often, things have gone badly for him but, thank God, he has never lacked food, which is the most important thing.

At first, Franklin worked for an employer who exploited him but with a little savings, he managed to buy his own tricycle. His goal is to buy at least 10 tricycles and to employ others. For this, he needs financing. For the moment, with this loan, he wishes to buy 2 tricycles and begin to realize his dream.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY TWO TRICYCLES TO TRANSPORT CUSTOMERS

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en:
Kawthar is married with five children, two of whom are working. In addition, her husband works as a daily worker in Israel.

Kawthar is one of FATEN’s oldest clients. She has received several loans, starting with 200 USD, and repaid them all in full and on time.

Kawthar started selling clothes out of her house but, for six months, she has rented a store in the camp center. She wants the loan to buy more clothes to meet the demands of her clients, especially since these days are the peak for such products.

Kawthar appears in the photo at her store.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes for her store

loans.name: Ramblic

texts.en: Ramblic is forty – six years old. He is married and has given birth to two children, both in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Ramblic is a trader. He runs a provision store. He buys his goods from Kumasi and sells in a shop by the road side. He has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy provision

loans.name: Judice Kwamboka

texts.en:
Judice is married to Wilfred, and they have one child, Kevin who is four years old. Judice was introduced to KADET through existing clients and she has no previous credit history. She has been in the computer service business for three years. Judice also owns rental houses that she rents and from which she receives additional income.

Judice will use her loan to renovate the rental homes that she has so that she can increase rents and therefore increase the return on her investment. Both of her businesses are in a slum. With the extra profits she earns, she plans to buy more computers for her computer service business. In the future Judice hopes to start a computer training college.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The loan will be used to renovaterental rental houses.

loans.name: Vianey

texts.en:
Vianey N. is 27 years old and is married with two children aged 5 years and 6 months. He lives in Gasabo district which is forty-five minutes drive from Kigali.

Vianey has worked as a butcher for a long time - this is his successful tenth year in this business! He employs three people  who help in various ways to make the shop run more efficiently. The hours of his business require that he works from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day.

Vianey is now requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy a fridge, which will help him to properly store the meats that he sells. Also, with more storage space, he will be able to increase the quantity of meats that he sells.

If his strategy is successful, Vianey hopes to earn more profits which will allow him to take care of his children through providing more food, paying school fees and generally building a more secure future for them.

loans.use: To buy a fridge

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is thirty seven years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits etc. in the local market.

She wants to use this loan to buy a bulk supply of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders to expand her business. Victoria hopes to make good income from the expanded business to enable her provide the children with quality education.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche).
 
Vive en la comunidad de Irama Belén Achacachi  de la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Su esposo es empleado de una empresa constructora de carreteras.
  
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de  ganado de raza mejorada ( una vaca lechera) y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Cecilia raises cattle. She sells her milk production to PIL Andean (Industrialized Milk Plant). She lives in the Irama Belén Achacachi community in the Omasuyos province, La Paz department. It is two and a half hours from the city of La Paz. Her husband is employed by a road construction company. The loan is to buy a better breed of livestock (a dairy cow) to increase her milk production. This will increase her income. This is her first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow to improve milk production

loans.name: Luis Ramón

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, específicamente en el municipio de Nagarote, el señor Luis G. se dedica a trabajar desde hace 30 años en una empresa donde se ha destacado por ser muy responsable, cumplida y honrada. Trabaja a diario con el fin de obtener los ingresos necesarios para mantener su hogar y específicamente para brindarle las condiciones necesarias de estudio a sus dos hijos.

Una de sus hijas actualmente requiere el apoyo de su padre puesto que ella está en la universidad y su padre debe de pagar estos gastos y es por esta razón que el señor Luis G. solicita un crédito que utilizará para pagar los gastos universitarios de su hija y así contribuir a que ella se desarrolle para que triunfe en la vida.
texts.en:
Luis G. has worked for a business in the León department, specifically in the Nagrote municipality, for 30 years. He has excelled because he is very responsible, reliable, and honorable. He works everyday in order to get the necessary income to support his household. Specifically, he works to give his two children an education. One of his daughters currently needs her father’s support. She is in the university, and her father needs to pay these expenses. That is why Luis G. is asking for a loan to be used to pay his daughter’s university expenses. That way he will contribute so that she develops in order to triumph in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for his daughter's university education

loans.name: Nafanua

texts.en:
Nafanua B. is 60 and married with 6 children (ages 19 - 35 years).  She owns a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Nafanua has many years of experience in this business.  Nafanua needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 1050 tala or US $438 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Nafanua joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Nafanua's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Nafanua B. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.en: Carmelo A. is from the village of Parug-Parog, Solana, Cagayan. He is 50 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Carmelo owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Carmelo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. Carmelo is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his fourth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Amalia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Amalia A. Se dedica a Trabajar arduamente en el  Departamento de León en la actividad de cocinera. a traviesa la necesidad de invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda , ya que ha estado en malas condiciones y es madre soltera con 3 hijos que mantener. 
Solicita el crédito para realizar la compra de materiales de construcción tales como: laminas de zinc, hierro, bloque, bolsa de cemento entre otros. Con este crédito le brindará a sus hijos un techo digno donde vivir.
texts.en:
Amalia A. lives in León department and works as a cook. She needs to invest in some home improvements because her dwelling is in poor condition and she's a single mother with three children to support. She asks for funding to buy building materials and supplies like: zinc metal sheeting, iron, concrete blocks, a sack of cement, etc. This loan will allow her to provide her children with a proper place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes and onions for her business.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen sells groceries in her stall. She loves her business because her customers pay cash when they come to purchase groceries. She does not want to incur debt in her business. She hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more groceries to sell.

She is married with three children and her husband is a caterer. She is 39 years old. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to lift her business and her family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Amonjon

texts.en:
F. Amonjon is 23 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents. Amonjon has been selling curtains for 5 years together with his mother and has gained a rich experience in this kind of business.

Initially Amonjon started with selling clothing with the capital of 100 USD. Gradually he expanded his business and decided to sell curtains as there are few competitors in this kind of business. He has a good taste in choosing curtains when purchasing them which allows him to have a good clientele.

Amonjon wants to continue growing his business to improve his quality of life. For this reason he is requesting a loan of 3000 USD which he will use to buy merchandise and offer products more rapidly as well as fill his pending orders.

Amonjon and his family thank you very much for helping them succeed.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new modern curtains to sell.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibrahima M. est cordonnier expérimenté et très connu dans sa ville. C’est un métier qu’il a hérité de son père et y a fait 20 ans. il fabrique des chaussures, n’importe quel modèle et les écoule à travers la ville et parfois même en dehors de Diourbel. Selon lui, l’aspect le plus important de son travail est donner le plaisir au client en lui fabriquant de belles chaussures. En charge de sa famille, Monsieur M., âgé de 54,  compte sur ce business pour satisfaire les besoins de sa maison.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima M. is an experienced cobbler, renowned in his town. He inherited this trade from his father some 20 years ago. He makes shoes of any model and distributes them throughout the town, and even outside Diourbel. The most important aspect of his work is to please the customer by making him fine shoes. Mr. M. is 54 years old. He takes care of his family and depends on his business to meet household needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials necessary to make the shoes on display

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 40 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a businessman and they live together in Lagos State, Nigeria. Helen is a well-known trader in her community. For many years, she has been buying and selling foodstuffs such as semolina, tomato paste, fufu (made from cassava), beans and more in her shop in Lagos. She works hard to make sure there is food on the table for her children. She opens her shop every day of the week in order to make more sales.
Helen is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to buy more foodstuffs such as semolina, tomato paste, fufu, beans and more in large quantity as this will attracts more discounts. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell, such as semolina, tomato paste, fufu and beans

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Amistad Group

texts.es: PROSPERIDAD Y AMISTAD se caracteriza por ser puntuales y responsables en sus pagos, nuestra socia Zulema que es la presidenta se dedica a las confeeciones D. polos, blusas, pantalones para damas caballeros y niños, esto le permite aportar en casa y pagar la educación D. sus hijos. Ella desea que sus hijos puedan tener estudios profesionales asi que juntamente con su esposo se esfuerzan por lograrlo. El prestamo lo inveritia en la compra D. telas para sus confecciones. El grupo se muestra agradecido con los prestamos es por eso que pagan puntualmente sus cuotas segun su cronograma.
texts.en:
This group is known for being punctual and responsible in their payments. Zulema makes polos, blouses, and pants for women, men, and children. With her profits, she is able to contribute at home and pay for the education of her children. She hopes that her children will study and get professional degrees, so she and her husband work hard to realize this dream. She will use the loan to buy fabric to sew with. The group is grateful for the loans they have received, and therefore always pays their loan installments on time and according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Mr. Sor P., is 50 years old and his wife, Mrs. Chanthou Ung, is 46 years old. They have been married for 30 years. They have three children: one son and two daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker, and another one raises cows at home. The family lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sor and his wife are farmers. They grow rice on their farmland in the village. The couple does not have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their rice farm. Sor is asking his first loan of $600 to help build his capital. 

Photo: Mr. Sor P. was at home not at the rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase farming materials

loans.name: Rosa Rafael

texts.pt:
Rosa Rafael C. vive na cidade da Matola, província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique. Possui um negócio próprio de compra e venda de produtos da primeira necessidade. No empréstimo passado foi possível comprar a mercadoria que esteve prevista e a quantidade desejada.
Conseguiu pagar a sua letra de acordo com o seu calendário e o seu negócio tem andado bem embora com uma ligeira quebra devido a subida do valor do Rand, a moeda sul-africana onde tem adquirido a maioria do seu produto. Com o rendimento do seu negócio conseguiu melhorar a situação financeira da sua família.
O presente empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt pretende comprar produtos alimentares e roupa diversa usada para aumentar a quantidade do stock. O empréstimo foi satisfatório, melhorou bastante a sua vida, a sua filha casou se oficialmente. No futuro pretende solicitar mais crédito para apostar no melhoramento do seu negócio, separando estabelecimento de roupa a de produtos alimentares.
texts.en:
Rosa Rafael C. lives in the city of Matola, in the Maputo province, in the south of Mozambique. She runs her own business buying and selling consumer products. The past loan made it possible for her to buy merchandise in the quantity she wanted. She was able to repay the loan on time and her business has done well, but has taken a small loss due to the drop in value of the Rand (the currency used in South Africa, which is where she purchases the majority of her products). With the revenue she earns from her business, she has been able to improve the financial situation of her family.

The previous loan was for 25,000MT, and she used this amount to purchase food products and diverse clothing, which augmented her quantity of stock. The loan was satisfactory, and improved her life, and her daughter was able to get married. In the future, she hopes to access more loans to further improve her business, separating the clothing store from her food products.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of consumer products and varied used clothing

loans.name: Luz Felicidad

texts.es:
Luz de 44 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y montañas en construcción).  Ella vende joyería en bisutería, recorriendo las calles de Guayaquil y vendiendo a sus conocidos y amigos. 

Ella vende en un puesto de víveres arroz, bebidas y enlatados pero como necesitaba un ingreso adicional para mantener a sus hijos decidió vender joyería, poco a poco a podido tener un nuecero elevado de clientes. Trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta que llega uno de sus hijos y después vende la joyería hasta las 02h00pm. Con el préstamo quiere comprar  bisutería como cadenas, anillos y enlatados para su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere cambiar su negocio a oro sector por la delincuencia que hay.
texts.en:
Luz, 44, lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a semi-urban zone with dirt roads and mountains under construction). She sells costume jewelry, travelling around the streets of Guayaquil and selling to her acquaintances and friends. Luz also has a grocery stand - rice, drinks and canned goods, but as she needed an additional source of income to maintain her children she decided to sell jewelry. Little by little she has been able to obtain a greater list of clients. She works from 6 in the morning until one of her children arrives and afterwards she sells jewelry until 2pm. With this loan she wants to buy more costume jewelry such as necklaces, chains and tinned goods for her business. In the future Luz wants to move her business to the gold sector because of the delinquency that exists.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase necklaces, rings and canned goods

loans.name: Barselisa

texts.en:
Barselisa is a young mother who aims to become successful someday by developing her farming business. Her husband works as an OFW (Overseas Contract Worker), and together they work for the future of their family. Barselisa is thankful to Kiva partner, ASHI, for the loans it has provided since 2005. Berselisa has been able to support her farm by purchasing fertilizers, rice seeds and other supplies, and hopes to further improve her crop production in the future through hard work and the continuous assistance of ASHI.
Lack of business capital encouraged Barselisa to seek the financial support of Kiva lenders. She will be glad if her loan request is granted and she will use the loan wisely by purchasing necessary agricultural supplies to maintain crop production. Her hard work and patience are her foundation in achieving a better life. In addition, the income Barselisa gets from her business is very helpful in supporting her business and sustaining the needs of her family, especially in providing school allowances for her two children.
Someday, Barselisa hopes to expand her farming business. She is glad for the secured opportunity of taking this loan and for your support and encouragement. Her long-term goal is to achieve a level of rice production so that she can give opportunity of employment to others, especially her extended relatives in her barangay (village). Berselisa hopes to maintain a long-term, sustainable farming business.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita O. is from the village of Bal-ason, Gingoog City. She is 37 years old. Tita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Tita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for her business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Tita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Tita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Tita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more new movies and DVD discs.

loans.name: Misak

texts.en:
Misak S. is 22 years old and lives in Vazashen village, Ijevan area, with his parents and a sister. This year he graduated from the European educational regional academy, Ijevan branch, and now he works at Vazashen village administration.

For a long time, Misak and his family have been engaged in animal husbandry and land cultivation. Thanks to farming, they have been able to support their family, buy necessary furniture for their home and pay for Misak’s education.

Misak seeks a 500,000 AMD loan to buy another cow and fodder for his farm animals. He says the Kiva loan will allow him and his family to develop their farming and to increase their family's income.

loans.use: To buy another cow and fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Amevor

texts.fr: en 2002, G. s'est lancée dans le commerce des articles de mercerie, elle a ouvert sa propre boutique à cet effet et appelle sa boutique " SOLID ROCK", elle s'approvisionne à lomé. la demande actuelle de sa clientèle est élevée, elle voudrait s'approvisionner pour mieux les satisfaire, elle sollicite donc de WAGES son premier crédit qui va lui servir à acheter divers articles de mercerie pour gonfler son stock. elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. cette activité lui permet de contribuer aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
In 2002 G. began to sell haberdashery items from her shop, called 'Solid Rock'. She sources her goods from Lomé. Given that customer demand has risen, she would like to boost her stock levels in order to better meet their needs. For this reason she is seeking her first loan from WAGES which will enable her to do this. She is married with four children, and this business enables her to meet her family's needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of haberdashery goods

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita L., from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental, is 34 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Perlita owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Perlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is now requesting her second loan for 6000 PHP to be used as additional working capital for the fish business. Perlita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional working capital for the fish business

loans.name: Tarumandy Poty Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Rocio Carolina L.  quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.

La Sra. Felicita E. de Olmedo es una de las integrantes y se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad ya que diariamente vende gran cantidad de empanadas, y jugos naturales.
Comenta que le ayuda mucho y que se siente realizada como mujer ya que le ayuda mucho a su familia, con el ingreso que obtiene en su actividad de ventas de comestibles.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de carne ya que el precio actual es bastante alto y desea aprovechar el crédito y adquirir en gran cantidad.
texts.en: The main contact at the beginning of this group was Ms. Rocio Carolina L., who invited and organized her friends to come together to join the "Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras" ["Enterprising Women's Program"]. Ms. Felicita E. de Olmedo is one of the members and she is very satisfied with her work. Every day, she sells a large quantity of empanadas [typical stuffed bread pastries] and natural juices. She says that this has helped her a lot, and that she feels fully realized as a woman now that she can help her family significantly with the profits she earns from selling foods. She is requesting this loan to buy meat, as the current price is rather high, so she wants to take advantage of this loan to buy in a larger quantity.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing foods, and especially to buy meat

loans.name: Johana Maria

texts.es:
Johana es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia, es por eso comienza  a buscar ingresos para apoyar a sus cuatro hijos, siendo su esposo conductor quien apoyo  con dinero para comenzar su negocio de ropa nueva. El cual lo hizo con poco dinero luego nace la iniciativa de un financiamiento para aumentar sus ingresos.
Siendo Afodenic de gran beneficio para su inversión que hasta hoy sigue con sus ventas, en su casa de habitación. Con este nuevo préstamo comprara variedad de ropa para adulto, niño, en diferentes estilos, a si como ropa de interior de dama.
texts.en: Johana is a woman very dedicate to her family. It's for this reason she started looking for ways to earn income to support her four children. Her husband is a driver, and he gave her the money to start a business selling new clothing. She started out with little money but then was able to grow her income thanks to a loan. She has benefited greatly from her investments from the loans from Kiva partner Afodenic, increasing her clothing sales out of her home. With this new loan she plans to purchase a variety of clothing for adults and children in different styles, as well as undergarments for women.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of clothing to keep growing her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine T.  is currently in the business of selling various items in the shop such as sugar, cartons of salt etc. and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar, rice and beans to sell.  Christine is 29 years old and is married with a husband who is a business man.  She has 2 children and her children both go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more bags of sugar, rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Safina Ramadhani

texts.en:
Safina Ramadhan W. is a 36 year old woman who is married to Abdi Wekesa. They have three children. Her husband works in transportation to increase the family’s income. They live in Kahoya in Eldoret Town where Safina runs a cafeteria. She has run her business for three years and earns a monthly income of nine thousand shillings.

This will be Safina’s first loan from KADET and she plans to buy inventory for her business and buy more seats for her café. With the income from the loan, Safina want to expand her business to accommodate more customers.

In future, Safina plans to educate her children and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy food and supplies

loans.name: Charlito

texts.en:
Charlito S. Sr. is from the village of San Ramon. He is 54 years old. Charlito is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over thirty years and earns approximately $590 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Charlito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Darwin Joffre

texts.en:
Darwin Joffre lives in the southeastern part of Guayaquil, an area called Fortin. His house is made partly of cane and partly of cement. He has electricity but no running water. Darwin Joffre has had a passion for baking ever since he was a child. His father was a baker and he learned the profession from him. Fifteen years ago, Darwin Joffre started his own bakery.

Darwin Joffre’s days start early, at 4 a.m., when he and his wife start baking the bread. He bakes bread and sweets. He also sells drinks at his bakery. During the week his wife helps at the bakery, and during the weekend she works as a cleaning lady. Darwin Joffre has two sons (aged seven and four) and the older one goes to public school. Due to the increase in crime in his neighborhood he has had to put bars in front of his store.

Darwin Joffre plans to use his loan to buy an oven ($500), flour in bulk ($300), and yeast ($50). In the future he hopes to continue improving his house with cement, and he wants his children to graduate.

loans.use: To buy an oven, flour, and yeast.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a forty-eight-year-old married man with three children who lives in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a dream of setting up a farm for the family. For twenty years, he has been a successful builder and a farmer and with the income generated, he was able to pay for three of his children to go to school up to university.

His major challenge is the accidents involved during his construction work. His dream is to have rentals for the family. Joseph needs the loan to plant three acres of cow peas.

loans.use: Planting cow peas.

loans.name: Lila

texts.es:
Lila tiene 71 años de edad, es viuda  y reside junto a sus tres hijos en el sector Bebederos, una zona rural que tiene como actividad principal a la agricultura y que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado a  una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo,capitalde lar egión de Lambayeque.

Lila se dedica a las labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que su esposo falleció ella y sus hijos se encargan de sacar adelante su siembra de arroz en un pequeño terreno de cultivo con el que cuenta, a ella le gusta mucho esta actividad y con los ingresos que percibe se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

Lila desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para su cultivo de arroz, ella espera obtener una buena cosecha para que le pueda generar ingresos. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lila is 71 years old, a widow, and she lives with her three children in the Bebederos sector, a rural region that is primarily agricultural. It is locate din the district of Oyotun, one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of the region of Lambayeque. 

Lila has been involved in agricultural activities since the passing of her husband. She and her children take charge of managing the rice plantation on a small plot of land they own. She loves her work and with the income she earns she is able to provide for her family. 

Lila needs to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her rice plantation. She wants to obtain a good harvest to generate better earnings. She has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a 40-year-old married man with five children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the salon business for over five years. He initially got money from farming to set up the salon. 

His vision is having an executive salon and educating his children. Solomon wants the loan to buy synthetic hair, weaves and oil for his salon.

loans.use: Buying synthetic hair, weaves and oil for his salon

loans.name: Kounkorota Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe KOUNKOROTA, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Welabougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’articles de boutique, de condiments, d’habillements et pratiquent le maraîchage.
