Les femmes du groupe KOUNKOROTA sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter divers articles de boutique, de condiments, de semences et des habillements.                                                                          FANTA D. compte acheter beaucoup d’articles de boutique avec les grossistes de Dioïla et souvent à Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à la maison et au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  40 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the KOUNKOROTA group are married women who average 42 years of age and four children each. They all live in extended traditional families in the village of Welabougou, prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship and friendship. They sell dry goods, condiments and clothing, and they also keep market gardens.

The KOUNKOROTA members are on their first group loan, which they will use to purchase various dry goods, condiments, seeds and clothing. FANTA D. plans to buy a lot of dry goods from Dioïla wholesalers and also in Fana. She conducts her sales daily from her home and at the market, for cash and on credit, to a customer base consisting of both men and women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which will be used to make loan repayments and contributions to social ceremonies. The remainder will be reinvested in her business activity.

loans.use: To purchase various dry goods

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S., 29, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Kunthea is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1.5 each per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 28 on food and USD 28 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner. S. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Yath

texts.fr: Monsieur Yath W. habite  dans la localité de Yoff  ou il exerce son activité de couturier depuis plus de 25 ans. Il aime beaucoup la création. Il a choisi son activité par amour, en plus du fait qu’il est issu d’une famille de tailleur. Il l’a hérité de son père. Monsieur W. est sociétaire du guichet de Yoff depuis aout 2007.Il a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus destinés a confectionner des habits qu’il expose et  vend en prêt a porter. Les revenus générés par ce financement lui permettront  de régénérer  son activité qui devenait de moins en moins rentable pour lui. Son objectif est de récupérer  sa clientèle perdue.
texts.en: Mr Yath W. lives in Yoff where he is a dressmaker for 25 years. He really loves designing. He was born in a tailor family and chose this activity out of love. He inherited the business from his father. Mr W. is a member of our branch in Yoff since August 2007. He already paid off his previous loan. He is now applying to a 300 000 frs loan to buy cloth to design clothes that he exhibits and sells as ready-to-wear clothes. The generated income will allow him to dynamized his business which was becoming less and less profitable lately. His goal is to get back his lost clients.

loans.use: To buy cloth and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is Sarah A., 41, a resident of Pulido, GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Belleza A., her business partner, and is the mother of five children, three of whom are studying in public elementary school, one in college and the other is already working. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Sarah, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.
Sarah has operated a candle-making business for nine years now. With nine employees, including her husband, Sarah is able to run the business with confidence. She has been able to establish patrons who have become wholesalers of her candles, not only in the local community but also in neighboring towns and cities. Monthly, Sarah earns an estimated net income of around 12,000 PHP.
To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP. She plans to use this loan to buy more raw materials needed for her candle-making business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Sarah dreams of being able to give all of her children a good and high quality education through all of her hard work in her business. As a Christian family, by faith she claims that her business will become even more successful to also be of help to their growing local church. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meetings where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed to make candles.

loans.name: Jose Avelino

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 51 años  de edad que vive junto con su esposa ymenores hijos,cuenta con una casa propia y todos los servicios básicos (agua, luz y desague ), su vivienda está ubicada en el distrito Las Lomas.  Este distrito se caracteriza porque los pobladores desarrollan la actividad agricola (siembran arroz y algodón) .

José se dedica  a la agricultura por más de 16 años, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde  siembra arroz.  Producto que se consume mucho en los alimentos diarios de todos los pobladores. Con los ingresos que obtendrá en laventa de su arroz podrá mejorar su calidad de vida  para toda su familia.

A solicitado José a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes para abonar sus tierras de cultivo y asegurarse de tener una muy buena producción de arroz para poder pagar el préstamo brindado como incrmentar sus ingresos y darles lo que necesita su esposa e hijos.

A José se le conoce por ser un hombre responsable y trabajador en el distrito de Las Lomas, todo el esfuerzo que demanda su trabajo es con la meta de sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Jose is the father of a family. He is 51 years old and he lives together with his wife and their young children. He has a house of his own and it is equipped with all of the basic services (water, hydro, and plumbing). It is located in the district of Las Lomas. This district is known for its agricultural population (cultivating rice and cotton). 

Jose has been an agriculturist for more than 16 years. He has his own land where he cultivates rice. It is a product that is used in various foods consumed daily by the population. With the income he will obtain with the rice harvest he will be able to improve the quality of life for his entire family.

Jose has requested a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in order to purchase fertilizers for his fields to ensure a good yield of rice. He will then be able to pay the loan that has been granted and he will also increase his income and provide his wife and children with what they need.

Jose is known to be a responsible and hardworking person in the district of Las Lomas. All of the effort he invests in his work is done with the goal of providing for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his fields.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is from the city of Guingona Ozamiz city. She is 42 years old and married with eight school-aged children. To make a living, Emeliana operates a transportation service. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Emeliana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emeliana is requesting a  loan of 15000 PHP to purchase motor accessories and a raincoat for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Emeliana from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase motor accessories and a raincoat

loans.name: Dorinda

texts.en:
Dorinda is from the village of Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 66 years old. Dorinda is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Dorinda owns & operates a business harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Dorinda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Dorinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dorinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Dorinda is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Dorinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 28-year-old housewife and mother of one son. Her husband is a taxi driver; he started this profession six years ago and from the start has been saving a small amount of his income to be able to buy a car. 

Siham's husband (who appears in the picture next to the taxi) saved up a good portion of the car's price, but needed the addition of the $2,000 that Siham took out from FATEN to purchase it. They need the car's income for the family as sharing it with the agency was not feasible. 

Siham is a conservative woman therefore she refused to be photographed.

loans.use: to buy a taxi

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eliana; la socia tiene 39 años de edad, la socia es casada, La socia tiene 3 hijos; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ceviches, este  es un delicioso plato de bandera  frio hecho a  base de pescado y cebollas, la elaboración del ceviche es sencilla y la socia prepara con todos los insumos previamente comprados y frescos, La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ingredientes, pagar al proveedor del pescado que le deja, comprar utensilios de cocina entre otros gastos. La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra.de ingredientes, pagos al proveedor, comprar utensilios de cocina.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Eliana is a member of the community bank IMASUMAC II, located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco.

Eliana is 39 years old, married, and has three children.  She works buying and selling ceviche, a delicious cold dish made from fish and onions.  Making ceviche is simple and Eliana makes it with fresh ingredients she buys ahead of time.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase ingredients, pay the fish merchant, purchase kitchen utensils, and pay other expenses.  

Eliana appreciates the support she is given and promises to make her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, pay her food providers, and purchase kitchen tools.

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with seven children. 

Roel has a shop that sells beverages, breads & canned goods. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & breads.

Roel has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. In the future, Roel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & breads

loans.name: G.s. Chavarria Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario Chavarría lo conforman Paula Emilia y Juana Del Carmen. Paula se dedica a la venta de refrescos, tiene más de 21 años de dedicarse a este medio de vida. La ubicación es en la terminal de buses en donde diariamente transitan alrededor de 50 a 100 personas lo que le resulta muy favorable. Juana tiene su pulpería, hace mas de 16 años que tiene este negocio con el paso del tiempo ha logrado incrementar a la mayoría de sus clientes pues conocen muy bien los productos que ofrece. El crédito es para la compra de galletas, golosinas un poco de cosméticos, pan y otros productos.
texts.en:
The C. solidarity group is made up of Paula Emilia and Juana Del Carmen. Paula sells drinks, and has made her living doing this for 21 years. She sells in the bus station where approximately 50 to 100 people pass by every day; this is very profitable. 
Juana has a general store, and has had this business for over 16 years. With the passing of time, her store has grown. The majority of her customers know her products very well. This loan is for the purchase of cookies, sweets, some cosmetics, bread, and other products.

loans.use: to purchase cookies, candies, some cosmetics, bread, and other products

loans.name: Sierelyn

texts.en:
Sierelyn is married and has one child. She is 35 years old and lives in Dumanhog, Siquijor, Siquijor Province. 

Sierelyn is a farmer and raises pigs to sell. She has been doing this for 2 1/2 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more pigs to raise and sell. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for eight months. In the future, Sierelyn hopes that her current business will become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Byona Biyinzika Savings Group A

texts.en: 35-year-old Eric has been overseeing operations at his pub business for the last five years. Pub businesses are all the rage now in Kampala. Most pubs are driving roaring businesses with the increasing population in Kampala. Eric, too, can attest to this, as his pub is in high favor with mostly the middle class demographic. He offers a variety of both hard and soft drinks. Eric says prior to starting this business, he was more involved in a poultry business. Monthly, he says, the pub business' gross sales income is a total of Uganda shillings 300,000. He says he intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase more crates of both hard and soft drinks to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of hard and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Sara Josefina

texts.es: Sara Josefina D. 44 años D. edad, resiD. en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar, en una colonia muy sencilla, el cual está constituido por su esposo D. 42 años y sus dos hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Ella se dedica a la venta D. ricas tortillas. El negocio lo ha establecido en su hogar D. residencia, lugar que es muy visitado ya que muchas personas confían en el trabajo D. Sara y les encantan las deliciosas tortillas que día con día elabora con mucha pasión y dedicación. Sara ha trabajado toda su vida para poder colaborar un poco en la economía D. su hogar y así poder dar a su familia una calidad D. vida diferente. Ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su tortillería en la compra D. la materia prima como: maíz, agua, cal, gas propano, leña, etc.  Todo esto con el fin D. mejorar su situación económica para tener acceso a una mejor oportunidad D. vida.
texts.en: Sara Josefina, 44, lives in her own home with her family in a modest residential development. Her husband is 42 and their two children are still in school. Sara sells tortillas. Her business is located in her home and is frequented by the many people who trust her work and enjoy the delicious tortillas that she makes every day with dedication and passion. Sara has worked all her life to be able to contribute to her household's finances and give her family a higher quality of life. She maD. the decision to request this loan through INTEGRAL (Kiva Field Partner) so she could invest in her business through the purchase of raw materials such as corn, water, lime, propane gas, firewood, etc. This will allow her to improve her economic situation to have more life opportunities.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as corn, water, lime, propane gas, and firewood.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: El señor Jorge, se dedica a la producción de leche y su esposa tiene un puesto de venta de dulces y comida en la puerta del colegio de la comunidad donde viven. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar un par de vacas lecheras para así poder aumentar la producción de leche y generar mayores ingresos. Jorge vive en casa propia ubicado en la localidad de Achacachi  del departamento de La Paz;  es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Jorge ya obtuvo el año pasado un crédito a través de Kiva y ahora desea repetir la experiencia y acude a sus financiadotes para conseguir este nuevo préstamo.
texts.en: Jorge is a dairy farmer and his wife has a stand selling candy and food at the entrance to the school in their community.  He needs the loan to buy a pair of dairy cows to increase milk production and generate higher income.  Jorge lives in his own house located in Achacachi, La Paz Department.  He’s married and has four children.  Jorge already got a loan through Kiva last year and now he wants to repeat the experience and is calling on its lenders to get this new loan.

loans.use: to buy a pair of dairy cows.

loans.name: Asilbi

texts.ru: Асилби проживает в городе Куляб. Она замужем. Ей 40 лет. У нее четверо детей. Ее сын работает в строительной организации на должности главного бухгалтера. Сама она занимается торговлей на рынке. Имеет торговую точку, где продает фрукты и овощи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки огурцов, помидоров, яблок, винограда, сливы и груши.
texts.en: Asilbi lives in the town of Kulob.  She is 40 years old, married and has four children.  Her son works at a construction organization as the chief accountant.  Asilbi is involved in sales at the market.  She has a retail outlet, where she sells fruits and vegetables.  She has been involved in this business for 10 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cucumbers, tomatoes, apples, grapes, plums and pears.

loans.use: to buy cucumbers, tomatoes, apples, grapes, plums and pears

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Isata is 41 years old and married with one child, who is nine years old.  She runs a general merchandise store in Fullahtown in the central part of Freetown.  She also has one employee working with her.

Isata has been in this business for five years and sells soap, paste, sardines and bread at her store.  She also earns income from a business of selling local food items.  She says that the main challenges to her businesses are low incomes, inflation, and transportation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soap, paste, sardines, and bread.  Isata says that the extra income from this loan will help her change her family's entire life.  In the future, she would like to have an international business.

loans.use: To purchase more soap, paste, sardines, and bread to sell.

loans.name: Mónica Carolina

texts.es: Mónica Carolina de veintiocho años de edad vive con su compañero de vida. Ella posee una venta de mariscos en el mercado de su localidad se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues es muy buena vendedora y lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad, producto fresco, limpio y por supuesto a precios realmente accesibles; Mónica Carolina es una mujer entregada a su trabajo se levanta desde muy temprano para preparar la venta de cada día en el mercado; para ella uno de los secretos del éxito es no permitir que los contratiempos pasajeros nos derroten, es por eso que ella le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mariscos de todo tipo lonja, pescado, camarón entre otros. Mónica Carolina tiene fe que de esta forma lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mónica Carolina is 28, and lives with her life partner. She owns a fish stall in the local market. She has acquired a lot of customers, as she is a very good saleswoman, and what she sells is of very good quality: fresh, clean, and of course, sold at really affordable prices. 

Mónica Carolina is a woman very devoted to her work, who gets up very early to prepare for each day's sale at the market. 

For her, one of the secrets of success is not allowing passing setbacks to defeat her. That's why she is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy seafood of all types, fish, fish filets, shrimp, and other products. 

Mónica Carolina has faith that in this way, she will succeed in giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fish, fish filets, and shrimp.

loans.name: David

texts.es: David tiene 33 años, es un joven amable y emprendedor. Vive en compañía de su esposa y de su pequeña hija, además de dos hermanas y tres sobrinos, en su casa propia. El trabajo que realiza David es la digitación de documentos en computadora. Paralelo a ello trabaja también ofreciendo el servicio de transporte en mototaxi, el cual posee uno y que logró comprarlo con sus ahorros. Lleva dedicandose a ambas actividades desde hace siete años, y hasta el momento lo ha hecho solo. Él se siente a gusto con lo que hace, ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico y gracias a ello puede solventar los gastos de su hogar. Tiene planes de ampliar su negocio de digitación, pues desea ofrecer el servicio de escanear fotos, ya que por la zona por donde vive es el único que brinda éste servicio. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, y por tanto se siente muy bien con su grupo comunal, pues los considera como personas responsables y cumplidoras con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, comprará un scanner nuevo y repuestos para su mototaxi.
texts.en: David, 33, is an enterprising and friendly young man. He lives with his wife and their small daughter, along with two sisters and three cousins, in their own home. The work that David does is typing documents into the computer. At the same time, he also offers transportation services on his moto-taxi, which he was able to buy with his savings. He gets up to work these jobs at seven in the morning, and at the moment he works alone. He is happy with what he is doing since it allows him to have an income and, thanks to that, he can cover the household costs. He has plans to expand his typing business as he’d like to offer photo-scanning services since, in the area where he lives, he’s the only business that offers that services. This will be his second loan with MFP, and he feels very happy with his communal bank as he considers the members to be responsible and compliant with the payment of their loans. He will buy a new scanner and pay for repairs to his moto-taxi with the loan he’s asked for.

loans.use: to buy a scanner and to pay for repairs to his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Tserenbaatar

texts.en: Tserenbaatar is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and looks after their young daughter. His eldest son is a student and the other one is in kindergarten. Tserenbaatar transports sacked coal and meat by his Frontier car and had been selling them since 2005. Now he owns an automobile. In winter, he buys cattle and then sell them, and he is thinking of continuing this business. He is a laconic and shy man who says, "Now it is time to work and earn money as I am young and healthy." He is requesting a loan of  3,000,000 MNT to buy more meat to sell.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 46-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Delia has a shop that sells vegetables and spices like onions, garlic and tomatoes. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of spices and vegetables for selling.

Delia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Delia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of spices and vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna vive con su familia en la maravillosa provincia de Limón la cual marca una gran diversidad cultural: con una población predominantemente negra y con importantes rasgos de la cultura indígena costarricense, la afro caribeña, blancos y chinos, cada grupo le aporta a la zona su estilo propio. Esta provincia tiene hermosas lugares con arenas blancas, playas y palmeras y exuberantes parques nacionales que protegen bosques húmedos tropicales y arrecifes de coral, así como centenares de especies de flora y de fauna en vías de extinción. El parque nacional Tortuguero, contiene la muestra más grande de bosque húmedo tropical protegido y aquí usted podrá recorrer sus canales y ríos, observar la flora y la fauna, apreciar el desove de las tortugas marinas y tener la oportunidad de observar a más de 300 especies de aves dentro de las que se encuentra la lapa verde, el pavón y los tucanes. En esta zona se llevan a cabo importantes investigaciones científicas y se ha convertido en un punto especial para el turismo científico y ecológico.

Hace unos meses Reyna desea tener suficiente mercadería para asi poder salir adelante con su negocio, dedicarle más tiempo, para asi brindarles a los vecinos de la comunidad  prendas de calidad. Con el ingreso que obtenga de este negocio le dará también una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Es por esto que Reyna está solicitando un crédito por el monto de 596,000.00 (quinientos noventa y seis mil colones), para comprar mercadería, específicamente mas ropa, para asi continuar haciendo sus ventas ambulantes y llegar a alcanzar sus metas.

Reyna es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Batán, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Y están felices porque los resultados han sido muy buenos y la Empresa ha ayudado a muchas mujeres a trabajar en sus diferentes negocios.
texts.en:
Reyna lives with her family in the marvelous province of Limón which contains great cultural diversity: with a predominantly black population and with important indigenous Costa Rican cultural traits, the Afro-Caribbeans, whites and Chinese each contribute their own style to the area. This province has beautiful places with white sands, beaches and palm trees and flourishing national parks that protect tropical rain forests and coral reefs as well as hundreds of species of flora and fauna on the road to extinction. Tortuguero National Park contains the largest example of a protected tropical rain forest and there you can traverse its canals and rivers, observe flora and fauna, witness sea turtles laying their eggs and take the opportunity to observe more than 300 species of birds among which you will find the green macaw, peacocks and toucans. Important scientific research is being conducted in this area and it has become a special destination for scientific and ecological tourism.

For several months Reyna has wanted to have enough merchandise to be able to get ahead in her business and also to dedicate more time to it so that she can bring quality goods to neighbors in her community. Her income from the business will also provide a better quality of life for her family.

Consequently, Reyna is requesting a loan in the amount of 596,000 colones in order to buy merchandise, specifically more clothing so that she can continue with her street sales and succeed in reaching her goals.

Reyna is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Batán, one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. The members are happy because the results have been good and their communal bank has helped many women work in their various businesses.

loans.use: to sell clothing.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is forty years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by running a pig fattening business in the Philippines.  Susan is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed for her pigs.

Susan has been in the pig fattening business for three years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream; to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 62 years old and married; she has eight children. She is from Tabid, Misamis Occidental. Lilia plants, harvests and sells bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for ten years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help her improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lilia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina, 30, is married and resides with her husband, one child, and one sister in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running a food store at home for over two years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a truck driver who transports dirt for sale. In order to improve her family livelihood, Dina is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase hair salon equipments for her sister to run a hair salon in order to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and support her child to study at a higher level. In addition, she plans to build a new house next year.

loans.use: to purchase hair salon equipments for her sister to run a hair salon

loans.name: Carlos Augusto

texts.es:
Carlos es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y siempre querer ofrecer un bienestar para su familia. Carlos se encuentra casado y es padre de 2 hijos de 4 y 7 años de edad, quienes son su motivación para trabajar fuertemente todos los días en su negocio. Carlos se dedica a la actividad de la confección a terceros, la cual aprendió viendo a las operarias de una empresa y cuando comenzó puliendo algunas confecciones. Carlos decidió montar un taller de confección donde ofrece el servicio a gran cantidad de clientes, y gracias a sus buenos trabajos ha podido generar grandes ventas que le garantizan a el y a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Carlos montó su taller con muy bajo capital, lo que ha hecho que a menudo le hagan falta algunas materias primas o algunas máquinas para terminar sus trabajos. Con el ánimo de mejorar esta situación, Carlos busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina plana, de modo que su taller sea más productivo y pueda satisfacer todos los pedidos de sus clientes. 

Carlos espera que de esta manera su negocio crezca y se siga consolidando, y desde este su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. Carlos sueña con tener un gran taller donde pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas y mejorarle la calidad de vida a muchas más personas.

loans.use: Compra de una máquina plana, de modo que su taller sea más productivo y pueda satisfacer todos los pedidos de sus clientes.

loans.name: Irene Narciza

texts.es: Irene tiene 25 años de edad, es de estado civil casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tienen un hijo, Cristian de 7 años de edad, quien estudia en una institución de su localidad, ella se dedica hace 5 años a la producción de leche, ya que esto se ha convertido en un ingreso económico, ella solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca de leche para aumentar su producción y por ende sus ingresos, y así puede ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: para la compra de una vaca de leche

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ann would like to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To diversify his farming business by purchasing a cow

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Mr. Nestor is single man. He has been in the photography business since 1998. He takes care of himself with the income that is generated from his business, but he hasn’t enough money to organise for his future; he wants to study again at the University and to start a family. He wants to buy a camera in order to make videos of people when they have ceremonies like weddings, funerals, and birthdays, etc.

Mr. Nestor is currently looking for clients interested in his video photography services, but for the first month will pay his loan back with income generated from his original photography business.

loans.use: To buy a video camera

loans.name: Bizulaiho

texts.ru:
Bizulaiho S. is 34 years old. She is married and is a mother of four. She has a secondary education. Her husband is a constructor worker and her children are going to school. Bizulaiho has been selling children’s shoes for 8 years. Before she received her first loan from MLF “MicroInvest” Bizulaiho did not have a permanent stall. She sold her goods on the street and different parts of the market. After receiving a loan of $150 she slowly increased turnover, Bizulaiho started traveling to nearby markets to buy her stock as well as purchased a permanent stall in one of the biggest markets in the city. She also was able to add children’s clothing to her assortment. Currently her assets are up to $600. In the future, she is planning to open another point of sale.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Султонова Бизулайхо – 34 лет. Замужем, мать четверых детей. Образование среднее. Муж работает строителем, дети ходят в школу. Она торгует детской обувью, уже 8лет. До получения кредита в МЗФ «Микроинвест» торговала на улице в разных точках рынка, без определенного место деятельности. После получения займа в размере 150$ постепенно расширила товарооборот, стала ездить за товаром и кроме этого приобрела постоянную точку торговли в одном из больших рынков города. Сейчас в её ассортименте товаров добавлено детская одежда. В данный момент её активы возросли до 600$. В будущем планирует открыть еще одну торговую точку.

loans.use: To open another point of sale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice has always dreamed of seeing her children well educated, but this dream was almost shattered since she and her husband could not afford school fees.  This caused her to obtain a loan from GHAPE to start a business.  She has since successfully invested four loans and has been able to sponsor some of her children through secondary school.

With a loan of $1000, she plans to invest in her former business of selling groundnuts and also start selling ready-made dresses.  She plans to use the profit to further pay school fees for her children.

She plans to pay her loan in 24 months.  The first installment repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Pay rent and start sale of ready-made dresses

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Duong Thi B., 47 years old, has been a member of TYM Fund (Kiva partner) since 1997. She started with a loan of 30USD to buy and sell agricultural products. She spent most of the profit from that loan on her everyday living expenses, and was able to save a small amount. After three years borrowing from TYM Fund, Mrs. B. has gained more confidence to borrow more money to buy old barrels and discarded plastic, etc to sell to recycle companies. From bare hands, Mrs. B. is now an owner of a recycle store where she has three employees working for her, each gets a wage of 60 USD per month. Each month Mrs. B. earns about 375USD. Thanks to the loan from TYM Fund, she was able to build a convenient, three-storey house. She would like to borrow 950USD to buy van to transport garbage.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị Bảy, 47 tuổi là thành viên tham gia Quỹ từ năm 1997. Khi mới vào Quỹ chị khởi đầu với mức vốn 30USD dùng vào việc buôn bán nông sản phẩm, thu nhập chỉ để chi tiêu vặt và tích lũy một phần nhỏ. Sau 3 năm tham gia vay vốn của Quỹ, chị đã mạnh dạn vay mức vốn cao cùng với vốn tự có của gia đình chuyển sang thu mua các loại thùng phi cũ, nhựa phế thải...đem bán cho các cơ sở thu mua lớn. Từ chỗ chỉ là mua đi bán lại cho các chủ khác đến nay chị đã trở thành một chủ cơ sở thu mua phế liệu tại nhà và có 3 công nhân làm thuê mỗi tháng trả lương 60USD/người. Thu nhập bình quân một tháng của gia đình là 375USD. Nhờ vào hoạt động vay vốn của Quỹ để kinh doanh nên gia đình chị đã có thể xây được 1 ngôi nhà 3 tầng khang trang, có đầy đủ tiện nghi sinh hoạt. Hiện tại chị mong muốn được vay thêm 950USD từ Quỹ để mua ô tô vận chuyển hàng.

loans.use: Buy van to transport garbage

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita is a partner of the Banco Comunal “La Amistad”, located in the province and district of Moyobamba, department of San Martin. She sells different varieties of candy, the same that is offered in the principle schools in her area, as well as in the main plaza.

It was her sister-in-law who gave her the idea to start a business and who taught her how to manage it. She started it with a loan received from the community bank, which was a great help because it permitted her to supply and diversify the products that she sells, which are popular with children.

With a loan of S. 500.00, which she will repay in four months, she will buy a larger quantity of chocolate, cookie and waffle packets, gum, “chisito,” potato chips, caramels, “frugos” by the dozen and mineral water by the dozen.

Anita is 36 years old and is very happy. She likes what she does a lot, above all, the daily contact with her varied customers. Along with her husband, her six children always support her and her wish to develop as a woman and as a small entrepreneur. She wishes to have a small store in her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Anita es socia del Banco Comunal “La Amistad”, ubicado en la provincia y distrito de Moyobamba, departamento de San Martín. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas en sus diferente variedades, los mismos que ofrece en las principales escuelas y colegios de la localidad, así como en la plaza principal. Fue su cuñada quien le dio la idea de poner un negocio y le enseñó su manejo, iniciándose con el préstamo recibido del banco comunal, el mismo que es de gran ayuda porque le permite surtir y variar los productos que vende y que son requeridos mayormente por los niños. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará mayor cantidad de chocolates, galletas y waffle en paquetes, chicles por cajas, chisitos, papitas fritas por tiras y caramelos en bolsas, frugos en docenas, asimismo agua mineral en docenas. Anita con sus 36 años se muestra muy contenta, le gusta mucho lo que hace sobre todo el contacto diario que tiene con su variada clientela, junto a su esposo y a sus seis hijos que siempre la apoyan desea desarrollarse cada día más como mujer y como pequeña empresaria con el deseo de tener una bodega de venta de abarrotes en su propia casa.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (chocolates, cookies, waffles, etc.)

loans.name: Jacinta Ofelia

texts.es:
Mrs. Jacinta is a member of the communal bank Women with a Future, located in Wiracocha in the district of Calleriad in the region of Ucayali. She is 55 years old and a mother of three children: one is already independent and two still rely on her. She is married and her husband is a mechanic. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received through Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the sales of soda.

Presently she is dedicated to renting rooms in her home and selling sodas. She wakes up at 6:00 a.m., prepares breakfast for her kids and husband, and she sets to the administrational duties of renting rooms.

With the loan of 1000 soles, which she will pay back in five months, she will buy 30 corrugated sheets of metal, nails, wood, and five boxes of soda.

Jacinta says that Manuela Ramos is a great help for solving economic problems, and so she feels really happy for all the support offered.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Jacinta pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en Jr. Wiracocha 206 – AA.HH Jorge Chávez, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 55 años, es madre de 3 hijos, uno ya es independiente y dos aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo es mecánico. Con el primer préstamo de S/ 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas.

En la actualidad se dedica al alquiler de habitaciones en su vivienda y a la venta de gaseosas. Se levanta 6 a.m. prepara el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo y se dedica a administrar el alquiler de sus cuartos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 30 planchas de calaminas, clavos, listones, maderas y 5 cajas de gaseosas.

Jacinta dice que Manuela Ramos es una gran ayuda para solucionar sus problemas económicos, por lo cual se siente muy contenta por todo el apoyo brindado.

loans.use: Buy construction materials for rental rooms

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr:
34 years old, Miss W. Odette is unmarried and a mother of one child. She also takes care of two other people. Abandoned by her husband, she works as a seamstress which has helped her obtain her diploma; however, she still lives in deplorable conditions. Through this marvelous project, Odette is asking for a financing of $1000 in order to buy a sewing machine, thread and other sewing supplies. She would also like to buy a motor bike so that she can work as a taxi driver in order to provide for the needs of her family. This will also enable her to undoubtedly grow her business and thus increase her income so that she can improve the economic and social living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Agée de 34 ans, Mademoiselle W. Odette est célibataire avec un (1) enfant et deux autre personne à sa charge. Abandonnée par son mari, elle s’est lancée dans la couture ce qui lui permettra d’avoir son diplôme et ceci dans une condition déplorable. Par ce merveilleux projet, Odette demande un financement de $1000 pour l’acquisition d’une machine à coudre, d’une machine à surfiler et d’autres fournitures de couture et s’acheter une moto pour faire taxi moto afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Ceci lui permettra également d’augmenter à coup sûr ses affaires et de facto ses revenus pour améliorer les conditions de vie économique et sociale de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing machine and thread

loans.name: Semperillo 3 Group

texts.es:
Sra. Martha, the leader of the group, is 22 years old. Since she was only 7 years old, she has worked on making typical blouses. She dedicates a lot of time and care on the process because she embroiders the collar and the sleeves with typical designs of the Larrainzar region. With her loan, she wants to buy fabrics and lots of threads to continue doing the embroidery and be able to sustain her 3 children.

The other members of the group are: Sra. Apolonia P. H., Sra. Petrona H. H. and Sra. Maria Elena P. H.. All of them are dedicated artisans

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

DOÑA MARTHA DE 22 AÑOS DE EDAD, DESDE QUE TENIA 7 AÑOS DE EDAD SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR BLUSAS TIPICAS A LAS CUALES LES DEDICA MUCHO TIEMPO YA QUE LAS BORDA DEL CUELLO Y MANGAS CON BORDADOS TIPICOS DE LA REGION (LARRAINZAR), CON SU PRESTAMO QUIERE COMPRAR TELA Y MUCHO HILO PARA SEGUIR REALIZANDO LOS BORDADOS Y PODER SEGUIR MANTENIENDO A SUS 3 HIJOS, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON. APOLONIA PÉREZ H., PETRONA H. H. Y MARIA ELENA PÉREZ H. SON ARTESANAS.

loans.use: Buying threads, fabrics, and dyes for embroidery.

loans.name: Anna's Agape Group

texts.en:
Anna is 36 years old and is a single woman with 2 children, ages 10 and 5 years old. She and her husband also take care of 1 other person, age 45 years old. Anna is a clothes (vitenge and khanga) seller, and she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 6 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (vitenge and khanga) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (vitenge and khanga) for her business.

loans.name: Itagia

texts.en: Itagia F., 69, is married has nine children.  She has many years of experience raising beans, cabbages and tomatoes, and sells her produce to villagers and the public three days a week. She has taken out and repaid three previous loans from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $145.  SPBD loans are Itagia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. She will use the loan solely to buy equipment and materials for her farming business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, equipment and seeds

loans.name: Lira

texts.es:
Lira, a 55-year-old mother of 3 children, has sold homemade breads for many years along with the help of her beloved husband, Mariano. She rises early to prepare her breads and travels to sell them in the various areas of Yarinacocha and in the outskirts of the city of Pucallpa. Ms. Lira and her husband work very diligently with the sole desire to provide their children with a happy life. Lira's objective is to grow her business more and eventually open her own bakery. Therefore, she requires a capital to achieve this goal. With your help, Lira will achieve her objective in a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lira, de 55 años de edad, es madre de 03 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de panes caseros desde hace mucho tiempo con ayuda de su amado esposo, Mariano. Se levanta muy temprano a preparar este aperitivo para ofertarlo de manera ambulante por los diferentes lugares de Yarinacocha, y del mismo modo por los alrededores de la ciudad de Pucallpa. La señora Lira junto a su esposo trabajan con mucho esmero con el único deseo de otorgarles felicidad a sus hijos.Lira tiene un objetivo crecer más en su negocio y con el tiempo poner su propia panadería, y por eso requiere de un capital para cumplir con su propósito. Con tu ayuda la señora Lira logrará su objetivo en corto tiempo.

loans.use: To grow her business selling homemade bread and eventually open a bakery.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a 60-year-old widow who supports six children in her household. She runs a business on a small scale. Anna owns ten housing units which she rents out at US $12 a month. She is able to generate US $804 in rent a month. She has received and fully paid US $1587 loans from KMET/ KIVA. She has currently applied for US $800 to enable her to improve the condition of her houses.

loans.use: House renovation

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila is a member of the communal bank “Urpicha”, which means “little bird” in Quechua.

Teofila is married, 45 years old and has nine children of whom five still live with her. Teofila lives in a rustic home in the San José neighborhood, a zone that was invaded a few years ago. Teofila has a small store where she sells groceries, vegetables, fruit, wood and drinks. Teofila also has laborers make clay bricks for her, which she also sells in her store. On Saturdays and Sundays she travels to the markets of the region where she sells her groceries and fruit. In turn, at those markets she buys cereals and cheeses which she sells in her neighborhood and in the markets in Ayacucho.

Teofila needs a loan of 1,000 soles, funds that will be invested into the purchase of wood and clay from which to make her bricks.

Teofila dreams of improving her business, expanding her store and having her own working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Urpicha que significa pajarito en quechua.

Teofila es casada, tiene 45 años y tiene 9 hijos de los cuales 5 viven con ella, Teofila vive en casa rustica en el barrio de San José zona que fue invadida hace algunos años. Teofila tiene una pequeña tienda en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, leña y bebidas. Además Teofila manda elaborar adobes con peones, los cuales son vendidos en el mismo lugar. Los días sábados y domingos viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes, frutas y de las ferias compra cereales, quesos que vende en su barrio y en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Teofila necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que fue invertido en la compra de leña y tierra para hacer los adobes.

Teofila sueña con mejorar sus negocios, ampliar su tienda y tener un capital propio.

loans.use: Teofila needs a loan of 1,000 soles, funds that will be invested into the purchase of wood and clay from which to make bricks.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Jorge, “Jorgito”, como lo suelen  llamar sus vecinos  y amigos es un joven emprendedor y muy hacendoso, desde pequeño demostró ser un muchacho  con mucha fuerza de voluntad  y trabajador, por ello, desde adolescente se dedicó a trabajar en una pequeña carpintería, gracias a su iniciativa y agilidad aprendió rápidamente el oficio,  actualmente con mucho esfuerzo y constancia está logrando implementar su propio taller, instalado en el domicilio de sus padres, gracias los novedosos y finos acabados de sus trabajos, su clientela se siente muy contenta y satisfecha.  En esta oportunidad, para seguir desenvolviéndose y poniendo en cada uno de sus finos proyectos, gran creatividad desea adquirir algunas herramientas de trabajo, y con ese fin, es que solicita este préstamo.
texts.en:
Jorge, or "Jorgito", as his friends and neighbors call him, is a hardworking, enterprising young man. Ever since he was young, he showed himself to be a strong-willed, hardworking boy. In his adolescence, he began working in a small carpentry workshop. Thanks to his initiative and agility, he learned the trade very quickly, and he is currently putting together a carpentry workshop of his own at his parents' house. Thanks to his novel, finely crafted pieces, his clients have been very happy and satisfied with his work. In order to continue his highly creative work and further the development of his business, Jorgito is requesting this loan so that he can buy more tools to use in his work.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy carpentry tools

loans.name: Mi

texts.en: Mrs. Mi Y. is a villager in Vihea Village in Kandal Province and she has a hectare field to cultivate rice. Aside from this, she is a pig breeder who raises two pigs. Her husband, Mr. Suth Seung, is a fisherman who can gather a little fish to support his family. Although Mrs. Y. and her husband have different businesses, they still do not have enough money to build a new house so Mrs. Y. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to achieve her goal. Mrs. Y. is 33 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to study or attend school because that child is five years old.

loans.use: Mi would like to add to her savings to build a new house for her husband and four children.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng S., 48, and his wife, Mrs. Thary Noun, 44, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1986 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. The eldest son is studying to be a dentist in Kampong Cham Province, one daughter assists her father by selling medicine, and the other children attend a local school.

Heng has been a village doctor since 1984. His wife used to sell medicine at home, but then she started another business selling fruit at the village market and transferred her medicine shop to their daughter.

The couple also opened a shop in the village market where their daughter can sell medicine. They lack the money to finish some parts of the shop. Therefore, Heng is requesting a loan of $1000 to add to his own money to buy a door and a roof for their medicine shop at the village market.

loans.use: To help buy a door and a roof for his medicine shop

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda A. is 37 years old and married with three children. Currently all her kids are in school. The responsibility for her children rests on her shoulders. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, and bottles of minerals. She thinks expanding her business to include other items frequently demanded by her customers presents a big opportunity.

She wants to use the loan to buy additional goods to increase her shop's inventory. She hopes improved sales will allow her to save more for her children’s education. Hilda belongs to the community group called ‘Nyame be ye’ (meaning God will do) Trust Group. In this group, members serve as social collateral to gain access to loans and support one another to repay loans.

loans.use: Buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania and SELFINA! This is 43-year-old Mariam A. M., married with four children between the ages of 20 and 26. Mariam has been running a bar since 2004. 

Her bar is a good place to relax and catch up with friends.  Many cannot think of a better way to end a hard day’s work than with an ice cold local beer, under the shade from the blaring Tanzanian sun, with one’s friends. 

Working at the business 16 hours per day, 7 days per week, and assisted by three employees, Mariam currently earns about $250 each month. She is now requesting a loan of $1000 in order to purchase additional stocks of beer, soda and drinking water, and in the future plans to increase her variety of stocks. Mariam thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beer, soda and drinking water.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
K. Farida is 29 years old, married and has one child. Farida has been selling clothing for children for the past 3 years. She started this business because her husband has no fixed job and sometimes they had difficulties in their lives. Using her savings, she started to travel to the neighboring town of Istaravshan to buy clothing to sell at the local market of Isfara. Little by little she increased the number of clients and expanded her business. Nevertheless, presently her selection of garments is poor and therefore she requests a loan of 2500 Somoni to be repaid in 6 months. With this loan Farida can purchase new and varied merchandise to offer her clients. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and is where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It is famous for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Roza

texts.en: Roza M. is a 40-year-old single woman who has bred cattle for the last seven years. Roza lives with her parents who are on pension now, so she is the breadwinner of the family. Cattle breeding brings her stable income, but it is just enough to cover the basic needs of her and her parents. Roza would like to increase her income to improve her family's living conditions. To help her achieve this goal, Roza has applied for a 1200 USD loan that she will use to purchase two calves and fodder for the cattle.

loans.use: Purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Lene

texts.en: Lene M. is a 37-year-old married mother of two. One of her children is in high school and the other is attending college. Lene asked for this loan in order to purchase two piglets to raise and to buy wheels for the household "tricycle" -- a motorcycle with an attached sidecar. Tricycle taxis are a common form of transportation in the Philippines.

loans.use: To buy two piglets and wheels for a motorcycle sidecar.

loans.name: Vadim

texts.en:
Vadim is a very experienced carpenter. Since childhood he has had a desire to become a painter or a carpenter because he had the gift of being able to paint  beautifully and create different beautiful sculptures. He decided to follow the path of his father, who was also a carpenter. Now that he has all the necessary tools to work, Vadim can make wooden furniture like doors, windows, kitchens, beds, armchairs, and many other beautiful things.

Vadim wants to start a business in the sphere of manufacturing articles of wood. To do this, he will have to purchase some materials for his workshop. First, he would like to invest some money in advertising, and this will require the creation of booklets listing his name and what services he can provide.

And only after he has completed that, he will be able to start working according to the customers' demands.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his workshop.

loans.name: Remie

texts.en:
Remie is engaged in the hog raising business in her village in Andarayan South of Solana, Cagayan. She is already 40 years old and is married to Emerlito, a public elementary school teacher. They have two children: Ariah Joy, who is in grade one, and James Aldrich, who is 4 years old and an incoming nursery student for the next school year. Remie is helping her husband earn a living for their family through her small business.

Remie is a college graduate with a degree in education. However, she prefers to be a full-time wife and teach her children good values, as well as establish her own business. Her pig pen is located at the back of their house. She has been managing her enterprise for almost four years. Her business has provided her family with their basic needs and at the same time assisted her husband in sending their children to school.

Remie maintains her hog raising business for the future of her children. In order to further develop her hog raising, Remie is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 15,000.00 that she will use to buy some piglets. She dreams that she can buy a jeep for a transport business someday and that somehow her children will finish their college educations.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
El Sam Ol is 65 years old and resides with his wife in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He rents rooms to workers in the garment factory, which typically earns him about $3 every day. His wife, Sem S., 53, has run a grocery store in the market for years to earn a living and is able to make $4 per day. This couple has five children -- three are still young and two are tailors.

Every month, this family spends $60 for food, $10 for utilities and $60 for their children’s expenses. To make more money, Sem S. would like to take out a loan of $600 to expand her grocery’s inventory. Doing this, she will be able to satisfy her customers and make more money than before. (Sem S. is pictured with her customer.)

loans.use: Buy grocery items

loans.name: Gulomali

texts.ru: Гуломали Юсупов проживает в районе Варзоба. Возраст 37 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена работает в интернате "Чорбог". Гуломали работает учителем более 19 лет. Помимо этого он занимается животноводством. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить дойную корову для семейного пользования. Погашение будет проводит  за счет заработной платы.
texts.en:
Gulomali Yusupov lives in the Varzoba region. He is 37 years old, married and has three children. His wife works at the boarding school "Chorbog". Gulomali himself has been working as a teacher for more then 19 years. To supplement his salary he also raises cattle. Gulomali would like to take out this loan to purchase a milk cow for personal use. He will be paying back the loan using his salary.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en:
Davaadorj T. lives with his wife in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He was recently married and his wife is still a student in a local university. He has just recently moved out from his parents’ home in order to start a new life for his own family.

Davaadorj runs an office supply and service center. Some of the services that he offers are taking photos, scanning, printing, and copying documents. He started his business in 2003 with one personal computer that he owned. However, with his business profit, he has bought more equipment, including two laptops, a color printer and a digital camera.

In the future, Davaadorj would like to expand his small service into a well-equipped and full-service studio. He requests a loan to purchase more paper and ink for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more paper and ink for his business

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.en:
Cacilda C. is 37 years old, is divorced from her husband, and currently lives in Namaacha. She has four children between the ages of 10 and 18 who are currently in school. She studied until the 7th grade and was forced to stop due to pregnancy. When she got pregnant she moved in with her husband. The couple had three more children before she was left by her husband and forced to find work.

Cacilda started selling used clothes and saved up enough money to buy a piece of land on which to build a home. She buys used clothes in South Africa and then returns to Mozambique to sell the clothes in Boane and Maputo. With this loan she plans on increasing her business inventory.

This will be Cacilda's third loan with Hluvuku. She hopes to see her business continue to grow, allowing her to make improvements to her home and ensure that her children can continue to study.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa B. is from the village of Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 62 years old, married, and has four adult children.

Josefa operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling home products to tourists and local community members. She has been engaged in her business not less than 6 months and earns approximately Php 5,600 a month.

In 2009, Josefa joined PMPC to gain access to financial to help to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of Php 10,000 from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

Josefa is requesting a new loan of Php 10,000 which will be use to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To expand her sari-sari store

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Jose Feliciano

texts.es: El señor José Feliciano López A., tiene la edad de 28 años, habita en el barrio San Ignacio , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar ,ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos los cuales   le apoyan con las actividades agrícolas en tiempos libres , don José desde hace 8 años se dedica a la agricultura, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , él inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder hacer trabajos de conservación de suelo. Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Jose Feliciano, 28 years of age, lives in San Ignacio with his wife and three children. His wife works to help with household expenses and the children help with the agricultural work in their free time. Jose has been farming for the last eight years.

Their biggest problem is a lack of funding. Jose began farming with his parents' help. His plans for the future include improving their standard of living and working to conserve the soil. With this loan he will buy supplies and fertilizer to apply to cultivation, enabling him to obtain a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers to improve production

loans.name: Maria Lady

texts.en:
Maria Lady P. is from the village of Kiburiao, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 36 years old and married with 4 school-aged children. Maria Lady has owned a bakery for over 13 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP.

Maria Lady joined HSPFI in 1997 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and run her bakery. She has successfully repaid a HSPFI loan of 15,000 PHP which was invested in the bakery, and she is now requesting her 19th loan of 15,000 PHP to further invest in her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To invest in her bakery.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 28 and single. She has been selling food for some time now. She is hoping for a loan of N50, 000 to purchase more food to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food to sell

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.fr: G. Rosaline est née le 16/01/1976 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Rosaline est mariée à DE SOUZA Aimé, un mécanicien. Ce couple a à sa charge trois enfants tous scolarisés dont deux sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis vingt deux ans à Fridjrossè Kpota, un quartier de Cotonou. C’est le mari de Rosaline qui assure les charges de la famille. Ceci permet à Rosaline d’utiliser les revenus de son activité pour mieux développer celle-ci. Rosaline vend de façon ambulante des sacs d’écolier, des fournitures scolaires, des chaussures, des savons et des fruits. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Rosaline achète ses produits. Rosaline a déjà quinze ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Rosaline a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour continuer à développer son activité, Rosaline demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
G. Rosaline was born on January 16, 1976 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin.  She is married to SOUZA Aimé, a mechanic.  This couple has three children to support.  Two of them are their own;  all three are in school.  For 22 years, the family has been residing in Fridjrossè Kpota, a district of Cotonou.  Rosaline's husband is the one who ensure that family expenses are covered.  This allows Rosaline to use the revenues from her business to develop it further.  Rosaline goes door-to-door to sell her bags, necklaces, school supplies, shoes, soaps, and fruit. Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, is where Rosaline buys her goods.  She already has 15 years of experience in this business.  She had two ALIDé loans before that she has repaid.  She was able to use them to raise her level of business.  To continue to develop her business, Rosaline is asking for a third loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags and school supplies

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 41 year old woman who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon. Sanaa has been working as a sewer since 1998. Sanaa sews all type of clothes like men’s suits, women’s dresses etc. Sanaa requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new sewing machine. This new machine will help her improve her work. Sanaa has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always paid on time. 
Sanaa is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and does it well since she has experience. Her clients are mainly her friends and neighbors; she also works for clothing shops. When she first started her business, she didn’t face any difficulty since she used to work in a sewing factory. Sanaa decided on doing her business because after the war she had to stop working. Therefore, she decided to have an independent work. In the future, she plans to keep on the good work.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Bukky

texts.en: Bukky sells electrical goods to make a living. She has been in this business for three years.  She is 31 years old and married with two children. She is a hard working woman and she is determined to lift her business high above poverty. She sells her electrical goods daily from 8am-6:30pm. She hopes for a loan of N170,000 to purchase more electrical goods to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical goods to sell

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothea L., 34, has been married to Mr. Phat Veng since 1997. They have two children, one son and one daughter. Both of them are still young and attend school. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sothea is a silk weaver. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a wooden house builder. She hopes to supplement her other business raising cows.  She will get extra income from selling cows when they grow big enough. Hence, Sothea is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase cows to raise.

loans.use: To purchase cows to raise.

loans.name: Aïssata

texts.fr:
Aïssata M. a 46 ans, mariée et mère de neuf enfants. Elle réside avec sa coépouse,  leurs enfants et leur époux commerçant, à Sanoubougou I-Koulikoro, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame  Aïssata M. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée à l’activité d’achat et de vente de  fruits (ananas, avocat, banane, orange, etc) il y a environ six ans. Elle mène son activité devant les locaux des services de  Douanes de Sikasso. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle  a décidé de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant deux  ans. Elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel, après avoir bien remboursé le prêt précédent. 
Elle compte acheter, des fruits (en faire un stock) en provenance de la Côte d’Ivoire qu’elle revend en détail ou en gros à une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aïssata M., 46, is married and the mother of 9 children. She lives with her co-spouse, their children, and their husband who is a merchant in Sanoubougou I-Koulikoro, one of the outlying neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having tried numerous businesses without success, Mrs. Aïssata M. began to sell fruit (pineapples, avocados, bananas, oranges, etc.) about 6 years ago. She has her salespoint in front of the Customs Office in Sikasso. Wishing to better satisfy her ever-growing clientele, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. She is on her second individual loan, after having correctly reimbursed the preceding loan. She intends to stock up on fruit coming from Côte d’Ivoire which she then resells, wholesale or retail, to a clientele composed of all sorts of people. She expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 F CFA which will be used essentially to grow her working capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on the loan, investing any remainder back into the business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fruit (pineapples, avocados, bananas, oranges, etc.)

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora DORIS ELIZABETH F. A., tiene  31 años, vive en el distrito de BUENOS AIRES provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. 
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II. Ella presenta estudios superiores incompletos, refiere que por problemas económicos dejò los estudios y se dedicò a trabajar; tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella porque es madre soltera. La socia se dedica  a la venta de menús y pollos a la brasa en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles  comprò: arroz, papas, pollo, fideos, aceite, carnes, huevos, etc. para la preparación de sus menús.
Con su próximo crédito de 1,700.00 nuevos soles comprará platos, cubiertos, vasos, sacos de papa al por mayor y un horno pequeño para la preparación de los pollos a la brasa.
Ella sueña con remodelar y ampliar su local.
texts.en:
Señora Doris Elizabeth F. A. is 31 years old and lives in the Buenos Aires district in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad--Peru. The member belongs to the community bank “Mujeres Emprenedoras II.” She has not completed her studies because economic problems forced her to stop her studies and to start working. She has three children who depend on her economically as she is a single mother. The member sells prepared meals and roasted chicken out of her home. With her first loan of 300.00 Nuevos Soles she bought rice, potatoes, chicken, noodles, oil, meats, eggs, etc. for the preparation of her meals. With the next loan of 1700 Nuevos Soles she will buy plates, silverware, glasses, sacks of potatoes in bulk and a small oven to prepare her roasted chicken. She dreams of remodeling and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plates, silverware, glasses, potatoes in bulk and a small oven for roasting chicken.

loans.name: Princesa Rita

texts.es:
La señora Princesa es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara 2” desde hace 9 años, vive en el distrito de Chucuito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, se dedica a la venta de artesanía.

Princesa nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital y comprar más productos.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar bayeta y lanas al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda de artesanías en puno donde pueda vender sus productos y generar mayores ingresos. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, las bromas que se hacen en las reuniones y lo amable que es la promotora.
texts.en:
Princesa has been a member of the Santa Bárbara Communal Bank for nine years. She lives in the Chucuito district, Puno province and department. She is a 35 year old single mother and has one child. She attended school until her fifth year of high school. She sells handicrafts. Princesa tells us that she used her first loan for 300 PEN from the Manuela Ramos movement to increase her capital and buy more products. She is asking for a loan for 700 PEN to be able to buy wholesale cloth and wool. Her dream for the future is to have a handicrafts store in Puno where she would be able to sell her products and generate greater earnings. What she really likes about her Communal Bank are the punctuality, the jokes that are made during the meetings, and the kindness of the loan officer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
