loans.use: Buy fabric and wool

loans.name: Hok

texts.en: Mrs. Hok Peach is 58 years old and lives in Melong Khang Tboung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field to cultivate rice. She has a small problem because her field is infertile and her field is far from the irrigation system. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and a water machine. With the rest of the loan, she would buy pesticides to kill all kinds of insects. She also makes Khmer cakes to earn a small income to support her family. Mrs. Hok Peach is widow with six children. One of her children is a laborer in Korea, two others are farmers and the other three are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, a water machine and pesticides.

loans.name: Darkhshan Reta Group

texts.en:
The pictured group is Darkhshan Reta which is made up of five woman. Torpeki is the group leader. She is 48 and married with five children. She wants to take out a loan for her husband’s house painting business. He needs a loan to buy the required, good quality materials for his business to progress well.

Shaperi is a good tailor. She sews kid’s clothes in her house. Most of her neighbors like her work and bring their children’s clothes to sew. She has received a loan to buy a new machine for her business. 

Semen has a beauty salon which is really popular in Afghanistan and is liked by most of the people. She wants the money to fill her requirements. 

Anetah wants to take out a loan for her husband who has a small cart parts shop. He would like to buy more materials for his shop.

The last member is Seveyta who would like to receive a loan for her brother who has a carpentry shop. She is confident that her brother will progress as soon as possible. 
 
They have requested a group loan of 70,000 afghanis and would like to thank the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Virgen Asunta Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, ellos viven en la comunidad de Hospitalpampa de la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco y se reúnen cada treinta días en la casa de la señora Dagmar en la comunidad de Hospitalpampa. El banco comunal “Virgen Asunta” esta conformado por 10 miembros,  
    
Los socios se dedican al comercio minorista, entre los miembros de este banco tenemos a las socias Gerónima que se dedica a la venta de leña; La socia Teresa se dedica al procesamiento y venta de yogurt; El socio Silvestre se dedica a la construcción de casas; La socia Marylin compra y venta de granos, ellos están preocupadas porque no venden sus productos debido a las fuertes lluvias que cayeron durante varios días, las lluvias aumentaron el caudal del rió provocando que el rió moviera el puente que da paso para la ciudad del Cusco de la comunidad de Izcuchaca por lo tanto no hay paso. Los socios no pueden llevar sus productos a vender a las diferentes ciudades del Cusco, pero los socios se las ingenian para vender sus productos entonces abrieron un camino alterno para la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia Dagmar tiene 44 años de edad, es casada, es natural de la ciudad de Calca, tiene cinco hijos, ella actualmente vive en la comunidad de Hospitalpampa, Ella es una madre trabajadora que se las ingenio para abrir un pequeño negocio de compra y venta de comestibles. La socia Dagmar requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando más azúcar, arroz, fideos, gaseosas y muchos productos más. 

Nuestros socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Virgen Asunta." They live in the community of Hospitalpampa in Anta province, Department of Cusco. They meet every thirty days at the home of señora Dagmar in the community of Hospitalpampa. The communal bank “Virgen Asunta” is made up of 10 members. The members make their livings in retail trade. Among the members of this bank we have Gerónima, who makes her living selling firewood; Teresa who makes her living processing and selling yogurt; Silvestre who makes his living building houses; and Marylin buys and sells grains. They are worried because they aren't able to sell their products due to the heavy rains that lasted for several days. The rains raised the water level of the river, which moved the bridge over which they cross from the community of Izcuchaca into the city of Cusco; therefore, there is no way across. The members cannot bring their products to sell in the different cities of the Department of Cusco, but they managed to sell their products once an alternate route to the city of Cusco was opened. The member Dagmar is 44 years old, is married and comes from the city of Calca. She has five children and currently lives in the community of Hospitalpampa. She is a working mother who managed to open a small business buying and selling foodstuffs. Sra. Dagmar needs the loan to increase her business's capital and purchase more sugar, rice, noodles, sodas and many other products. Our members are grateful for the opportunity provided and promise to make good on the various payments in the established time periods.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member, Dagmar, needs to loan to increase her business's capital by buying more sugar, rice, noodles, sodas and many other products.

loans.name: Kanchan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kanchan K. is a resident of Sainbu-Bhaishipati, which is one of the developing villages of the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

She lives in a single family home with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Sabin K., is a house painter. They have one son and one daughter. Both of the children are studying in primary school.

Kanchan is a farmer and grows green vegetables on her land. She sells her vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening. She uses her income for her children's education. Now she is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Fousseyni

texts.fr:
Monsieur Fousseyni C. est agé de 41 ans, marié et père d’une fille. Il réside avec sa famille au quartier Babemba, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Pour des raisons sociales il ne fréquenta pas l'école. Il s’intéressa très vite aux activités génératrices de revenus, notamment le commerce d’articles divers avec l’achat et la vente d’huile alimentaire,  de sel e cuisine, de  spaghetti,  de savons etc, il y a environ 6 ans. 
Il dispose d’une place au nouveau  marché de Médine avec une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes de ménage. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
 Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter, 1 fût d’huile alimentaire, 2 cartons de spaghetti et 1 sac de sel de cuisine. Il s'approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes de  la place, avant de les revendre en détail, au  comptant et à crédit.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Fousseyni C. is 41 years old, married, and father to one girl. He lives with his family in the Babemba area, one of the peripheral areas of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). For social reasons, he does not attend school. He quickly became interested in income generating activities, in particular the trade of different items and the purchase and sale of cooking oil, salt, spaghetti, soap and more. It has been about six years. He is in the new Médine market, generally his customers are housewives. He is very sought after because of the quality of his products. To increasingly satisfy his customers, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with which he is on his first individual loan. With this first loan, he will buy one barrel of cooking oil, two cartons of spaghetti, and one bag of salt. He stocks up from wholesalers before reselling by retail, cash, or credit. He envisions a monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA that will be used mainly to increase his business, to contribute to family expenses, and to pay his loan interest.

Translated from French by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase different items for sale.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola sells medicines and groceries to make a living. With this business, she hopes to make more profit. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more medicines to sell. 

Bola is 45 years old and married with five children. Her children are doing well in business and at school and this gives her joy as a mother. Her husband sells electronics to support their home. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es músico.  Trabaja con su orquesta en acontecimientos sociales, su esposa es comerciante y distribuye productos a crédito; esta es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su familia, tiene 1 hija.

Vive en alquiler, su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona 12 de Octubre  de la ciudad de el Alto. 

El préstamo lo destinará a la renovación de equipos para su Orquesta.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro. El análisis socio-económico indica que Manuel está en condiciones de solicitar un préstamo.
texts.en:
Manuel is a musician. He plays with a band at social events. His wife is a merchant and sells her products on credit. Their income is the main source of income for the family which includes their daughter. Manuel lives in a rented house in the Zona 12 de Octubre neighborhood of the city of El Alto. Manuel will use the loan to repair the band's equipment. This is Manuel's first IMPRO loan. A socio-economic analysis indicates that he meets the conditions for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy equipment for entertainment business.

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Lolo, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de la région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font le commerce des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique, de condiments et d’arachide.
Ces femmes du groupe Lolo sont à leur premier prêt solidaire et Wouleye F. qui s’est spécialisée dans le plastique, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique.
Elle s’approvisionne le plus généralement à Bamako et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Dioïla et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the group Lolo are all married and average 40 years of age and five children each living in traditional extended families in Dioïla City in the region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship and community. And they do commerce in plastic kitchen utensils, condiments, and peanuts. The women in the group are on their first solidarity loan. Wouleye F., who became specialized in plastic ware, intends to use her loan for buying plastic kitchen utensils. She stocks up for the most part in Bamako. And she sells locally at the Dioïla market and at the surrounding fairs and accepts cash and credit from a customer base composed of women and men. She plans on making an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover day-to-day family expenses, and the rest will be reinvested in the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying plastic ware

loans.name: Koitamet Ole Lesire

texts.en:
Koitamet Ole Lesire T. is 41 years old. He is married to Sintei Ene T. and is the father of four children. Koitamet has been farming on his own piece of land for the last three years.

Koitamet learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a Kadet registered client. This will be his first loan. He plans to use it to buy pesticides and fertilizers to spray on his ten acres of wheat, which are doing very well in this area. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to lease more land for farming to increase his wheat production. 

His future dream is to be able to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can plant more wheat for commercial purposes and buy his own farm machinery. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers to spray on his ten acres of wheat

loans.name: Aylin

texts.en:
Aylin S. is a 48-year-old married woman who lives in Guartel Enclaro, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling fish.

Aylin’s husband, Marvin, is also a fish vendor and they have three children who are between 15 and 26 years old. They have one child who is currently going to school and who also helps in the business as part of the daily chores. Their other two children are currently working for other people.

Aylin S. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD) in 1995 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in fish vending. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000 from her business activities.

Aylin S. is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 was used to purchase a motorcycle so that they could reach more rural areas in their fish vending business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and on her family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing PHP 24,000 for her 14th loan which she intends to use as additional working capital in her fish-vending business. Aylin is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.


 About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Zulaikho

texts.en:
Z. Zulaikho is 54 years old. She is widow with three children. For 7 years Zulaikho has been working as a market vendor. She sells plates and dishes of the oriental style in the central local market. These kind of goods are of popular demand among the population. This kind of china is widely used for the dowry of girls and also for family celebrations. The love of her children is the biggest reason for Zulaikho to make an effort to provide what they need. 

Now Zulaikho is planning to enlarge the range of her store's goods. With this purpose she requests 13,000 Somoni. Zulaikho has been an active and strongly motivated client of IMON since 2007. Her credit history makes her eligible to receive new and larger loans. The well being of Zulaikho’s family and her business are in your hands. She and her children are sincerely grateful for your support. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: purchasing plates and dishes of the oriental style to expand inventory

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 33 años, vive con su pareja y sus hijos en su casa que es  propia.Luego de 7 años de experiencia que tiene en la atención de su tienda, ha logrado sacar adelante el negocio, y con el paso del tiempo ha crecido y ha podido comprar algunos artículos para el hogar y de esta manera logro  instalar  un bien abastecido bazar. En la actualidad no solo vende comestibles, si no que también ha colocado nuevos estantes donde ofrece  peluches, joyas, adornos y muchos otros objetos  necesarios para el hogar. Ella disfruta de conversar con sus clientes que frecuentemente le  compran sus productos, pero le disgusta tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de la tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, desea mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio, pues quiere  brindarles mayor comodidad a sus habituales clientes.Es el diecisieteavo préstamo que tiene  con MFP, y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy responsable y puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Liz tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de adornos para fiestas patrias peruanas (como escarapelas, insignias, banderas) que ya se acercan, y  siente que obtendrá muy buenas ganancias que le permitirán continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Liz, age 33, lives with her life partner and their children in her own house. After having seven years of experience tending her store, she has gotten ahead in the business. With the passage of time it has grown. She has been able to buy some items for the home, and she has set up a well stocked bazaar. She now not only sells food, but she has also put in some new shelves where she sells stuffed animals, jewelry, decorations, and many other objects that are needed for the home. She enjoys talking with her customers who come in frequently to buy her products. But, she does not like having to stay all day inside the store without being able to leave. In time she wants to improve the store’s facilities. She wants to provide greater comfort to her regular customers. This is her 17th loan with MFP. She has always been characterized as being very punctual with all her repayments. Liz plans to invest the requested money in buying decorations for the Peruvian National Holidays (such as ribbons, insignias, and flags) that are approaching. She feels that she will get very good earnings, which will allow her to continue progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Mrs. Nao Set Village Bank Group

texts.en:
These sixteen people are villagers in Chambak Tuem village in Takeo province and they make up this village bank loan. Mrs. N. S., who is 50 years old, is the village bank president, selected by the other members. The members will use their portion of their loan in varied ways.

Mrs. N. S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family living. Moreover, she also finds firewood to sell.

Mrs. N. S.’s problem is that her field has infertile soil and also has a lot of insects. So, to improve production, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. With the rest of the loan she will buy three piglets to raise to start a new business.

Mrs. N. S. is a widow with a child who is a fruit seller.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to buy three piglets to raise

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo D. is from Barangay 18, Gingoog City. She is 56 years old. Amparo is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Amparo owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Amparo has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Amparo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Amparo is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Amparo from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene R., 48, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Nelson R., a housepainter, and mother of a young adult who is currently enrolled in college. By the grace of God, Arlene has managed to support her child's schooling up to college level. A dream for most Filipino parents like Arlene, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Arlene operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Arlene gets supplies at wholesale prices and sells them at a per piece rate. Arlene’s store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Arlene dreams of being able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Đặng

texts.en:
H. Đặng Thị (20201030023) is a 34-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, H. owns and operates a specialized retail store.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling electronic products in the local community.  H. has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7.392.000 VND from SEDA.  The previous loan was used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business.  H. is now requesting a new loan of 9.632.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the H. from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Đặng Thị (20201030023) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm điện tử trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thiết bị & dụng cụ mới để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.632.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chopoklaj Group

texts.es: Doña Lidia Marcela es soltera, cursó Primero Básico escolar, tiene una hija de dos años de edad tiene bajo su cargo, ella se dedica a la comercio, (Compra y venta de Cortes típicos Blusas, delantales Típicos), tiene 5 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El grupo solidario se denomina Chopoklaj del Barrio Santa Isabel Momostenango, el nombré significa frente la arena blanca. El grupo cuenta con seis integrantes, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar: Compra y venta de colchas venta de  fantasías la elaboración de canastas plásticas.  El préstamo que solicitan es para la ampliación de capital así incrementan el volumen de ventas. Esperan que su negocio sea más grande y productivo.
texts.en:
Lidia Marcela is single, and she has a seventh grade education. She has a two year old daughter under her care. Lidia is a merchant. She buys and sells typical clothing that includes typical blouses and aprons. She has been in this business for five years. Counting on enthusiasm and the help of some neighbors, they organized a group in order to be able to request a loan. Their Communal Bank's name is "Chopoklaj del Barrio Santa Isabel Momostenango". The name means Facing the White Sand. Their group is comprised of six members who are engaged in different activities. Among their activities is buying and selling quilts, selling costume jewelry, and making plastic baskets. The loan they are requesting is to increase their capital in order to increase their volume of sales. They hope that their businesses become bigger and more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish (TL), Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Chelita

texts.en:
Chelita A. is a married woman who lives in Hda. San Pablo, Brgy. San Pablo, Manapla, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating one business venture, a Food Vending ( Bananaque)  business.  Her husband Cesar, who is 52 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have one child who is 12  years old.

 Chelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Chelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to fund the operations of her business so that she can continue to save up for future education of her child.

 Chelita A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund Operations

loans.name: Sergio Marcelo

texts.es: El Sr. Sergio Cliente que vive en la ciudad de la paz, en la zona de Sopocachi, la casa donde vive es del abuelo donde cuenta con una ambiente propio que fue heredado por el abuelo, tiene un hijo al cual pasa  pensiones,  don Sergio es de profesión chef con especialidad en comidas a la parrilla, en la actualidad incursiono con un recreo familiar ubicado el la localidad de Huajchilla, rio abajo,  que atiende los sábados y domingos los demás dias se dedica a dictar clases en la universidad en la carrera de hotelería turística. Cuenta con tres empleados de primer nivel los cuales son de su confianza. Lleva con esta profesión 8 años y con el negocio 3 meses por lo cual el crédito será destinado al equipamiento del recreo mas publicidad en radio para mejorar la afluencia de clientes.
texts.en: Sergio is a borrower who lives in the Sopacachi area of the city of La Paz.  He lives in his grandfather’s house where he has own area that he inherited from his grandfather.  He also has a son for whom he pays school fees.  Sergio is a chef specializing in grilled foods.  He recently started a family recreation place located in Huajchilla, Río Abajo where he works Saturdays and Sundays.  The other days he teaches university classes for the hotel management and tourism degree program.  He has three top level employees whom he trusts.  He has been in this profession for 8 years and has had the recreation area for 3 months, which is why the loan will be for purchasing equipment for the recreation place and more radio publicity to increase the influx of customers.

loans.use: To purchase sunshades, children's games and publicity.

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Rosalio; el tiene 46 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; el socio se dedica a atender su pequeña tienda de abarrotes, el vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite yfideos,el socio atiende desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su hijo, el socio quiere ampliar la tienda de abarrotes. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de arroz y azúcar.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosalio belongs to the “Reyna de los Angeles” community bank which is located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco.

Rosalio is 46 years old.  He is single and has one child.  He works serving in his small grocery store.  He sells basic foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, oil and noodles.  He serves in his store from 5.00am until 11.00pm and through this business he is managing to support his son.  He would like to expand his grocery store.  He is requesting this loan to buy goods such as sacks of rice and sugar.

He is grateful to those who are taking part in his dream by funding this loan and he pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar

loans.name: Sungura Group

texts.en:
Abraham N. is in his early thirties and is married with three children. Abraham runs a small phone accessory and spare parts store and has been doing that since 2007. The shop is open between 7:30 am and 9:00 pm and earns Abraham a low monthly profit. 

This will be Abraham's 8th loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Abraham used his previous loans to increase his stock of different spare parts, as well as improve the condition of his stall. These loans have all been successfully repaid. With his 8th loan, Abraham aims to invest in some used phones and beginning selling them as well. Abraham's dream is to one day own a big mobile phone store. 

Abraham will share this loan with his loan group Sugura, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Abraham can be seen 2nd from left in the first row, wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: To start selling mobile phones.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 56-year-old single lady and a mother of a 24-year-old girl. She has been operating a retail shop for 12 years, which has enabled her to identify potential clients and also master the commodities that sell fast.

This is her first loan from Kadet after she was introduced to Kadet by a friend. She intends to use the loan to add more stock to the retail shop, e.g. sugar worth 5,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs.), rice worth Kshs. 5,000, and flour worth Kshs.5,000. 

Cecilia plans to use the expected profits to open a business for her daughter. She hopes  to grow the business in the future to own a big wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add more stock of sugar, rice and flour

loans.name: Tumennasan

texts.en:
Tumennasan B. is 49 years old and lives with his wife and adult son in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His only son attends university. Tumennasan owns his own iron/metal work business where he produces a variety of iron items outside of his fence. He began his business in 2000 and has gained a lot of experience and skills as a iron smith. His wife helps him with the business. 

After many years of successful development, he was able to build a stable operation. His business earnings have enabled him not only to provide for his family but also to pay his son's tuition fees. For the future, he plans to expand his business by producing more various iron products. Moreover he hopes to establish his own car repair shop. 

Tumennasan is a modest and honest man and says, "I want to continue operating my business at a sustainable level so that I can continue to afford my son's tuition fees." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase his working capital for his iron products production.

loans.use: To increase his working capital for his iron products

loans.name: Oyunsaihan

texts.en:
Oyunsaihan T. is a 40 year-old single mother who lives with her two sons in Bayanhoshuu of Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

She and her family live together in a house with a fence. Her oldest son is a university student and the youngest son attends high school.

Oyunsaihan works as a sales manager in the Mongol Keramik company. Her company is a construction company which is dependent on the seasons and during her free months she operates a clothing trading business to supplement her earnings. With this loan, she plans to import clothing items from Erlian, a border city of China, in order to sell her products for upcoming holidays and celebrations. She has significant experience in her trade. 

In the future, she hopes to open her own store. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes from China.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Meliza

texts.en:
Meliza C. is from the village of Bal-ason, Gingoog City. She is 21 years old. Meliza is married and has two infant children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business making and selling broom sticks to local businesses and community members. Meliza has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Meliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Meliza is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional brooms. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Meliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional brooms

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mrs. Ros L. lives in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province. She was born in 1967. She is a widow with two children who are employed in garment factories. She is a farm laborer and a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. In the rice field, she has some problems because it is time for growing rice during the dry season. So, to improve production, Mrs. Ros L. is applying for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane C. is from the village of Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 34 years old. Mary Jane is married and has two very young children. To make a living, Mary Jane operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and direct selling clothing and shoe products from Natasha, Avon and MSE. She also makes and sells barbecue sticks. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like t-shirts and blouses. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Mary Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like t-shirts and blouses

location.town: Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes, handbags and clothes

loans.name: 33. Thi Tran. Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Loan Nguyen Thi (7) is a 53 year-old woman living in the town of Thi Tran Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa. Loan is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 33. Thi Tran. Thieu Hoa (12.13.33).

Loan is married and has two adult children. To making a living, Loan operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock, primarily cattle, for sale. Loan has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month.

In 2011, Loan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  Loan is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan of 5,787,900 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Loan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:
1. Ngo Thi Tu (11) is a 45 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
2. Nguyen Thi Thuy (13) is a 42 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
3. Nguyen Thi Ly (12) is a 40 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Loan N. thị (7) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở  Thị Trấn Thiệu Hóa, Thanh Hóa.  Loan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 33. Thị Trấn Thiệu Hóa, Thanh Hóa (12.13.33).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Loan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Loan kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND.  Vào 2011, Loan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Loan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,787,900 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Ngô Thị Tú (11) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,787,900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. Thị Thuy (13) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,787,900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  N. Thị Lý (12) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,787,900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: EL SEÑOR N. LABORA COMO TECNICO DE PERFORACION DE POZOS, ES SOLTERO, TIENE CINCO  PERSONA A SU CARGO, ES EL PRIMER CREDITO QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, LOS NECESITA PARA CANCELAR DEUDA  CON OTRA INSTITUCIONES BANACARIA Y UNA PARTE INVERTIRLO EN MEJORA DE SU VIVIENDA, EN CONSTRUIR UN CUARTO, EN COMPRA DE ARENA, BLOQUE, CEMENTO, HIERRO,ESTRIBO, EL PAGO DE LA MANO DE OBRA, AGRADECE EL APOYO QUE  ESTA INSTITUCION LE BRINDA
texts.en:
Mr. N. works as a well-drilling assistant, is single and has five people in his care. This is his first loan through CEPRODEL. He needs it to cancel debt with other bank institutions and use part of it to invest in home improvements. He wants to build a room and plans to buy sand, bricks, cement, iron, buttress materials and pay for labor costs.

He is grateful to the institution for this support.

loans.use: To pay for personal expenses

loans.name: Sop Mohamed Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP MOHAMED est créé le 27 août 2009. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Elles ont monté leur groupe par voisinage et par liens d'affinité. Le groupe fait du Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE NORD3

Madame KATY C. (debout à droite de la photo en tee-shirt jaune) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de deux autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de vêtements et de parfums. Elle pratique cette activité avant qu'elle n'adhère au Banc Villageois

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'aller à la capitale (Dakar) pour s'approvisionner en marchandises (vêtements et parfums)

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille (nourriture, santé, scolarité des enfants etc.)
texts.en:
The SOP MOHAMED solidarity group was created August 27, 2009. It is composed of eleven women who are all from the same neighborhood. They came together as neighbors and through bonds of affinity. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of MONTAGNE NORD3.  

Mrs. Katy C. (standing on the right and wearing a yellow shirt) is the head of the group. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of two (2) children. She is also responsible for two other children who were entrusted to her by relatives. She has a small business selling clothes and perfumes, an activity she was already engaged in prior to joining the Banc Villageois.  Her new loan will allow her to go to the capital (Dakar) to stock up on merchandise (clothing and perfume). Her goal is to help her husband in supporting the family (food, health care, children's tuition, etc.)

loans.use: to buy clothing and perfume for resale

loans.name: Ernesto Raul

texts.es:
Ernesto de 47 años, es un hombre trabajador que desde pequeño le gusto esta actividad por el apoyo de su tío que le enseño todo lo que es sastrería y también abrió un negocio de papelería.

El labora todo los días en su papelería en algunas veces en la sastrería cuando lo necesitan sus clientes. Le afecto en su negocio el polvo ya que queda en una calle principal y algunas veces esta mal de salud. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar materiales textiles y útiles de oficinas como cuadernos plumas y otros,el anhela terminar de adecuar su casa para mejorar la condición de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 47 years old and is a hardworking man who learned tailoring when he was a little boy.  His uncle taught him this business and he also opened a paper goods store.

He works in his store daily and sometimes in the tailor shop when his customers need him.  The dust from one of the main streets affects his business and at times he’s in bad health.  This loan will help him buy office supplies such as notebooks, pens, and other things for his business.  He eventually wants to fix up his home so that he can improve his children’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Beishegul's Group

texts.en:
Beishegul is the treasurer or this group. She is 29 and married a private entrepreneur. Together they bring up two daughters, who are preschool age (under seven). Three years ago with the initial investment of 10 000 soms the family purchased equipment for producing ice-cream. In the beginning of this business activity there was just one equipment and now they have three. The monthly profit from selling ice-cream is 20 000 soms. With money received from the loan, Beishegul wants to purchase sugar, milk, and other products, which are needed for ice-cream production. In the future she plans to save money for purchasing an apartment.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase milk and sugar for ice cream production.

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry is a married woman with 2 children, one of whom attends school while the other one is still too young. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 5 years, she has operated a clothes-selling business.  She sells in a shop to her neighbors, both men and women. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and insecurity in her business. Terry dreams of become a wholesale supplier of clothes in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes at wholesale and resell at a retail price. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes at wholesale and resell at a retail price.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando, age 46, owns and operates a livestock business, particularly focusing on the raising of pigs. He has kept this business for almost 15 years. He is also a meat vendor in their public market. His net income is 10,000 PHP every three months. Orlando is a widower and the father of three children.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP in order to purchase additonal pigs to raise. He hopes to avail more loans in the future from Kiva field partner ASKI, and offers his thanks to the generous Kiva lenders who choose to assist him.

loans.use: to purchase additonal pigs to raise

loans.name: Nery

texts.es: Nery tiene 43 años, es divorciada y disfruta de la compañía de sus 3 hijos en una  casa que le cedieron su familia. Tiene 10 años de experiencia criando animales menores como cuyes y gallinas  en su misma casa. Siempre esta al pendiente de los cuidados necesarios para sus animales ya que de eso depende para que puedan crecer sanos. Es así que es muy cuidadosa en la limpieza de la granja y en la alimentación ya que son vitales para que sean saludables. Al cabo de un tiempo los lleva a vender en la feria local de su comunidad, adicionalmente lleva granos como cebada, maíz seco entre otros  para comercializarlo ya que tiene un puesto de ventas  en la feria. Sus hijos la ayudan siempre en el transporte así como en la venta de granos y animales. Este negocio le permite tener  ingresos de manera estable y por tanto su deseo es aumentar la cantidad de animales en su granja. Este será su crédito número 15 con MFP, recuerda que fue invitada por una vecina a formar el grupo que actualmente permanece y se ha convertido en una de las integrantes con mayor trayectoria que ha demostrado ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos. Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. El dinero lo utilizará en la compra de mercadería en granos y cuyes como pollos de mejor raza para mejorar la raza de sus animales.
texts.en:
Nery, 43, is divorced and enjoys the company of her 3 kids in a house given to them by her family.  She has 10 years experience raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens from home.  She is always on the lookout for the necessary care for her animals, which they need so they can grow up healthy.  Similarly, she is very careful cleaning the farm and with the food, as these are vital for the animals to be healthy. 

After some time she brings them to sell at the local market in her community.  She also brings grains such as barley and dried corn amongst other things to the market, where she has a market stall.  Her children always help with the transportation and the selling of the grains and animals. This business allows her to have a stable income, and for this reason she wishes to increase the number of animals on her farm. 

This will be her 15th loan with MFP.  She recalls being invited by a neighbor to join the group, where she currently remains and has become one of the most experienced members.  She has proven to be responsible and punctual in her payments.  Therefore she hopes for the support of every one of you. The money will be used to purchase merchandise such as grain and guinea pigs and chickens of the best breed to improve the breeding of her animals.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, and also buy corn and barley.

loans.name: Shalva

texts.en:
Shalva is 35 years old and comes from the village of Geguti in the western part of Georgia. He lives with his wife, Sophia, and two-year-old daughter.

Shalva and Sophia have a greenhouse, where greens (between October and May) and tomatoes (between June and September) are grown. He has six years in the business. Shalva sells tomatoes in the local open market; the greens are sold to exporters who ship them to the Ukraine. Their average total income is 615 GEL.

Along with the abovementioned greenhouse the family also owns another greenhouse. With the requested loan of 1,500 GEL Shalva plans to purchase polyethylene materials to cover the structure and make the greenhouse ready for sowing. It will also be used for growing tomatoes and greens. A small part of the loan will be used to purchase fertilizer. By fertilizing the land in both greenhouses, he will get double the amount of greens and tomatoes.

Shalva plans to reinvest the increase in income in further development of his farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and polyethylene materials for his greenhouse.

loans.name: Chernor

texts.en:
Chernor is 43 years old and married with three children between the ages of 5 and 25. He runs a clothing store in Lumley, a neighborhood in Freetown.

Chernor has been in this business for seven years and sells both male and female dresses. He also earns income from renting a house to tenants. He says that the main challenge to his business is price fluctuation.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more clothing items.  Chernor says that the extra income from this loan will help him educate his children. In the future, he would like to expand his business to a boutique level.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is 52 years old and lives in Dipolog City. She is married with three children. To earn a living, Estrella has a business selling fruit. She earns about PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. Estrella has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase fresh fruits to sell. Estrella has been a member of PMPC just this year.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fruits to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary a married mother of five children, all of whom are in school, lives in Uganda in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

For the past six years Rosemary has had a tailoring business. Working seven days a week, she sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Rosemary has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more clothing materials. Her main business challenges include seasonality and thieves, and her goal is to own a tailoring school.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 40 años de edad, él es casado y tiene dos hijos, él vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y donde desarrolla sus actividades, él es cocinero y tiene un pequeño negocio familiar ósea un pequeño restaurante. Ya es un año que se dedica  al negocio y le va muy bien  gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. 

Fredy requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo bolsa de arroz, bolsa de azúcar, carne y verduras.  
  
El Banco Comunal “Nueva Visión de Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Urubamba (Cusco,  Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Fredy was born in the city of Quillabamba (Cusco, Peru) and is 40 years old. He is married and has two children. He lives and works in the city of Urubamba. He is a cook and has a small family business, which is a small restaurant. It has already been a year since he started the business, and it's going very well for him thanks to the hard work he has put into it. 

Fredy needs the loan to purchase supplies such as bags of rice and sugar, meat, and vegetables. 

The "Nueva Visión de Urubamba" ("New Vision of Urubamba") communal bank meets every month in the city of Urubamba (Cusco, Peru). Cusco is known as a big tourist and commercial area. It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world, is found there.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like bags of rice and sugar, meat, and vegetables

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco pertenece al distrito D. Tica Tica, Provincia D. Cusco, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nicasia; La socia tiene 59 años D. edad, la socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos, La socia tiene su propio negocio, ella se dedica  a la compra y venta D. golosinas, la socia tiene su puesto ambulatorio D. venta D. golosinas en el colegio Civirichi, la socia requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra D. caramelos, chupetines, galletas, entre otros al por mayor y lo venD. D. forma independiente, la socia desea a futuro poder terminar D. construir su vivienda para tener la satisfacción D. que sus hijos tendrán un hogar propio y seguro, entonces ellos no se ocuparan D. la casa si no D. ellos mismo y sus estudios. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra D. golosinas al por mayor.
La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”. The bank is located in the district of Tica Tica, in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco.

The member is Senora Nicasia. The member is 59 years old, married and has 2 children. She buys and sells sweets. The member has a street stall selling sweets in the Civirichi college. The member needs the loan to invest in the purchase of candy, lollipops and cookies and other such items wholesale to sell independently. The member wants in the future to finish building her house so as to have the satisfaction of giving her children a safe home of their own, so that they are not worrying about the house but concentrating on themselves and their studies. The member is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of candy wholesale.

The member is very satisfied and grateful for the support that will be given her through the communal bank and is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy sweets wholesale.

loans.name: Relita

texts.en:
Relita is 62 years old and lives in the village of Malibacsan in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is widowed with 11 grown children. 

To earn a living, Relita makes tasty snacks and sells them in the local community for a profit. Most often, she sells cassava cake, rice cake, suman, puto cheese, sweetened rice, etc. Those are native delicacies preferable to several Filipinos. She has been doing the job for two years and earns about 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month. Relita has requested a loan from GDMPC worth PHP 5,000 to purchase additional snack items to vend.

Relita has been a member of the cooperative since 2008. This is her sixth loan request from GDMPC. In the future, Relita would like to rent a vending space, like at a school nearby, to have more sales. She hopes to receive successive orders in the future to sustain the business and her daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional snack items to vend.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila, vive con su hija en casa familiar, ella se dedica a vender ropa: short, faldas, pantalones, blusas, para damas, caballeros y niños, el negocio lo tiene en el centro de la ciudad, desde hace cinco años se dedica a este oficio, ademas en sus momentos libres cose ropa en su propia maquina.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más mercadería para surtir su negocio, y comprar más ropa: pantalones, camisas, blusas y de esa forma incrementara sus ganancias porque tendrá más variedad para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
El sueño de Zoila  es tener una mejor calidad de vida y que su hija estudie, y que en el futuro sea profesional.
texts.en:
Zoila lives in her family home.  She sells clothing for women, men, and children: shorts, skirts, pants, blouses.  Her business is in the city center.  She has been doing this work for five years.  In her spare time, she also sews clothes with her own machine.

She needs the loan to buy more merchandise to stock her business and buy more clothing: pants, shirts, and blouses.  In this way she will increase her profits because she will have more variety to offer her customers.

Zoila's dream is to have a better quality of life and for her daughter to study and be a professional in the future.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, and blouses for her business.

loans.name: Solongo

texts.en:
Solongo, 33, is a taxi driver trying to save money for her son’s future education. She lives with her sick mother and her son in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Solongo has been running her business since 2007 and has gained a lot of experience during this period. She is actually a business manager but has still not worked in this occupation as there are no positions available with companies. Her taxi service is therefore the main source of income for her family.

Lately, Solongo's car has started to break down, making it dangerous to serve customers. Therefore, she needs to change some parts and sections of the car. It will be beneficial for her business earnings if she can make these repairs before this winter. The loan Solongo is requesting will used to purchase the new parts for her taxi car and to make the repairs on it.

loans.use: to purchase new spare parts for her taxi car in order to repair it.

loans.name: G.s. Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es: Margarita Del Socorro tiene 32 años es soltera madre de dos hijos menores de edad que están estudiando en primaria. Ella solicito un crédito para invertirlo en su negocio ha permitido tener mayores ganancias. Su mayor obstáculo ha sido principalmente enfermedades de sus hijos. El préstamo lo invirtió en la compra de calzado, cosméticos ropa en general entre otros. Desea continuar creciendo principalmente en cantidad de clientes y en el futuro realizara mejoras a su vivienda. La señora Marisol tiene 42 años es casada, su esposo es agricultor. Ella solicito un crédito de venta de gallinas y huevos.  Afirma que su negocio ha logrado crecer ya que esta ofertando otra variedad de productos de gallinas. Su mayor obstáculo es la falta de capital de trabajo grande que permita incrementar mas el inventario.
texts.en: Margarita Del Socorro is 32 years old. She is a single mother of two young children. Her children are in primary school. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business in order earn greater profits. Her biggest obstacle has primarily been her children’s illnesses. The loan will be invested in the purchase of shoes, cosmetics, clothing and other things. She wants to continue growing the number of customers she has. In the future, she will make improvements to her home. Marisol is 42 years old and married. Her husband is a farmer. She is requesting a loan for selling chickens and eggs. She states that her business has been growing now that she is offering other types of chicken products. Her biggest obstacle is the lack of working capital that would allow her to increase her inventory.

loans.use: purchase shoes, cosmetics, clothing and other items.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Virginia sells canned goods, noodles & coffee powder in her shop. She has had this business for 7 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, noodles & coffee powder.

Virginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future,Virginia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles & coffee powder.

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister is 37 years old and married to Isaac, who is employed and brings additional income to the family. They have two children, who go to school.  She has run a boutique for the last three years, with an income of KES 30,000 a month.
She has never borrowed from any other MFI and this is her second loan, after having successfully paid off the previous loan well and in good time. She will use the entire loan to buy more stocks of cosmetics and new dresses to sell during the festive season.
She plans to support her family and pay school fees for her children with the anticipated profits. She hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To add stock to the business.

loans.name: Gloria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer trabajadora, de 53 años que vive con su hija de 15 años, quien es estudiante de colegio. Ambas viven en la ciudad de Santo Domingo. 
Santo Domingo de los Colorados es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del país, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre las región Sierra y Costa. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes inusitados que se pueden encontrar desde el ingreso mismo a esta bella ciudad. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada.  La fiesta principal de Santo Domingo, se celebra con un movimiento intenso de visitantes, intercambio comercial y cultural. Una gran feria tiene lugar en las instalaciones de la Asociación de Ganaderos, allí se muestran y compiten los mejores ejemplares de las distintas razas y cruces que son criados en las haciendas de la región. 

Gloria aprendió de sus familiares el negocio de criar cerdos y luego venderlos. Esto lo viene realizando desde hace algunos años por lo que ha podido mantener sola a su hija. Ella desea invertir comprando 6 cerdos pequeños y así en unos meses poder aprovechar la venta que se incrementará gracias a la época navideña.

Ella se preocupa por su salud ya que su sueño es poder educar a su hija y darle todo lo necesario. Como toda buena madre se esfuerza para dar a su hija una calidad de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Gloria, 53, is a hardworking woman living with her 15-year-old daughter who attends secondary school.  They both live in the city of Santo Domingo.

Santo Domingo de los Colorados is one of the country’s youngest cities.  It is located at the junction point between the Mountains and the Coast.  It is a privileged site not only because of its ethnic wealth but also because of its unusual scenery that can be found starting at this beautiful city’s very entrance.  Santo Domingo de los Colorados is currently part of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province.  The main festival of Santo Domingo is celebrated with an intense influx of visitors, commercial and cultural interchange.  A great street fair takes place at the installations of the Cattlemen’s Association where the best examples of the various breeds and crossbreeds raised in the region’s haciendas are displayed and compete.

Gloria learned how to raise pigs to sell from her family.  She’s been doing this now for several years and has been able to support her daughter by herself.  She wants to invest in the purchase of six piglets to sell in a few months taking advantage of the increased sales that take place thanks to the Christmas season.

She’s concerned about her health because her dream is being able to educate her daughter and give her everything necessary.  Like all good mothers, she strives to give her daughter a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy six piglets.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 38 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends school. For two years, she has had a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan. Charity is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
To earn a living, Benjamin, a 53-year-old father of four grown children, has been growing corn and vegetables to sell for almost 34 years. He usually earns a profit of P19,000 per season from his corn plantation, utilizing his income to provide food, allowances and education for his children, some of whom are now employed.

Despite his success, Benjamin wants to increase his corn yields and so is requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides and pay the labor costs involved in planting corn. He is hoping that his patience and hard work will continue to yield good results.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides and pay labor costs involved in planting corn.

loans.name: Rinorah

texts.en:
Rinorah is a hard-working lady living in Kasese, Uganda, and her personal goal is to educate her children. She has been running a retail shop for the last two years after starting with working capital of fifty thousand only from her farming activities which she did initially.

Her major hardship is customers not paying on time, however, she has a vision of buying land to grow crops. The purpose of the loan is to buy cassava flour for resale.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bakary est âgé de 34 ans, marié  et père  de 3 enfants. Elle vit dans sa famille paternelle avec ses enfants et  d’autres ménages.
Ayant abandonné l’école au secondaire (système éducatif Malien), tôt il embrassa le commerce de gas-oil auprès de son oncle. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage, il évolua seul pour faire le commerce de gas-oil. Il mène cette activité depuis 10 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience. Sa force de vente est due à la maîtrise du rouage de ce secteur d’activité. Il vend sa marchandise au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de chauffeurs et de revendeurs. 
 Dans le souci de faire face à la demande clientèle et de faire plus de bénéfice, il  sollicite ce nouveau prêt. Il  est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 36 mois, avec  3 prêts individuels bien remboursés. Il  est à son 4ème prêt individuel qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter 4 barriques de gas-oil. il s’approvisionne sur place.
Monsieur Bakary envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt, de mener autres activités génératrices de revenus.
Son ambition est   de construire des maisons.
texts.en:
Bakary is 34 years old, married and the father of 3 children. He and his children live with his paternal family and other households. He left school at secondary level (in the Malian education system) and started working in the diesel retail business with his uncle at an early age. After working for several years as an apprentice, he started his own diesel oil retail business. Today he is a seasoned reseller with 10 years of experience in the field. His high sales volume is due to his good understanding of how the sector works. He sells his merchandise for cash to a clientele which is mostly composed of drivers and resellers.

Bakary is requesting a new loan in order to be able to keep up with customer demand and increase his profits. He has been with Soro Yiriwaso for 36 months and has already fully repaid 3 previous loans. This will be his 4th individual loan, which he plans to use to buy 4 barrels of diesel oil. He gets his supplies on the spot.

Bakary predicts a monthly profit of 150 000 francs. His profits will allow him to repay his loan and engage in other profit-making activities. He would eventually like to build houses.

loans.use: to buy diesel oil.

loans.name: Yeny Maritza

texts.en:
Yeny is just 21 years old and lives in the municipality of Puerto Berrio. She has 2 beautiful twins’ baby daughters whom only are 2 months old, and since they were born, she feels as the happiest person in the world. This young woman has an amazing talent, she’s a dancer, why this year she started working in a dance school where they teach and make presentations too. 


Buying inputs for the place where she has the dancing studio can be really expensive, and she wants to increase her clients so the studio can become more successful and start being recognized. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy some furniture for the studio and some water dispensers, she also wants to adjust the entire studio. 

Yeny dreams with buying a house where she can build a live with her daughters and be happy with them. Help this talented young woman to be successful in her business and in her life.

loans.use: buy some furniture for the dancing studio and some water dispensers, she also wants to adjust the entire studio

loans.name: Chimen

texts.en:
Chimen is 42 years old and has a farming business since 2002. She lives in Salyan region Yenikand village, married, has 2 children.
In he beginning of her business she borrowed a loan of $500 and bought 0,08 hectare plot of land. 
Now she needs a loan of $800 to buy 0,1 hectare plot of land. She plans to create apple garden.

loans.use: To buy 0,1 hectare plot of land

loans.name: Jalilova

texts.en: Z. is a resident of Beylagan town. She is 45 years old and has three children. She owns a shop in the town center where she sells household items of various usees. She has been doing this business since 2002. When she started $she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed 300 to buy inventory.
