Dennis is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Dennis from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 45-year-old married man living with his wife and three school-age children. He has built a good experience working as a construction worker for 25 years. In 1990, he started working independently, taking home/construction projects. He has a good number of clients asking for his services. His income is important to help with the household expenses.  

Today, he is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his business capital and invest in purchasing an engine for his cement mixer in order to continue expansion of his business and to increase his productivity further. He expects that his business will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: To purchase an engine for his cement mixer

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina Z. is from the village of Upper Solana, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old. Florentina is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Florentina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as canned goods, snack foods, detergents & beverages in the local community. Florentina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Florentina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florentina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Florentina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Florentina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods.

loans.name: Juan Enrique

texts.es:
Juan Enrique Z. es una persona humilde y trabajadora que con esfuerzo propio ha logrado salir adelante junto a su familia donde él es el sostén del hogar y que gracias a su actividad de productor ganadero ha sabido darle una educación a sus hijos ya que el solo logro llegar hasta segundo grado de primaria.
Este  es el segundo crédito que solicita en ceprodel es para la compra de cerdo de engorde  ya que busca otra alternativa de ingreso de ingreso además de la producción lechera y venta de terneros 
Los créditos que ceprodel le han ayudado para mejorar su condición de vida ya que con el crédito anterior pudo aprovechar para aumentar su ganado y asi producir más leche con lo cual obtuvo mayor ingreso el cual lo invirtió en la compra de una picadora de pasto la cual es de mucho beneficio
texts.en:
Juan Enrique Z. is a very humble and hard-working person who, through his own efforts, has managed to get ahead in life together with his family.  He is responsible for supporting his household and, thanks to his business raising cattle, he has been able to provide his children with an education.  Juan himself only managed to reach second grade.

This is the second loan that Juan has requested from Ceprodel and he will use it to buy pigs to fatten since he is looking for another income in addition to the one he makes from selling milk and calves.

The loans that Juan has received from Ceprodel have helped him to improve his living conditions as he used his previous loan to increase the size of his herd.  This meant that his cattle produced more milk which made him more income.  He was consequently able to invest in buying an animal feed grinder which has benefited him a lot.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Gnambossou-Gbeta 01 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA 01 est composé D. 17 membres qui vivent tous dans le même quartier. La présidente D. ce groupement, du nom D. Marie Thérèse, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but D. rehausser le niveau D. leur activité afin D. mieux faire face à la demanD. D. leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une deuxième fois l'appui financier D. ALIDé.
Marie Thérèse est mariée à un certain Pauline et a six enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales.  Il y a une dizaine d’année que Marie Thérèse et son mari se sont  installés à Aïbatin, un quartier D. Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Marie Thérèse  n’est jamais allée à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux D. sa famille, Marie Thérèse mène comme activité depuis dix ans environs, la vente D. produits vivriers par le système D. distribution. C'est à Zè et à Ikpinlè que Marie Thérèse s'approvisionne. Dans le but D. renforcer son activité et D. mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Marie Thérèse sollicite un crédit auprès D. ALIDé. Son ambition est d’amener son activité à un niveau plus élevé.
texts.en:
GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA group is composed of 17 members who live in the same neighborhood. The group leader, Marie Thérèse, is raising her hand in the photograph. In order to bolster their businesses and better meet customer demand, the group is seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

Marie Thérèse is married to Paulin, and she has six children who all attend school. The couple takes care of the various family expenses together. About ten years ago, the couple moved in to Aïbatin, a neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin.

Marie Thérèse never attended school. For ten years, she's been selling food products through the distribution system, in order to proviD. for herself and her family. She gets her supplies in Zè and Ikpinlè. In order to bolster her business and better meet customer demand, she's seeking a loan from ALIDé. Her ambition is to take her business to a higher level.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in products for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and four young children. Some of the children are still attending school. She has owned a bakery since 2009 and has more than nine years of experience in the same occupation. She works in collaboration with her husband. He has worked as a pastry distributor for the past 26 years in order to better support the family money-wise. She has a very good repayment history and this will be her third Kiva loan. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to develop her shop and increase her productivity by renovating her tools and purchasing a meat-cutting machine. She is certain that the loan will positively impact her business.

loans.use: to renovate her tools and purchase a meat-cutting machine

loans.name: Indatwa Group

texts.fr: Adèle  est client d’ACB depuis 2011, elle est membre du groupe Indatwa, elle est née au Rwanda, son éducation est de 6 ans de l’école primaire, elle est mariée, elle a 37 ans, elle a 8 enfants entre 16 et 2 ans, 2 de ses enfants vont à l’école. C’est son premier cycle de prêt, Adèle va utiliser le prêt pour l’agriculture en payant main d’œuvre et les aliments pour son restaurant. Sa stratégie est l’attraction de la clientèle. Dans l’avenir, Adèle veut avoir un restaurant de première qualité dans son quartier et éduquer ses enfants  jusqu'à l’université. Elle aussi agriculteur de tomates et de riz.
texts.en: Adèle is a client of ACB since 2011. She is a member  of the Indatwa group. She is born in Rwanda. She has finished six grades of primary school. She is 37 years old. She is married, with eight children between 2 and 16 years of age, two of whom are in school. This is her first loan circle. Adèle will use her loan to pay the cost of manual labor and food items for her restaurant. Her strategy is attracting more customers. In the future, she would like to have a quality restaurant in her neighborhood and support her children’s studies through the university level. She also grows tomatoes and rice.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, rice and vegetable oil for her restaurant

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Mr Abdoulaye est célibataire sans enfant et n’a personne en charge.

Il gère un TELECOM (vente d’accessoires de téléphone et réparation de téléphone), depuis 3 ans. Mr s’approvisionne au grand marché et au marché du secteur 10 de Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont tous ceux qui possèdent des téléphones portables (dans le quartier et ses amis).

Il veut acheter du matériel de réparation et accessoires (un demi paquet de façade, 20 écouteurs, 10 baffles, 10 fourreaux, 20 micros 7 batteries etc.).

Mr utilise ses bénéfices pour améliorer ses conditions de vie. Il ambitionne agrandir sa boutique de TELECOM et se marier.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is a single man with no children or dependants. 

He  has run a TELECOM shop (selling telephone accessories and telephone repairs) for three years. He sources his goods from the large market and from the smaller district 10 market of Ouagadougou. His customers are all those who own mobile phones (all those in his quarter, as well as his friends). 

He would like to purchase telephone repair tools and phone accessories (half a pack of phone covers, 20 ear pieces, 10 speakers, 10 cases, 20 mouth-pieces, 7 batteries etc). He uses the profits generated from his business to improve his living conditions; his aim is to grow his TELECOM business and to get married.

loans.use: to purchase telephone repair tools and accessories

loans.name: Susan

texts.es: Susan es una joven de 20 años y vive con sus progenitores en la propiedad que tienen desde hace muchos años atrás. Trabaja en un negocio familiar que fundaron sus padres desde hace más de 20 años vendiendo artículos ferreteros, es lo que aprendió durante toda su vida. Es así que decide independizarse en la venta de artículos ferreteros en el mismo local de ventas que tiene sus padres. Esta forma de trabajar  lo hace desde hace 2 años y le permite solventar económicamente la carrera que esta estudiando, pero tiene planes de crecer y tener su propio local de ventas. Ahora su fin es adquirir diferentes artículos de ferretería que son de su propio capital, como yeso, pernos, tubos de conexión. Considera que es de suma importancia para su negocio trabajar con los créditos que obtiene con MFP, que le permite incrementar poco a poco su capital y genera en ella el habito de la responsabilidad para afrontar sus cuentas además de que disfruta de ser parte del banco comunal a la que pertenece  porque son personas confiables de las cuales viene llevando hasta la fecha 6 ciclos de préstamo grupal. Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para poder concretar sus estudios e independizarse en su negocio. Con el dinero comprará más mercadería en los artículos ferreteros que vende.
texts.en:
Susan is 20 years old and lives with her parents in the home they’ve owned for many years. She works in the family hardware business that her parents started more than twenty years ago. She learned all about the business as she grew up.

Two years ago she decided to become self-sufficient and sell hardware at the same stall as her parents. This allowed her to pay for her studies. But she also has plans to expand and have her own stall.

Currently Susan’s goal is to obtain different types of hardware using her own money such as plaster, bolts, and pipe connectors. She believes that the loans she obtains from Kiva partner MFP are very important for her business as they allow her to gradually increase her working capital. They also make her take responsibility for the repayments. She also enjoys being part of the community bank whose members are very trustworthy. To date she has been part of six group loans. 

Susan is counting on assistance from many donors so she can complete her studies and start her own business. With the money she will buy more hardware items for her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her hardware business

loans.name: Kairy's Group

texts.en:
Kairy, 49, is the leader of this group of three. She is married and together with four children lives in the small southern town of Nookat.

Kairy has been farming for twenty years. She grows mainly potatoes and wheat. She started her farm with the cultivation of 300 square meters of land. Currently the area of the land is bigger, and accordingly, the size of her crops is greater. Despite their studies, her children do their best to provide assistance in the fields. Her monthly income is approximately 4,000 KGS.

The purpose of Kairy’s 45,000 KGS loan is to buy building materials so as to finish construction on a new house. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy building materials so as to finish construction on a new house.

loans.name: Flor Kantuta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR KANTUTA” iniciará el ciclo número seis en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la señora  Martha quien se encuentra de vestida con manta blanca.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: atención de cafetería, venta de cosméticos, portería, costura de mandiles, venta de comida, venta de salchipapas, chofer.
 
La señora Martha indica que hace seis años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo harina, etc.). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene  tres hijos.

En la fotografia no encontramos a Don Enrique porque su cultura no le permite; pero acompaña al grupo la prima de una de las socias
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Flor Kantuta” is starting its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch Community Center. The group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Martha, the woman wearing a white shawl over her dress. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different businesses in order to get ahead such as managing a cafeteria, selling cosmetics, working as a caretaker, sewing aprons, selling food, selling “salchipapas” (sausages and potatoes), and working as a chauffeur.

Sra. Martha says that she joined a Communal Bank and Pro Mujer six years ago after receiving an invitation. She currently has a business in which she sells food.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying rice, noodles, flour, and other items. Working in this manner makes it possible for her to generate income to support her family. Martha is single and has three children.

In the photograph, Don Enrique does not appear because his culture does not allow it. However, a cousin of one of the members does appear with the group.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, flour, and other items.

loans.name: James

texts.en: For the last 15 years, James, 42, has been operating a general store to make ends meet. He makes an extra shilling by engaging in farming. He wants in the next five years to have a better business premises and a high turnover.  He is married and blessed with three school-going children. He is requesting a loan of 45,000 Kenyan shillings to buy wheat flour, rice, biscuits and sanitary pads. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for reducing his stress levels and advancing him finances to use in his business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, rice, biscuits and sanitary pads

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es:
El Señor Aurelio tiene 42 años, vive con la señora Blanca y tienen 4 hijos. Es comerciante desde hace más de 15 años, vende todo tipo de artículos, como ser calzados, ropas, sabanas, edredones. Realiza sus ventas en forma directa y también en forma de pedidos en las zonas aledañas de la ciudad.
Debido a los años que lleva en este trabajo, el ha logrado formarse una clientela bien definida, a quienes visita en forma permanente dependiendo de la zona en que le toque trabajar. Uno de sus proyectos es expandirse y poder llegar a más ciudades de las que llega.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, frazadas, ropas, calzados y otros para la posterior venta. Con esto podrá abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Aurelio, 42, lives with Blanca and has 4 children.  He has been working as a retailer for more than 15 years, and he sells all types of items including: shoes, clothing, bed sheets and comforters.  He makes his sales directly and also through advance orders in the neighborhoods surrounding the city.  

Because he has been doing this work for years, he has formed a well-defined clientele, who visit on an ongoing basis depending on the neighborhood where he is working.  One of his plans is to expand so that he can travel to more areas than the ones he already frequents.  

He is requesting a loan to buy bed sheets, blankets, clothing, shoes and other items to later sell.  With this loan, he will be able to stock up his business and fulfill his customer's orders.  He thanks the Fundación for the opportunity that they are providing him.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets, blankets, shoes, and other items to later sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su esposo y una hija D. 26 años que actualmente está estudiando, Rosa se dedica a vender pupusas desD. hace 5 años, este negocio lo inicio por cuenta propia, lo atienD. D. 6:00am a 12:00pm. 
Por el momento está solicitando un préstamo para comprar maíz, leña, gas, chicharrón y quesillo, aceite y tomates,  estos materiales para preparar la venta, este préstamo le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y a atender mejor a los clientes.
Ella quiere crecer con el negocio, tener satisfechos a los clientes con los productos que venD., y ofrecer a su familia una mejor condición D. vida.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her husband and a 26-year-old daughter who is currently studying.  Rosa has been selling pupusas for 5 years.  She started her business on her own initiative and works from 6.00am to 12.00pm.

Right now, Rosa is requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood, gas, pork rinds, soft cheese, oil and tomatoes.  She will use these materials to prepare her products for sale.  This loan will help her to strengthen her business and better serve her customers.

Rosa would like to grow her business and keep her customers satisfied with the products that she sells.  She would like to be able to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for making her pupusas (corn, firewood, gas, pork rinds, soft cheese, oil and tomatoes)

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela tiene 22 años ella está casada desde hace 4 años con el señor Gabino el cual trabaja en la obra juntos han procreado 2 niños uno de 3 años y otro de 2 años aunque todavía no van a la escuela si dependen de dicho matrimonio. 
Ella invertirá el crédito para comprar 4 borregos, pastura el cual lo compra por kilo y alimento que lo compra por bulto, ella en la actividad ganadera lleva 4 años lo aprendió de su papa compra y vende sus borregos los vende cuando ya están grandes, las esperanzas que tiene la señora Daniela es que sus borregas crezcan y den borreguitos para que su sean más borregos y así sus ganancias aumenten. 
Ella está muy agradecida por el préstamo  porque podrá comprarse otros borregos que ya le hacían falta en su corral.
texts.en:
Daniela is 22 years old.  She has been married to Señor Gabino for the last four years; he works in construction.  They have two children together, one aged 3 and the other aged 2.  They are not yet at school, and so are dependent on their parents.

She will invest this loan to buy four sheep; grass which she buys for them by the kilo; and feed which she buys for them by the bundle.  She has spent four years working with livestock.  She learned from her dad to buy and sell sheep, selling them once they have become large. 

Señora Daniela's hopes are that her sheep grow and give her lambs so that she has more sheep, and so can increase her earnings.

She is very grateful for the loan, because she will be able to buy additional sheep which she currently needs for her farm.

loans.use: to buy four sheep, grass and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 35 years old and married with 3 children, ages between 7 and 12 and all currently attending school. He runs a local product store in Waterloo near Freetown. 

Mohamed has been in this business for 10 years and sells cola nuts, groundnuts, garri and coal at his store. His business is the only source of income he has. He says that his business is doing well.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more local products such as cola nuts, groundnuts (peanuts), garri (popular West African food made from cassava tubers) and coal.  Mohamed says that the extra income from this loan will help him support his family health and educate his children. In the future, he would like to be a supplier.

loans.use: To purchase more local products such as cola nuts, groundnuts, garri, and coal.

loans.name: Dal Chini

texts.en:
Dal Chini is 50 years old. She is married and has three children, ages 28, 22, and 12. In 2000, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her store. In the future, Dal Chini plans to improve the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Bernicia

texts.es: Bernicia de 24 años de edad convive con su esposo hace 7 años, ambos vieron nacer 2 hijos de 7 y 3 años. Todos ellos habitan un hogar propio y humilde en la comunidad de Pumpuriani. Berni, como la llaman de cariño, se dedica a la agricultura. Su esposo es el que comanda la producción de sus sembríos que abarcan plátanos, café, cítricos y paltas. Berni por su parte, dirige las labores de su casa y su pequeña tienda de golosinas y gaseosas; de vez en cuando apoya en el campo. Los frutos de los plátanos son cosechados cada quince días, por esa razón no falta ingresos cada dos veces al mes para los bolsillos de ésta joven familia. “En una ocasión perdí 3000 soles por culpa de los gusanos, mis plantas de plátanos crecieron, se volvieron amarillas y ya no dieron frutos”, señala. Ésta mujer emprendedora, más adelante quisiera ampliar su negocio de golosinas y convertirla en una bodega surtida, por que sabe que es muy rentable, así se dedicaría más a sus hijos y hogar. Con mucha ayuda, ésta familia podrá acceder a su crédito número 6 de MFP, capital que están dispuestos a pagar puntualmente. “La ayuda que MFP y mi banco comunal nos brindan significa para nosotros un gran apoyo”, menciona Berni. Con el dinero del préstamo, Berni y su familia podrán limpiar sus terrenos de la “mala hierba” y quitar los arbustos innecesarios, para ello comprarán machetes y pagarán al personal que lo realizará, cuyo pago es de 30 soles diarios por operario. Así también invertirán en semillas de café.
texts.en:
Bernicia, 24, has lived with her husband for seven years; they have two children who are 7 and 3 years old. They all live together in their own, humble home in the community of Pumpuriani.  Berni, as she’s affectionately called, is a farmer.  Her husband is the main force behind the farming which includes bananas, coffee, citrus fruit and avocado.  Berni, on her part, does the household chores and runs a small snack and soft-drinks shop; once in a while she also helps in the fields. 

Bananas are harvested every two weeks so this young family can count on having cash in their pockets at least twice a month.  “On one occasion, I lost 3000 soles because of the worms; my banana plants grew, turned yellow and did not bear fruit,” she indicates.  This enterprising woman would like to expand her snack selling into a full-fledged, well-stocked grocery store because she knows it is very profitable and that way she could dedicate more time to her home and children.  

With much help, this family will be able to access their MFP loan #6, capital that they are determined to repay punctually.  “The support that MFP and my communal bank give me means a great help to us,” Berni mentions.

With the loan money, Berni and her family will be able to clear the “bad weeds” from their fields and remove the unnecessary bushes.  To do so, they will buy machetes and pay labor costs for the personnel that will do the job who are paid 30 soles per day per worker.  They will also buy coffee seeds.

loans.use: to buy machetes and hire day laborers and also to buy coffee seeds.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 48 years old and is a married woman with seven children. She has a sari-sari (variety) store business in Talibon, Bohol. Editha sells items like vinegar, sugar and detergent to the people in her community. Each month, Editha earns 10,000 PHP with her business.

Editha has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as sugar, soy sauce and soap. Editha hopes to continue earning and be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as sugar, soy sauce and soap.

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
Jennie is 43 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Jennie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages . She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 in order to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

Jennie has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jennie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rafael Angel

texts.es:
Rafael de 47 años de edad, originario de la comarca llamada Las Delicias localizada en Yali municipio de Jinotega, se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales uno de ellos estudia  mediante una beca en Cuba y los otros de dos están estudiando para sacerdotes. El tiene 20 años de trabajar en el campo pues fue su padre quien le enseño desde muy joven aprender las labores diarias del campo, sembrando y limpiando áreas de café y siembras de frijoles. Al casarse se independizo de su padre. Cuando no esta trabajando en el área de siembra se dedica a la crianza de ganado.  

El requiere el préstamo para pagar mano de obra en el proceso de corte de café y así brindar empleo a otras personas en la comunidad y al mismo tiempo sacar adelante su siembra de café.  En sus planes futuros quiere ampliar 2 áreas de café para siembra ya que un  rubro con un fuerte mercado.
texts.en:
Rafael is 47 years old and from the Las Delicias region, which is located in the Yali municipality in Jinotega. He is a farmer and has three children, one of whom studies in Cuba through a scholarship, while the other two are studying to be priests. He has worked in the field for twenty years. His father taught him from a young age about the daily tasks of farming – planting and cleaning coffee and bean fields. When he married he became independent from his father. When he is not working in the fields, he raises livestock.

He needs the loan to pay for labor to harvest coffee, and, in this way, offer employment to other people in the community while taking care of his coffee fields. His future plans are to increase his two coffee fields since there is a strong market.

loans.use: to pay for labor.

loans.name: Nasuju

texts.en:
Nasuju is a married woman who has two children who depend on her. She has been practicing cash crop farming for a period of six years.

She learned about KADET through other women registered in her area of residence. This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She wants to use the loan amount to buy farm supplies such as wheat seeds and fertilizers and to hire manpower to aid in the farm work. 

Nasuju hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as wheat seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gbehigbenan 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement GBEHIGBENAN 1 est composé de onze personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Baoun Odette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Baoun Odette est âgée de 56 ans et vit au Bénin. Baoun Odette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Baoun Odette est mariée à un certain Lucien. Le couple a deux enfants dont un est scolarisé. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges, Baoun Odette vend depuis une trentaine d’années environs des condiments et des vivres dans une boutique située à son domicile. Baoun Odette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Baoun Odette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement GBEHIGBENAN 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: GBEHIGBENAN 1 is a group composed of 11 people who all live in the same neighborhood. This is the third time that this group requests a loan from ALIDÉ, in order to increase their business. The group representative, Baoun Odette, is the one raising her hand on the picture. Baoun Odette is 56 and lives in Benin. She never went to school. Baoun Odette is married to a man named Lucien. They have two children, one of whom goes to school. They both take care of the family financially. To contribute to the various expenses, Baoun Odette has been selling food and condiments for about thirty years in a little shop located in her house. Baoun Odette buys those items in a market in Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her sales and her income, Baoun Odette, along with the other members of the GBEHIGBENAN 1 group, is applying for a third loan from ALIDÉ. The first two loans have been successfully paid back.

loans.use: to buy food and condiments.

loans.name: Panda Group

texts.en:
Ika is a widow. She has one child. Her child is 10 years old and still at school. 

She has been selling daily basic needs such as sugar, oil and rice since 2009 from her house. The business is going well but she needs more money to have more variation of goods. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She plans to use her part of loan to buy more sugar, oil and gas. The income that she gets, she will use to fulfill her and her child's daily basic needs and also to pay school fess. 

There are also challenges that she faces like competitors, and sometimes her customers owe her. 

In the future, she wants to have her own store separated from the house. She also wants to have enough savings to give her child a good education even until university.

Other group members will use their parts of the loan to expand their businesses, which sell snacks and clothes on credit.

loans.use: to pay for more sugar, oil and gas.

loans.name: Nogoye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 33 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 24, octobre 2012. Ce banc regroupe des femmes qui habitent dans le même village et ceux des alentours. Une bonne entente les anime. La plupart font du commerce.
Nogoye debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont un garçon. Elle envisage de faire de l'embouche ovine. Elle va acheter 3 moutons à raison de 40000f l'un. Elle les élève jusqu'à la fête de la Tabaski prochaine pour le vendre. Elle va acheter 3 sacs d'aliment de bétail à 40000f pour la nourriture des sujets. Après élevage, elle compte vendre un mouton à 80000f.
Les bénéfices escomptés lui permettront de prendre ne charge les besoins de la famille car ne voulant plus dépendre de personne. Elle soutien ses enfants dans leurs besoins scolaires.
texts.en:
This group of 33 women belongs to the village finance group created on October 24th, 2012. The group is composed of women living in one village and its area. The women get along very well. Most of them are in retail.

Nogoye, the group’s star borrower, is standing to the right in the picture and raising her hand. She is 37 years old. She is married and mother to four children, one of them a boy. She plans to raise sheep. She will purchase three sheep at 40,000 XOF each. She will fatten them until the coming festival of Tabaski (Eid al-Adha), for which she will resell them. She will also purchase three bag of ovine feed, for 40,000 XOF each, to feed her animals. After raising them, she plans on selling each sheep for 80,000 XOF.

The profits will allow her to take care of her family, as she does not want to depend on anyone anymore. She supports her children with their school expenses.

loans.use: to buy three sheep.

loans.name: Himbarwa Group

texts.fr:
Louise  fait parti du groupe Himbarwa et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 35 ans et est mariée à Sébastien, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  6 enfants âgés de 4 à 15 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de bière de banane depuis 10 ans.

Elle est à son quatrième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, elle  va augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bière de banane  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Louise is a member of the Himbarwa group and lives in Gitega. She is 35 years old and is married to a Sebastien, a farmer. Together, they have six children, aged from four to 15 years old. 

Louise has been selling banana beer for ten years. She is on her fourth loan with Turame. 

With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital to buy a large quantity of banana beer, which she will resell to earn more.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of banana beer to resell

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a thirty-three year old charismatic young woman and a strong example of hard work. 

She is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps cows and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Monica makes a commission on managing the logistics of sales between local farmers and their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work. 

Given that Monica can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy more cereal produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Monica's clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood.

Support her dream by giving Monica a loan during this festive season!

loans.use: To buy cereals from farmers to resell.

loans.name: Trinidad De Los Anjeles

texts.es:
Durante muchos años, Trinidad salía a las 4: 00 am a pescar junto con su esposo, pues era el día a día de su familia y fue lo que ayudó a sus ocho hijos convertirse en profesionales. Sin embargo, no fue hasta hace seis años, que esta emprendedora decidió establecer su propia pulpería para cambiar de ambiente y evitar el peligro que contenía pescando. Ahora eta comerciante de 47 años de edad, muestra con una sonrisa lo feliz que se siente de haber tomado esa decisión. 
Trinidad cuenta con la ayuda moral y económica de su esposo, pues su lazo matrimonial ha estado lleno de armonía y de mutuo apoyo. Además, también recibe remeses de unos familiares del extranjero. Razón por la cual no duda en invertir en su negocio, de manera que solicita un préstamo para comprar jabón, pan, detergente, azúcar, arroz, carnes, entre otros productos de alta demanda en su negocio y más en esta temporada navideña, donde las ventas aumentan. En un futuro planea tener una distribuidora y comprar otra casa.

loans.use: Comprar jabón, pan, detergente, azúcar, arroz, carnes, entre otros productos.

loans.name: Idd

texts.en: Idd lives in Lumo, Temeke District of Dar es Salaam. He is married with three children. Idd sells used clothes. He buys these clothes from wholesalers, mends them in his tailoring workshop in a rented premise near his home, and resells them in retail. Most used clothes need some modification before a resale. Some are undersized, oversized or torn. Idd owns one old sewing machine. He is planning to expand his business. He needs one more modern sewing machine. The new machine will increase the speed of repairing the clothes and hence efficiency. He is also planning to employ one assistant to facilitate his mission.

loans.use: ADD STOCK OF USED CLOTHES

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace would like to buy three steers

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Komi T., 47, has two wives, eight children, and is the guardian of two other children who are orphans. He works primarily as a farmer but in a location where problems of terrain present themselves harshly. Lacking arable land, he is obliged to lease land for his crops, meaning that it is very costly for him.

To address this situation and to better serve his customer base, he is requesting a loan of $1,000. He will then be able to acquire cassava stems for planting and also to buy land for cultivation. Once his plans are realized, his living conditions will change.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 47 ans, Monsieur T. Komi a deux (02) femmes, huit (08) enfants et a à sa charge deux autres enfants orphelins. Il a comme principale activité l’agriculture mais dans un milieu où le problème de terrain se pose avec acuité. A défaut de terrain cultivable, il est obligé de louer des terrains pour son agriculture. Ce qui fait que le coût lui revient très cher.

Pour remédier à cet état de chose et mieux servir ses clientes, il sollicite un crédit de $1000. Ce qui lui permettra de s’approvisionner en tige de manioc et à acheter un terrain culturel. Une fois ce projet réalisé ses conditions de vie vont changer.

loans.use: Buying arable land and cassava stems for planting

loans.name: Ayawovi Doris

texts.fr:
Born in Vogan on December 20, 1979, Ms. Ayawovi Doris K. currently lives in Afagnan. She is married and cares for her mother and younger sister. The sale of dinnerware and plastic buckets is her daily activity. In business for over 15 years now, she has become a master of her trade. Since her arrival in Afagnan, she has successfully increased her clientele, which now requires her to increase her sales capacity. She buys merchandise from Lomé and sells it at her Afagnan location. She is now seeking a loan of $800 to buy merchandise in bulk in Lomé, in hopes of achieving higher sales. Increased sales would allow her to cover the costs of her sister's schooling and take care of her mother.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Vogan le 20 décembre 1979, Madame K. Ayawovi Doris vit actuellement à Afagnan. Mariée, elle a à sa charge sa mère et sa petite sœur. La vente des assiettes et des seaux en plastique reste son activité quotidienne. Plus de 15 ans déjà, elle a une maîtrise parfaite de son commerce. Depuis son arrivée à Afagnan, elle a réussi à augmenter l’effectif de ses clients, ce qui l’oblige à agrandir sa capacité de vente. Elle achète ses marchandises de Lomé et revient les vendre sur place à Afagnan. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite ce financement de $800 pour acheter en gros à Lomé, afin d’espérer une bonne vente. A partir de ses nouveaux chiffres d’affaire, elle pourra mieux prendre en charge sa sœur en scolarité et sa mère.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of dinnerware

loans.name: Fiorentina Laurencia

texts.en: Fiorentina is 37 years old, married, and the mother of six children. Her husband is a mechanic and is working in a motor repair company. The couple wants to start an auto repair shop where they can sell motor parts and other accessories like motor oil, tires, spark plugs, and so forth. Given this loan, Fiorentina and her husband will be independent and able to better provide for their large family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase motor oil, spark plugs, tires and other products to start an auto repair shop

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Poverty remains widespread in Thiaroye-sur-Mer but the hardworking inhabitants struggle daily to improve their lot. The five entrepreneurs who form the Diappo Liggueye Cooperative are asking for a loan to support their various businesses. These fall into three categories: fruit juice and ice cream sales, cloth dyeing, and operating a general store selling vegetables, fish and sundries. These diversified businesses will share the loan according to the following budget:

Ice Cream and Juice Sales

Purchase of refrigerator: 200,000 CFA

Stock: 45,000 CFA

Operating expenses: 20,000 CFA

Subtotal: 265,000 CFA

Cloth Dyeing

Dyestuffs: 50,000 CFA

Cloth: 150,000 CFA

Subtotal: 200,000 CFA

General Store

Merchandise: 150,000 CFA

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

La commune d’arrondissement de Thiaroye sur mer est une commune où sévit encore la pauvreté. Mais la population très travailleuse lutte chaque jour pour sortir de cette situation. C’est ce contexte de lutte contre la pauvreté que les membres du gie diappo liggueye qui ont pour objectif le progrès socio économique de ses membre en particulier s’est inscrit dans e projet et sollicite vote appui. Les activités tournent globalement autour du commerce .les cinq bénéficiaires sont déjà actives et compte renforcer leurs activités voir les diversifier.. ce prêt sera divisé entre les cinq bénéficiaire . Nous aurons le groupe de Celles qui ferons de la transformation de produits locaux en jus de fruit. Celles qui feront seront dans le commerce de légumes et des produits halieutiques et produit divers .et celles qui seront dans la teinture et la ventes des tissus teints

1ere activité : vente de jus de fruit et de crème glacées : Achat d’un réfrigérateur 200 000 f cfa Produits 45 000 f cfa Fonds de roulement 20 000 f cfa Soit un sous total de 265 000 fcfa 2eme activité : teinture et vente de tissu Matériel de teinture : 50 000 fcfa Consommables (tissu,produit de teinture etc …) : 150 000 fca Soit un sous total de 20 000 fca 3eme activité : vente de légumes , produit halieutique et produit divers Achat marchandises :150 000 fcfa Soit un sous total de 150 000 fcfa

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and stock it with juice and ice cream; to buy fabric and dye; and to stock a general store.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Mrs. Lang T., 32, is a mother of two children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works as a labourer making burnt brick, earning around $2/day, while her husband is now unemployed. One of her children is a student and another one is also unemployed. Mrs. Lang T. would like to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business, which would significantly help her and her family generate more income. She hopes the loan will assist in increasing her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Zulfia

texts.en:
Zulfia T. is a 34 year-old loving mother of two children,  the younger is only 4 years old. Her husband is a mechanic. 

For more than 6 years Zulfia is selling the fish in the central fish market of the city. She is pictured with her customers at her fish stall. When she started she had only US$300 in turnover. With time her business expanded and today it is quite a stable business with a working capital of US$2,000. 

Zulfia is requesting US$500 for 12 months. She wants to purchase fish in bulk for selling in the spring season, when fishing is prohibited. Zulfia has already received previous loans from IMON and shown herself to be a reliable client. She would to thank everyone for their support.

loans.use: Purchasing fish wholesale

loans.name: Domina

texts.en:
Greetings from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Domina A. is 30 years old. She is married and has children, who are ages 4 and 10.

In 2005, Domina established a stationary and secretarial business. Domina has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA. She now requests a new loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her stationary and secretarial shop

loans.name: Maria Asencion

texts.es:
Maria C. started her clothing and shoe business in her home 8 years ago because she needed to work and had always wanted to have and manage her own company. She likes the sale of clothing and shoes because it produces good profits. Her home expenses had been increasing and her husband’s salary was rapidly used up among the expenses of the 4 children and the outstanding bills.

In time and through her hard work she was able to start two other business locations outside of her home. She divides her time during the week among the three locales thus being able to cover the sale days in those neighborhoods. This keeps her merchandise moving and she does not have to wait for someone to come to her house to purchase it.

She needs a loan of USD $575 which she will repay in six months. This will allow her to buy more merchandise to fill outstanding orders. Let us help Maria to continue to prosper,

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

María C. comenzó hace mas de 8 años con el negocio de la ropa y calzado, en su propia casa dado que tenia la necesidades trabajar en algo y siempre quiso tener su propio negocio y administrarlo, y le gusta la venta de ropa y calzado porque produce buenas ganancia, además los gastos en casa eran cada vez mayores y el sueldo de su esposo se acababa muy rápido entre los gastos de sus 4 hijos y las cuentas por pagar.

Con el tiempo producto de su esfuerzo y ahorros pude poner otros 2 negocios fuera de su casa, entre los tres puntos de venta se va rotando los días de la semana, para poder cubrir los días de venta que hay en esas colonias, de esa manera su mercancía siempre tiene movimiento y no tiene que estar esperando a que alguien vaya a su casa comprar su mercancía.

Necesita de US $575 que pagara en 6 meses este crédito le va ayudar para poder comprar mas mercancía ya que tiene varios pedidos por surtir. Ayudemos a María para que pueda seguir prosperando.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana has a business selling second hand clothing at a busy market in the town of Nadvirna in western Ukraine. She has been in business for four years and has developed a successful enterprise, selling a good variety of clothes at reasonable prices. Oksana’s decision to start her business was influenced by her sister who also sells second hand clothing. Oksana is not married. Her business has been a good source of income for her to support herself.

Oksana has requested a loan of 5000 Ukrainian Griven to purchase a new supply of second hand clothing inventory for her business. This is a busy time of year for clothing vendors like Oksana. The ability to purchase a bulk supply of clothing will help her maximize her profits and continue to earn a good income.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo used to work as an employee in a private home, but as time passed she realized that her income, even though it was secure, was not sufficient to cover her family's expenses. What's more, she didn't like having to depend on a fixed salary. At that time, her primary need was to pay for her debts and her children's schooling, so she began to sell meals which she prepared in her home and then sold. She saved enough to purchase a taco cart which she set up outside of her home. Thanks to her hard work and dedication she has been able to increase her sales.

Consuelo is requesting a loan, which she will repay in 5 months, so she can put a bigger roof over her cart, as well as purchase chairs and tables and offer better service to her customers. Your help will make this possible.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

Consuelo laboraba como empleada de confianza en un domicilio particular, pero con el paso del tiempo observó que sus ingresos, si bien eran seguros, no eran suficiente para solventar los gastos familiares, además de que no le gustaba depender solamente de un salario fijo determinado. en ese momento, su necesidad primordial era pagar sus deudas y el estudio de sus hijos, por lo que comenzó a vender comidas que elaboraba en su propio domicilio, hasta que a base de ahorrar pudo comprar un carrito para tacos que instalo fuera de su casa, gracias a su empeño y dedicación ha logrado incrementar sus ventas.

Solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 5 meses para colocar un techo más amplio a su carrito de tacos, así como para adquirir mesas y sillas para sus clientes y ofrecer mejor servicio. Con tu apoyo esto será posible

loans.use: TO PUT A ROOF OVER HER SMALL TACO CART, AND PURCHASE TABLES AND CHAIRS SO THAT SHE CAN OFFER BETTER SERVICE TO HER CUSTOMERS.

loans.name: Zareena M.nawaz Group

texts.en:
Zareena baji is the wife of M. and has lived in the city of Kasur, Pakistan for the last 25 years. She is 4 years younger than her husband and the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. She has a two room brick house. Her husband is famous for his samosas, the well known Punjabi food. Zareena baji is applying for a loan to expand her husband’s business.

There are five other women who are members of the loan group. Suraiya baji wants the loan to improve her food business. Shahnaz baji wants to buy a horse cart and Uzma baji wants to expand her oil business. Kosar baji will expand her sewing machine business and Shamim baji wants to repair her auto-rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members and each woman will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans and if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand and improve their businesses.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two daughters. She owns a small business and works in the central city market of Pavlograd, in the so-called Trade Gallery. Irina sells women's teenage clothing items. All her merchandise is very high quality and can meet varying customers' demands. Irina started her business 11 years ago. Currently, she has about $9000 invested in inventory. Her monthly income is about $1000. 

Irina has proved to be a very reliable client. Her venture has been growing consistently into a stable and sustainable business. Irina likes to move on and not just be satisfied with present successes. She is hoping additional funding will help her re-stock her inventory and construct a new vending kiosk in the same market. She is requesting a 3000 Grivna ($US675) loan to implement these goals.  

Note: This is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for clothing sales.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio P. Tebalán is 29 years old and from the village of Chirrenox in the municipality of San Francisco in the department of Totonicapan. His family makes canvas trousers, and he works in his father's workshop. He came to the offices of ASDIR so that we could provide a loan for him to launch his own studio. With his acquired knowledge and the help of his wife and family, he will be able to launch such as business.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Antonio P. Tebalán de 29 años de la aldea Chirrenox municipio de San Francisco el Alto departamento de Totonicapán. La familia de dicha persona se dedica a la confección de pantalones de lona, él trabaja como operario en el taller de su padre, acude a las oficinas de ASDIR para que podamos brindarle un crédito para emprender su taller, con el conocimiento adquirido y con la ayuda de su esposa y familia podrán emprender tal negocio.

loans.use: To start his own tailoring studio.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: Nicolasa es natural del distrito de Cuyo Cuyo, con el fin de buscar mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos, decidió radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca, desde entonces se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas en forma ambulatoria, por las diferentes arterias de la ciudad.Pese a sus bajos recursos económicos, viene solventado los gastos de los estudios superiores a sus 2 hijos,  quienes  en sus horas libres la apoyan habidamente en su negocio y le corresponden su esfuerzo, con un buen rendimiento en sus estudios.En estos momentos, Nicolasa, solicita este préstamo para aumentar el volumen de mercadería, está segura que haciendo esta inversión aumentarán sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is from the district of Cuyo Cuyo, with the goal of increasing her quality of life and her childrens’, she decided to move to the city of Juliaca, since then she sells fruits and vegetables in different areas of the city. In spite of her low economic resources, she has been covering the education expenses of her two children, who help her in their free time and make her efforts worthwhile by having good results in school. At this moment, Nicolasa requests this loan to increase the merchandise volume, she is certain that with this investment her income will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.en:
S. Zuhra is 35 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Difficult living conditions for the family forced her husband to leave for Russia to earn a living. For 8 years, she has had a small business drying and processing apricots. Dried fruit, especially dried apricots, is very popular in Tajikistan. Apricots are also very healthy. Considering the constant demand for this kind of goods, Zuhra is quite successful and earns a steady and stable income for the family. Her business allows Zuhra to contribute significantly to the household and education of her dearest children.

Zuhra requests a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750). She plans to purchase more apricots to dry and process to sell. Zuhra expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her, so she can keep working.

loans.use: Purchase more apricots to process and sell

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo D. est une commerçante dynamique. Elle est revendeuse des légumes  au marché de Wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Cette activité étant sa principale source de revenu, elle souhaite accroître sa capacité avec le crédit qu’il va bénéficier. Adjo espère améliorer ses conditions de vie avec cette opportunité
texts.en:
Adjo D. is an energetic merchant, a retailer of vegetables at the marketplace of Wome, a village located about 130 km from Lomé, which is the capital of Togo. This business being her principal source of income, she would like to grow her capacity by using the loan obtained. Adjo hopes to improve her living conditions with this opportunity.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Eveline K. is an entrepreneur woman. She runs a grocery store and sells chips in Mwinyi Road Street in Dar es Salaam city center. The business requires big capital because demand is high due to the store's central location.

Eveline requests a loan of TZS 800,000 (USD$650) to buy more stock to meet the customers' demand.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La Señora de nombre Maria de los Ángeles U. Solís tiene la edad 53 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Maria tiene 2 hijos de los cuales sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor 33 años que cursa el 4 año de secundaria y asiste a clases por la noches ya que el trabaja y su hijo menor de 14 años y cursa el 5 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora es comerciante y tiene un  negocio propio donde vende los productos de gas butano y licorería, sus propósitos son de sacar adelante a su hijo para que pueda de ser un buen provecho para el día de mañana  sus deseos son tener mas vida para terminar la tarea de educar a sus hijos y no sean personas irresponsables y puedan ser provechosas para la sociedad y sus sueños proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que esta permanezca bonita para sus hijos y estos puedan vivir cómodamente y que obtengan las mejores condiciones de vida.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería donde vende los productos como: golosinas, gaseosas, refrescos naturales y pan, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación en chichigalpa, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 5 años, ella inicia este negocio por la necesidad de obtener un trabajo y decide establecer un pequeño negocio por lo que necesitaba mantener a su familia y salir adelante y decide invertir en golosinas de lo que recibió una excelente repuesta de los clientes que en su mayoría eran niños y así es como decide empezar un medio de trabajo para lograr que este le genere ganancias a su familia, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de sus productos y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y seguir proporcionando ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria de los Ángeles U. Solís is 53 years old. She is married and has 2 children. The older one is 33 years old and he’s attending his 4th year at night secondary school as he works during the day. She has another boy, a 14 year old attending his 5th year in primary school. Her husband is a business man. He owns a liquor store and he also sells butane gas. Her purpose is to provide his younger son with a good education so he can take advantage of that in the future. Her wish is to have a longer life, to educate his children to be responsible and useful to society. She also wants to make home improvements so their children can have a nice house to live in, a house where they can feel comfortable and to have better living conditions. She owns a grocery shop at home where she sells products such as, candy, sodas, natural beverages and bread. The shop is located in the city of Chichigalpa. She's had this business for 5 years. She opened this business because she needed a job. She stated selling candy in a small shop to support her family. As the business stated to improve and she became popular among her customers, mostly children, she decided to expand the business to generate a better income. Financing will be used for work capital as she needs to purchase more products to satisfy her customer's demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida O. is a 43 year old woman. She is widowed and a mother of three kids. Through hard work Vida has supported the oldest child to the polytechnic, one child in the senior high school and her last born is still in the junior high. Vida resides at Abuakwa with her family. She said she was born there and since then she has not actually traveled apart from the surrounding towns. Her husband died painfully through a prolonged sickness. She was almost in tears when we were talking because she believes he has left so much responsibility on her.

She is a food vendor who sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch or supper. 

Vida wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her youngest children especially in their education. 

She hopes to receive a loan of GH¢600 to expand her business by increasing her inventory. This would enable her save more to support the Children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa P. is from Pandan, Antique. She belongs to Mag-aba Center 21, a group organized by ASHI. She is blessed with 7 children and married to a fisherman.

She started vending food to crewmen of boats docked in their village. Later on she decided to set up a food stall so that she can be more accessible to her growing customers, which also include the students.  She is requesting for a loan of PhP 5,000 to increase her working capital in her food vending business.
  
Mrs. P. plans to have a small restaurant in their place. She also dreams that someday through her business, her children will finish their studies and also be able to renovate their house.  Through  ASHI she realized that she has already overcome her fear of socializing with other people. She also became a member of Philhealth (a healthplan program of the government).

loans.use: Food Vending

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther J.  is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Esther is 38 years old and is married to a husband who is a medical doctor. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a bar for sale point

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama J. was born in Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone. She is a divorcee with two children to look after. Adama sells market food and has been in this business for over seven years now. Adama is very grateful to SMT  for the previous loans. Previous loans through SMT have created a meaningful impact in the business and life of Adama. 

Having repaid previous loan successfully, she is now requesting a new one in order to further strengthen her business. With this loan and the income it will generate for her, she will be able to repay the loan, feed herself and children, and pay school fees and other school-related charges for the children.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Oyinkansola

texts.en: Oyinkansola is 32 years old and married with two children.  She sells jewelery and cosmetics for a living. She started this business in 2001.  She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more jewelery and cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Mrs Jocelyn T. is 39 years old, married with three children, and currently living in Dicayas, Dipolog City. Her husband has no regular job, but works as a farmer or makes 'tuba', the native coconut wine, in order to alleviate their way of living. Many root crops and bananas grow in their backyard and these are an additional source of income. Jocelyn applied immediately for membership of Kiva partner, PMPC, in order to have additional capital for her existing business. Now she is requesting 5000 PHP in order to buy additional kilos of meat and ingredients for her barbecue-selling business. Her hope is that all her children can finish college.

loans.use: To purchase meat and other ingredients

loans.name: Percy

texts.en: Percy A. is 49 years old and resides in Lingating Baungon, Bukidnon. She has two children who both go to school. Her husband is engaged in the buying and selling of livestock. Even though they have her husband's income, she choose to put up a variety store to have extra earnings. Percy is applying for a loan with HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to purchase additional goods because she want to expand her store and make it better. Percy is hoping for improvement of her business with the assistance of the organization.

loans.use: Purchase addtional items for her variety store

loans.name: Vakhila

texts.en:
Vakhila J. runs a small grocery store, selling a wide variety of foodstuffs, including canned foods, soft drinks, juices, sweets, tea, coffee, etc. She has been in this business for about four years. She is married and has eight children. One of her goals is to be able to improve her living conditions.

Vakhila has requested a loan of $1,200 to buy additional foodstuffs, in order to increase the range of her goods. The loan will help her increase her income and continue to operate a stable, sustainable business.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase beans and maize flour to sell. Poni is 27 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a sewing machine.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase beans and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Nelylyn

texts.en:
Nelylyn is a petite mother of three kids. She lives in the small agricultural town of Balubad in Silang, Cavite together with her husband and children. She is 25 years old. Nelylyn is a multi-micro-entrepreneur with a farming business on their small parcel of land as well as a small junk shop. She has been successfully juggling the operation of both businesses while raising her three children. She is a natural businessperson, with the nose for potential transactions and a heart for clients. She is also a loving mother with a big dream for her family's future.

Her farming business grows vegetables such as lettuce and mustard, and fruits such as bananas and coffee. She changes produce according to the season so the business always has income. Her husband helps her with the farming, but Nelylyn operates the junk shop on her own. She travels around the town in her tribike buying scraps and bottles, and almost anything that can be resold to recycling factories. From the junk shop, she earns a monthly income of P2,000, a small amount for so much effort.

This loan will be used to buy organic fertilizer for her vegetable farm. She will also be using some of the loan to buy more scrap for her junk shop.

Nelylyn is a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT), a Filipino family-oriented and Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates equal business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions.  www.cct.org.ph

loans.use: Organic fertilizer and scraps

loans.name: Julia Alicia

texts.es:
Julia  es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar II.
Julia es casada, tiene 55 años y 11 hijos, Julia vive en la comunidad de Huayllapampa, se dedica a la compra y venta de tara, cochinilla, también arrienda terrenos de donde cosecha estos productos, además en épocas de producción de tuna compra y vende esta fruta.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tara.
Los sueños de Julia son que sus 2 hijos menores concluyan sus estudios.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Communal Bank “Bienestar II.” Julia is married, 55 years old and has 11 children. Julia lives in the Huayllapampa community. She buys and sells tara, prickly pear cactus, and she rents land where she grows these products. In addition, she seasonally grows and sells prickly pear fruit. Julia needs a loan for 1050 soles to invest in buying tara. Julia dreams that her 2 youngest children finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tara

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita B. is from the village of Buyog, Banlag, Valencia City. She is 45 years old. Charlita is married and has three grown children. To make a living, Charlita operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling scrap metal, charcoal and firewood in the local community. Charlita has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Charlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Charlita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Charlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a warehouse and charcoal

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
B. Juliet is the leader of her lending group in Ntungamo. She is 58 years old and a widow with 6 children between the ages of 20 and 14. She is also the caretaker for two of her grandparents.

B. has been operating a bar, a hotel and a retail shop in the Itojo trading center for 23 years now. Although she makes 130,000 Ugandan shillings in profits per week, the combination of her debt and overhead costs are still more than her income, which forces her to continue to borrow from Pearl microfinance.

Juliet has a dream of expanding her businesses in order to put her children through school. She needs a loan to purchase inventory: crates of beverages.

loans.use: To purchase inventory (crates of beverages).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilisers.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en: Aidah is 37 years old and married with five children aged between 3 and 16 years.  All her children attend school. She resides and owns a four room house where she is staying with seven people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.  She owns a stall selling bananas and doesn’t pay for transport costs to and from shopping as she buys from the very market where she works.  On average she receives about 20 customers a day. She works in the out skirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for eight years ,servicing her seventeenth loan, working with the same group mates. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication. Her challenges include defaulters and rainy season because when it rains very few customers come to her stall because it is in muddy place. Aidah wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas. She aspires to see her business grow stronger and wants to start buying from farmers directly.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas for resale

loans.name: Di Woho Ni Group

texts.en:
Doris is 50 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade, a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She is a trader in second-hand clothes.

Doris (pictured middle) is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Di woho ni’, meaning 'be disciplined'. Most of the group members are engaged in trading or farming activities. The group members are requesting a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 39 years old and she is married with four children. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She sells household items in front of her house and, with the business, she is able to assist her family's basic needs and other necessities.

With the loan of N50,000, she plans to expand her business, which is now booming. With this kind of business she hopes to increase her earnings in the long run and be able to provide better for her children's education. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more household items to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
la sra. Gloria Z. T. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la colonia la Era de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas de maiz, tiene varios años de experiencia en elaborar tortillas, tiene clientes fijos los cuales son vecinos cercanos a la casa de habitacion y tambien varios negocios de cafeterias y pulperias.
ahora no se da abasto con toda la produccion que tiene , esta produciendo muy poco y para eso necesita el credito para comprar mas materia prima para la elaboracion de las tortillas.
esta espoca es de mucha demanda y quiere cumplir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
su meta a es arreglar su casa y que sea muy comoda para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria Z. T. is 41 years old. She lives in the Era district of the city of Tegucigalpa. She works making and selling corn tortillas. She has many years of experience making tortillas. She has steady customers who are close neighbors and also various businesses, cafeterias and shops.

Right now, she can’t cope with all the work that she has. She is making very little, and therefore needs a loan to buy more raw materials to make her tortillas.

This is a season of high demand, and she wants to meet all the needs of her customers.

Her goal is to sort out her home so that it is very comfortable for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, water, firewood and lime

loans.name: Mrs. Dany Prak Village Bank Group
