texts.en: This village bank consists of eleven people and is located in Chumrov Village in Takoe Province. The members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Dany P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a silk weaver in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to weave for her customers. Her husband, Mr. Chev Kil, is a farmer who owns a 0.3-hectare field for cultivating rice. Mrs. Dany P. has four children, one of whom helps her in the current business (silk weaving), while two of the others are attending the local school and the youngest one, at five years old, is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave for her customers

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene L. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin province. She is 30 years old. Charlene is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Charlene owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Charlene has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Charlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Charlene is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Charlene from HSPFI.  

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 41-year-old married man, who has four children in school. His business is named Eastlanders Auto Care, where he provides mechanical and panel beating services. He has employed two people. His business is favored because it is located along a busy road with heavy traffic. He has been running the business for 15 years and previously used to do sugarcane farming. Faulu Kenya has helped his business expand and gain customers. Peter has requested a 40,000 KES loan so as to buy a compressor machine and assorted tools. His hope is to set up a large business. He describes himself as dedicated to a better future.

loans.use: To purchase a compressor machine and assorted tools

loans.name: Lucerito Group

texts.es:
La señora Asunción  Graciela  R. Ramírez es casada  tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la colonia de San Miguel Xico, esto en Valle de Chalco Solidaridad, en  el estado de México; tiene 4 hijos los cuales 2 de ellos están en edad escolar, Su esposo es albañil y para obtener otros ingresos, ella inicia trabajando con una señora vendiendo  antojitos mexicanos en ese momento le ayudo porque con lo que ganaba le ayudaba a su esposo para los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos y al parecer todo estaba bien, hasta que con el tiempo comenzó a sentirse mal y acude al medico en donde le dicen que tiene una infección severa y se  estaban afectando los riñones  y era necesario estar en tratamiento al no contar con ningún seguro médico los costos se elevaban, realmente no contaba con recursos económicos, por lo que busco otras alternativas medicas, fue esta actividad la que le ayudo en su recuperación tanto en su salud como económicamente, un familiar le presto un poco de dinero que le sirviera como primer inversión, de ahí se ha hecho de clientes, su necesidad en este momento es de capital y poder incrementar su inversión, teniendo mayores ganancias que le ayudara en remodelar un espacio en su casa y le sirva como local en donde guarde y venda sus productos; de las ganancias que obtendrá es para pagar los estudios de sus 2 hijos.
Ella al igual que otros compañeros se unen formando un grupo para solicitar un crédito a través de  Fundación Realidad e invertir en las diferentes actividades que tienen como son: 
Ángela D. O. venta de chiles y semillas.
Asunción Graciela R. Ramírez venta de productos nutricionales.
Ernestina Ramírez Méndez  venta de ropa.
Jessica Vázquez Hernández venta de ropa.
María Antonia R. Ramírez venta de antojitos.
Iris Violeta O. S.  taller de costura.
Julia Martínez Hernández  venta de  fruta y legumbres.
Francisca Hernández T. Estética.
María Del Carmen González M. venta por catalogo.
María Antonieta Martínez M. venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Asunción Graciela R. Ramírez is 41 years old and married. She lives in the San Miguel Xico settlement, which is in the Chalco Solidaridad Valley in the state of México. She has four children; two of them are school age. Her husband is a bricklayer. To get other income she started working with another woman selling snacks. At that time this really helped because her earnings helped her husband with the school expenses for her children. It seemed that all was well. In time she started to feel bad, and she went to the doctor. They told her that she has a severe infection that is affecting her kidneys, and she needed to be in treatment. Not having medical insurance, the costs elevated. She did not have economic resources, so she looked for medical alternatives. It was this activity that helped in the recovery of her health as much as economically. A relative lent her a little money, which served as her first investment. Then she got customers. Now she needs money to be able to increase her investment. She has greater earnings, which will help her to remodel a space in her house. This will serve as the place where she keeps and sells her products. Her earnings will pay for the education of her two children. She is like the other colleagues who come together in a group to request a loan from the Fundación Realidad. They will use the loan to invest in their different businesses. They are: Ángela D. O.: Sells chiles and seeds Asunción Graciela R. Ramírez: Sells nutricional products Ernestina Ramírez Méndez: Sells clothes Jessica Vázquez Hernández: Sells clothes María Antonia R. Ramírez: Sells snacks. Iris Violeta O. S.: Seamstress shop Julia Martínez Hernández: Sells fruit and vegetable Francisca Hernández T.: Beauty salon María Del Carmen González M.: Catalog sales. María Antonieta Martínez M.: Sells clothes

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food, clothes, snack, and other things

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Reynaldo Salvador

texts.es:
El  señor Reynaldo Salvador M., se dedica a la compra venta de productos lácteos, es casado tiene tres hijos ninguno vive con él. El negocio lo tiene ubicado dentro del mercado bisne en el sector del queso y es administrado por él y su esposa.

El  señor Reynaldo tiene más de cuatro años de trabajar                  con nosotros lleva  23 créditos,  durante todo este tiempo  ha demostrado ser una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, el crédito lo utiliza para comprar de lácteos y así mantener inventario en el negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Reynaldo Salvador M. buys and sells dairy products. He is married with three children, none of whom live with him. His business, which is run by him and his wife, is located inside the Bisne Market in the cheese area. Mr. Reynaldo has been working with us for the past four years and has obtained 23 loans. During all this time, he has made it evident that he is hard working and responsible. The loan will be used to buy dairy products in order to maintain the inventory of the business.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory of cheese, curds and cream

loans.name: Rakai

texts.en:
Rakai C. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut paste at the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more groundnuts to make paste to sell.  Rakai is 41 years old and is married to a builder. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more groundnuts to make paste to sell

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim A. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and beans. Shamim is 40 years old and is widowed. She has one child and her child does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of rice and beans

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: EL SEÑOR RUBEN ES CASADO SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA YA HACE BASTANTE TIEMPO EL INICIO SU VENTA CON UN CAPITAL MINIMO E INGRESOS RELATIVOS YA CON EL TIEMPO Y CON MUCHO SACRIFICIO LOGRO COMPRAR EL KIOSKO EN EL QUE ACTUALMENTE TIENE SU VENTA Y TIENE INGRESOS PARA PODER MANTENER A LOS HIJOS QUE TIENE LOS CUALES ESTUDIAN EN EL ESCUELA Y EN SU TIEMPO LIBRE AYUDAN EN LA ATENCION DE LOS CLIENTES Y SU ESPOSA LE AYUDA EN LA ELABORACION DE LOS PLATOS QUE OFRECEN. EL SEÑOR TIENE MUCHAS METAS PROYECTADAS UNA DE ELLAS ES LA DE COMPRAR UN KIOSKO MAS AMPLIO PARA SATISFACER  A MAS CLIENTES CON SUS DELICIOSOS PLATOS DIARIOS, CON EL DINEROP DEL C REDITO COMPRARA UN REFRIGERADOR Y ASI MANTENER SUS PRODUCTOS FRESCOS, ES UN APERSONA JOVEN RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA CON MUCHAS GANAS DE SUPERACION Y ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Ruben is married, and his business is selling food. Quite a long time ago, he began his business with minimal capital and a small income. Over time, with much sacrifice, he was able to buy the kiosk where he currently sells his products. He now has sufficient income to support his children, who are in school. His children also help serve customers in their free time, and his wife helps prepare the dishes they offer. Ruben has many goals for the future; one of them is to buy a larger kiosk so that he can satisfy more customers with his delicious daily meals. With the funds from the loan, he will buy a refrigerator, so that he can keep his products fresh. He is a responsible and hard-working young man with a great desire to improve his life, and he is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence placed in him in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a refrigerator

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.en:
Claribel is the coordinator of her group, Las M., and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, an area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.
Claribel is excited to be taking her tenth loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing a machine to impress metal to make jewelry and the metal to use in the machine. She will use her profits to invest in the re-modelling of her home and school supplies for her children. She would also like to save to travel to the US to visit her family there. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase a machine with which to make jewelry and the metal to use in it

loans.name: Rosa  Dorila

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 31 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos. Es comerciante hace más de 6 años, trabaja con una clientela formada en las ciudades como Piribebuy Eusebio Ayala, Itacurubi, y otros, hasta donde viaja junto a sus clientes.
Sus clientes constantemente acuden a ella para solicitarle algún tipo de prenda de vestir que está a la moda y para no peder clientela ella debe entregar a tiempo todos sus pedidos.  
Con los préstamos que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo compra jeans que tenia como pedido y ademas pudo ampliar su zona de ventas y llegar a más personas en distintas ciudades y  hacer frente a la numerosa demanda de los clientes y la competencia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 31 years old, married and has 3 children. She has been a merchant for more than 6 years with a customer base in the cities of Piribebuy, Eusebio, Ayala, Itacurubi, and others to which she travels for her customers.

Her customers are constantly requesting some sort of garment of clothing that is in fashion, and so as not to lose customers, she has to fill all their orders.

With the loans that she obtained from Fundación Paraguaya, she could buy jeans to fill orders and also expand her sale area, reach more people in distant cities and meet the demand of her customers and competition.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase women's and men's jeans

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is involved in a cloth selling business. She buys cloth from Faisalabad (which is famous for its textile industry) and sells in different markets of her city. She lives in the small city of Vehari, which is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. She has three children: two boys and a girl. One of them is four years old and not yet started going to school; the other two are getting their education. 

Safia wants her children to complete their education and for this she works very hard. She is applying for a loan because she wants more variety in her stock. She will buy high quality fabric which can earn her more money.

loans.use: To purchase cloth in bulk to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita E. is from the village of  Consolacion, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 49 years old. Rosita is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Consolacion, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 48 years old. He is married with 7 children aged between 5 and 27. Five of the children attend school.

He is a farmer from the town of Kisii in Western Kenya. He has been farming for the last 20 years and employs 2 people from his community. His products are milk, tea, maize and beans which he sells locally. He also owns and operates a small restaurant in the same area (pictured above).

Peter has requested this loan of KES.30,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will increase his capital base and that the profits from the sale of milk will enable him to send his children to better schools.

In future, he hopes to put up a big retail shop, a salon and kinyozi (barber shop). However, Peter says he faces the challenge of natural disasters and lack of enough farm input for production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Neil

texts.en: Neil A. is from the village of Mangcuram. He is 41 years old. Neil is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Neil raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Neil has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) during the harvest season. In 2010, Neil joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Neil has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Neil is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Neil from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Margilyn

texts.en:
Margilyn G. is from the village of Tumbao, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 35 years old. Margilyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Margilyn owns & operates a business running a food stall, selling a variety of food products in the local community. Margilyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Margilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Margilyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients needed. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Margilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients needed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Robert Jedi

texts.es:
Robert vive en la zona de Villa Fátima de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es soltero.
El cliente trabaja como empleado en una empresa de seguros y reaseguros, y también realiza trabajos de contabilidad ( balances de apertura, impuestos y otros) 
El crédito solicitado será para el pago de su proyecto de grado, pago de fotocopias, empastados, y tramites de documentos personales.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita el crédito y la tercera vez que requiere el apoyo de kiva.
texts.en:
Robert lives in the Villa Fatima neighborhood of La Paz. He is single. He works for an insurance company. He also works as an accountant (bookkeeping, taxes, etc.). He is applying for a loan to pay the costs of his degree work, photocopies, book bindings and costs associated with obtaining the necessary documentation. This is the fourth time that Robert has applied for a loan and the third time that he's relied on support from Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fees for completing degree work.

loans.name: Nora Milagros

texts.es:
Nora tiene 31 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el sector El Marco del distrito de Jayanca, un distrito agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo y que se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo y de productos de primera necesidad en una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. El negocio le provee a sus vecinos de diversos productos que se necesitan diariamente y que suelen ser de difícil acceso dada la lejanía de la zona del pueblo central. Con estos ingresos apoya a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Nora desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos y de más carne de pollo, de modo que sus ventas puedan ampliarse y pueda percibir un mayor número de ganancias. Por ello ha decidido solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante conocida y estimada en la zona donde vive, sus vecinos la consideran una persona responsable y confiable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir contribuyendo al desarrollo de su familia.
texts.en:
Nora is 31 years old and lives with her husband and their 2 children in the El Marco sector of Jayanca district, an agricultural region in the province of Chiclayo, located 1 ½ hours from the city of Chiclayo. Nora sells chicken and products of primary necessity in a small general store installed in her home. The business provides her neighbors with diverse products needed daily that are difficult to get so far from the central zone of the city. With this income she helps her husband sustain the family economy. Nora wants to expand her business by buying more products and more chicken, so that the business can grow and she can gain more earnings. For this purpose, she has decided to request from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time a loan of 800 new sols to help her achieve her objective. Nora is quite well-known and an esteemed woman in the zone where she lives. Her neighbors consider her a responsible and trustworthy person. Nora's major wish is to continue contributing to her family's development.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CHICKEN AND PRODUCTS OF PRIMARY NECESSITY TO EXPAND THE STORE IN HER HOUSE

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is married. He and his wife have four children who go to school.

Antony was introduced to KADET LTD by existing customers and he is servicing a second loan in KADET. He is not in any other Micro-finance. He has been in the farming business for four years. He will use the loan to increase the number of broiler chickens on his farm. He sells the broiler chickens in an open air market. He also gets orders from different places where he supplies his farm inputs. 

With the extra profits he will increase the number of Grade cows in the farm. Antony hopes to be able to maximize his farm income in both vegetables and animals. Antony believes he is a hardworking man.

loans.use: The loan will be used to add broilers.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 41 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su hija, su yerno y su nieto; juntos se esfuerzan para salir adelante y alcanzar el progreso. Cada día es de lucha constante para esta trabajadora mujer, pues es muy empeñosa y se dedica a la preparación de diversos bocaditos que vende al por mayor a sus clientes que con frecuencia le compran para diversos eventos sociales, ya que saben de la exquisitez y buenos precios de  su mercadería. Dice que aprendió de muy joven a combinar ingredientes y preparar diversidad de bocaditos, como empanadas, bizcotelas, piononos, sándwiches, enrollados, entre otros; y esta muy contenta ya que su hija la ayuda y juntas han logrado crecer en el negocio, y cada vez tiene más pedidos. Además se encuentra satisfecha pues las ganancias son considerables y le permiten ostentar una buena calidad de vida. Como si fuera poco también se dedica a la venta de ropa por pedido, pues tiene varias clientes que le piden con frecuencia comprar al por mayor en una gran emporio comercial de la ciudad. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio de venta de bocadillos. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Carmen tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes que le hacen falta para preparar un gran pedido que tiene de bocaditos, y espera cumplir, pues quiere aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Carmen is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her daughter, son-in-law and grandson.  They all work hard together to get ahead in life and make progress.  Every day is a constant struggle for this hard-working woman.  She is very determined and works preparing snacks which she sells wholesale to her customers who often buy them from her for different social events since they are aware of the delicacy and good prices of her goods.  She says that she learned from a very early age to combine ingredients and prepare a variety of snacks such as empanadas, bizcotelas (a type of pastry), piononos (a type of small cake), sandwiches and enrollados (roast beef rolled and stuffed with ground meat, raisins and egg).  She is very happy because her daughter helps her and together they have managed to expand the business and increase the number of orders. She is also satisfied because the profits are substantial and allow her to have a good quality of life.

As if that weren't enough, she also sells clothes to order.  She has several customers who often ask her to buy wholesale from a large commercial store in the city.  As she is an enterprising woman, in the future she is planning to expand her snack sales business.  This is the first loan which she has had with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner as she does not want to give a bad impression to the people who made this loan possible as it will allow her to continue working in search of progress.  Carmen plans to invest the loan which she is requesting in the purchase of ingredients which she needs to prepare a large order for snacks which she has.  She hopes to fulfil this order because she wants to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare more snacks

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es: Jacinta  tiene 55 años, es viuda, vive con sus 2  hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a L. agricultura y a L. crianza D. animales como vacas cerdos y ovejas que tiene en su establo, por lo que sus hijos L. ayudan en esta actividad que diariamente desarrolL.. L. venta D. animales lo hace periódicamente ya que le trae mejores ganancias que L. agricultura, es por ello que mientras espera el tiempo D. cosecha, que demora 6 meses, L. venta D. animales cubre sus necesidades económicas. Sin embargo los cambios climáticos, han perjudicado L. mayoría D. veces su cosecha, es por tal razón que desea incrementar L. cantidad D. animales que posee. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que será muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. sacos D. abono para L. siguiente siembra D. papa, maíz y alfalfa.
texts.en:
Jacinta is 55 years old and a widow.  She lives in her own house with her 2 children.  She has worked in agriculture and has raised animals like cows, pigs and sheep her whole life.  Her children help her daily with her work.  Periodically, she sells her animals since she earns more doing this than in agriculture. While she waits for harvest time, about a 6 month period, her animal sales cover her necessary expenses.  However, climate changes have hurt the majority of harvest times and for this reason that she wants to increase the number of animals that she has.  

This is her first loan with MFP and it gives her peace of mind to know that she has financial support.  In addition, she is grateful to be a part of her communal bank because she knows that all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  She is also grateful to all the people who will help to make this loan possible as it will be invaluable for the advancement of her business.  With the loan that she is requesting she will buy sacks of fertilizer for her next planting of potatoes, corn and alfalfa.

loans.use: To purchase bags of fertilizer to ensure a good potato, corn and alfalfa crop

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es: Georgina tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas D. 4 años, Georgina se ha dedicado a vender cosméticos D. diversas marcas, reconocidas en el mercado, desD. entonces ofrece productos para el cabello, maquillaje, y cremas, esto D. acuerdo al pedido del cliente. Su estilo D. venta es dejar la mercadería a crédito, sin embargo es agotador cuando tiene que salir a la casa D. sus clientes ha realizar las respectivas cobranzas, sabe que es parte del sacrifico y esfuerzo del trabajo, pero vale la pena ya que al final ve las ganancias que recibe y eso le hace sentir satisfecha con la actividad que realiza. Para ella lo más importante, son sus hijos, por lo que espera poder ayudarlos en la culminación D. sus estudios. Ahora continuará esforzándose en la venta D. cosméticos con miras a  incrementar más su capital D. trabajo. Es crédito numero 8 con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la adquisición D. cosméticos, D. esa manera podrá cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
Georgina is fifty-one and lives with her husband and their four children in her own house.  For more than four years Georgina has earned her living selling a variety of well-known brands of cosmetics, taking orders for hair products, makeup, and creams.

Her business model involves leaving merchandise on credit. However, it's exhausting to have to go to her clients' homes to get paid.  She knows it's part of the effort and sacrifice of the job, but it's worth it since she sees the profits she brings in, so she's satisfied with what she does.  Her kids are the most important thing to her because she hopes to be able to help them complete school.

Now she plans to keep pushing herself in her cosmetics sales, with an eye toward increasing her working capital.  This will be loan number eight with MFP, and Georgina is glad to know that she's got financial support.  In addition, it's a pleasure being part of her village bank because all the members are responsible and stick together.  She appreciates all the people who will proviD. the loan she is seeking, since the loan will be a big help in her business's progress.  She plans to invest her loan in cosmetics so she can meet demand.

loans.use: Adquirir más cosméticos.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La señora Betty vive en casa de sus suegros en la zona de Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada tiene un hijo y el esposo trabaja en el interior como empleado, ella trabaja en una funeraria donde le pagan comisiones por ventas. Ella vende repuestos para movilidades en una pequeña tienda que instalo en su casa.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más repuestos para su tienda.

Es cliente antigua desde el año 2006 y paga muy bien, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Betty lives in her in-laws’ house in La Paz’s Las Lomas zone.  She’s married and has a son.  Her husband is a salaried employee in the interior of the country.  She works at a funeral parlor and is paid a commission on sales. She also sells vehicle replacement parts in a small store she set up at home.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital buying more replacement parts for her store.

She’s a longstanding client since 2006 and pays very well.  Therefore, she can access a new loan.

loans.use: To buy vehicle replacement parts.

loans.name: Yrysbu's Group

texts.en:
Yrysbu A., 58, is the leader of this group. Her husband works as a driver at a hydro-electro station. They have three sons and two daughters. In order to earn money Yrysbu breeds cattle, as they have been doing for twenty years.  In order to expand their herd, Yrysbu applied for this loan. In the future, she wants to purchase a vehicle for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Tessie Iniego's Group

texts.en:
Tessie I. is 56 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. She is from the village of Aggub, a part of the municipality of Solano, Nueva Vizcaya province on the Luzon islands. Tessie is the group leader of a thirteen-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Tessie makes and sells barbecue pork and chicken. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Tessie joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make her barbecue pork and chicken. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP that will be used for the same purpose. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her barbecue chicken and pork

loans.name: Zubaida Begum's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida Begum, 49, is the wife of N. H. and resides in a city named Kamokay in Pakistan. She has been living there with her family for 14 years. She has given birth to four children: three sons and one daughter. Her daughter is in fifth standard, while her sons help their father in his business. Zubaida prefers to stay at home and manage her responsibilities. 
  
Zubaida’s husband operates a small restaurant in the market, where he sells Punjabi foods such as nan chanay (made with chick peas and served with bread) and biryani (made with rice and chicken and served with pickle and yogurt). He has been operating this business for 12 years. He is well known among his customers and in the market for his quality of food.
  
Zubaida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy the required items such as chick peas, rice, cooking oil and spices for his restaurant business. This will help him to maintain the quality of his food, to serve more customers and to increase his income.
 
Zubaida is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Zubaida Begum.

loans.use: To buy required items for the restaurant business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair the house and provide capital for her business

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy Y., from the village of Kibaning, Kalilangan, Bukidnon, is 27 years old, married, and has four infant-aged children. To make a living, Mary Joy owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. Engaged in her business for over four years, she earns approximately 9000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Mary Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as snack foods. Mary Joy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as snack foods

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 27 years old, married, and has one child, age 3.  He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 4 years in Nyamira town, in western Kenya. His main products are tea, which he sells through the Kenya Tea Development Authority, as well as eggs and milk, which are sold locally. He also owns a shop in the same region.

Bernard has requested a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the income from this loan will be saved for his son's school fees and will also improve his family's livelihood. His major challenges have been a lack of ready markets for his products and lack of enough capital to expand his farm.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to dig a fish pond to raise fish
